story:
We did it! Thank you so much for this amazing Indiegogo campaign! You made the Sintratec 3D printer possible.


Do you think that the currently available DIY 3D printers are just too limited for your application? Let's change that! We offer you the world's first affordable laser sintering 3D printer.


Sintratec takes low-cost 3D printing to the next level

We started using low-cost 3D printers back in 2010. As engineers we were fascinated by this technology but were quickly let down by the gap between desktop 3D printers and industry 3D printers. We wanted to print usable, solid parts; not toys. Ever since then we’ve been dreaming of our own industrial laser sintering 3D printer.


But since these machines are sold at six/seven digit prices. The only way to get one, was to build one. So, three years ago, we embarked on this mission. Since then, we’ve built several prototypes, went through countless all-nighters, won the Swiss UpStart Award 2014 and are now ready to present you the Sintratec, the world’s first desktop laser sintering 3D printer.


You can make low-cost laser sintering a reality

With your help we are ready to take the Sintratec into production and deliver you a ready-to-assemble kit. By supporting this project, you’ll not only be one of the first who have ever built and used a laser sintering 3D printer, but you will also help us to bring laser sintering out of its exclusiveness to makers and developers.


Although we have developed a great machine, it's you who has the opportunity to make low-cost laser sintering a reality. Together, let’s take 3D printing to the next level.


Be a pioneer

By supporting our campaign you’ll belong to the first pioneers who have ever received, built and used a desktop laser sintering 3D printer. We put all the numbers together and decided that we need a total funding of $175k to successfully produce the first generation of Sintratec printers and ship the first units in July 2015.


Read on for more details about the Sintratec and how to get one.


Enjoy absolute freedom of form

Both filament and stereolithography 3D printers need dedicated support structures to be able to build complex forms. All too often, an object can’t even be printed in one go and needs to be divided into several parts. The Sintratec on the other hand does not need any additional support structures and can even build movable parts without issues.


Perfect for your application

Whatever parts you need for your project, the Sintratec brings your digital objects to reality better than ever. You can print functional parts for your drone or RC gadgets, bring your crazy shaped design concept to life or build a prototype of your device before putting it into production. Create a model of your architectural drawing, print a master pattern for investment casting or even use a CT scan to print out models of body parts. These are just a few applications where  laser sintering excels. What will you print with your Sintratec?


Print like the “big ones”

PA12, a Nylon, is the most commonly used plastic powder in industrial laser sintering. Even better, we are actually printing with the same quality powder used by machines which cost over $200,000. It is extremely durable, strong and at the same time flexible enough to prevent brittleness. Because the powder is sintered together, the final parts have a high mechanical load capacity in all directions and are not suffering from the weak bond between layers as is the case with filament printed parts.


Make functional parts

The laser sintering technology and the superior properties of the printing material makes it possible not only to print prototypes but also to print functional parts. This is the reason why laser sintering is widely used in the industries such as: automotive, aerospace, medical and the tooling. Take advantage of this by printing high duty objects for your projects.


The Specs

  • Compact Size: 550x530x360mm. Fits on your desk.


  • Build Volume: 130x130x130mm. Laser sintering allows you to stack objects or place them diagonally in the build volume resulting in a maximum build dimension of 225mm and thus, making the build volume quite large.


  • Diode Laser: 2300mW, blue laser. The laser is compact and comes with high quality optics. The laser light is visible, making optical adjusting safer. Laser safety glasses are included in the kit.


  • Main Print Material: Nylon PA12 Powder. Very strong and high resolution parts. Flexible if printed thin. Dark in color to better absorb the laser.


  • Heated Laser Sintering: Both with a heating coil and optical heaters. A heated build chamber opens a whole new world of 3D printing: Objects don’t have to be fixed down on a build plate as it is the case with cold laser sintering, stereolithography or filament 3D printing.


Hardware


The Sintratec is built with custom manufactured aluminum parts. Because of the heated build chamber the parts are made out of metal and fit together neatly. When you first look at and touch your Sintratec printer you will appreciate the high quality standard. We have designed the Sintratec not only to be functional but also to be straightforward to assemble and operate. For maintenance you can lift the “core” of the Sintratec out of the print chamber to get full access to all parts of the system.


Electronics

We have designed a custom electronics board from the ground up to give you a solution dedicated to laser sintering. The board features the SAM3X8E, a 32-bit MCU from ATMEL, that comes packed with our own custom firmware. Among others, the Sintratec Electronics allow:

  • Driving of all the motors necessary for printing, as well as the scanner system and the laser.

  • Controlling of the powder surface temperature using an optical heating system with infrared sensor feedback.

  • Controlling the chamber temperature using the heating coil with thermistor feedback

  • USB communication with your computer.


Software

The hardware is only one side of the coin. To allow for a good user experience, we’ve developed our own software to streamline the process from 3D file to actual print. The software reads in .STL 3D files that any 3D CAD software can export and lets you print and monitor the print.


The Perks

The prices are without any VAT or taxes your country may charge. To ship to a EU country, the USA or Canada please add USD 200. To ship to a Swiss address please add the 8% MWST, shipping costs are free.


To customers within Switzerland we offer an additional perk: Get the Sintratec fully assembled and tested, as well as delivered to your door, with a one day introduction at your place!


Limited number of printers to guarantee 1:1 support

3D printing is challenging, but all too often wrong promises are made during crowdfunding campaigns, resulting in frustrated backers and unused 3D printers. We are fully transparent and name these challenges to prevent wrong expectations.


To be able to use your Sintratec laser sintering 3D printer you need to:

  • Assemble your ready-to-assemble Sintratec kit with basic tools like Allen wrenches and screwdrivers

  • Wire the electronic components as shown in the manual

  • Calibrate the printer

  • Become familiar with our easy-to-learn software


With a limited number of Sintratec printers we are able to give you 1:1 email support and can therefore guide you through possible issues that may occur during the assembly, calibration and usage.


Furthermore, with your help we will be able to implement the features you request to make the Sintratec even better.


Where are we now and where are we going?

We have built and tested the fourth generation of Sintratec printers and the fourth generation of the Sintratec Electronics. The software is up and running. We already have fixed suppliers. What we need now is a successful crowdfunding campaign, so that we can start production.



The Team

We are three electronics engineers and share much of our background. Throughout the last few years we have been working hard and have learned a lot in the process. On the technology side Christian is responsible for the hardware, Dominik for the software and Joscha for the electronics, but we do much of the actual development and tasks, such as business development, in a collaborative process.

From left to right: Joscha Zeltner, Dominik Solenicki, Christian von Burg


Risk and Challenges

The most important thing for us is transparency, because not only do you trust us but you also enable us to bring low-cost laser sintering to the world. Like in many other crowdfunding campaigns we face key risks and challenges:

  • Hardware: Building a laser sintering 3D printer is complex and challenging. It involves the development of a whole system including software, mechanics, electronics and materials and we won’t stop to continue developing our toolchain. We have been working for the last three years on this project and have iterated through four complete prototypes along with custom electronics and the continuously improved software to produce a high quality product.


  • Supply Chain: A hardware project and its lead time is always dependent of parts availability and suppliers in general. We have experience in putting together and selling filament 3D printer kits since 2010 and have a solid network of suppliers. Suppliers and Manufacturers for the parts for the Sintratec are already fixed and wait for the final number of kits.


  • Team: A great project needs a strong team which is not only focused on its goal but also passionate and persevering. We have known each other for a long time and are working full time to fulfil our ambition of making laser sintering affordable. Should a team member be unable to continue, we can compensate.




FAQ

Do you ship to my country?

We ship to EU countries, the USA, Canada and Switzerland. If you are not living in one of those countries, you may contact us at info@sintratec.com, so we can check with our forwarding agent if an individual shipping to your country is possible.


How much does shipping cost?

Please add $200 if you are living outside of Switzerland. Shipping within Switzerland is free. You can also pick it up at our location.


Are there any additional costs involved in receiving my Sintratec?

If you are living in Switzerland, you have to add 8% VAT (MWST) for all perks except the fully assembled printer. If you are living outside of Switzerland there are no additional costs coming from us.  BUT, don’t forget to consider your local import regulations on which we don’t have any influence. We recommend to use http://www.dutycalculator.com/, where you can quickly get an overview of the involved local import duty and taxes (use “3d printer kit” in the field “product description”).


Is VAT included in the perks?

No, there is no VAT included in any perks except the fully assembled perk. See the answer above for more details.


When will the Sintratec printers be shipped?

We expect to ship the Early Bird and Batch #1 printers at the beginning of July ‘15, Batch #2 printers in August ‘15 and Holiday Special printers in September ‘15. The shipment of the assembled and tested units will individually be arranged with our backers. Check our timeline above to get further details. These dates are based on our best knowledge and calculations, but as is the case with hardware projects, delays are possible. We will be blogging about our progress to keep you up to date and allow for best transparency.


Can I get an assembled printer if I’m living outside of Switzerland?

Unfortunately, we only ship those first few assembled and tested units within Switzerland. However, local customer collection is possible.


Does the Sintratec come as a kit or fully assembled?

Apart from the limited assembled perk, the Sintratec comes as a ready-to-assemble kit. This means that you can assemble everything with basic tools like screwdrivers and wrenches. The kit comes along with a detailed manual for easy assembling. However, you will need to put in some time and effort into this kit. If you expect the printer to be plug-and-print after unboxing, this kit is not suitable for you.


What material do you use?

We are printing with an industrial grade Nylon PA12 powder. It is the same material used on expensive laser sintering 3D printers in the industry. We also successfully printed with wax powder and are actively doing research on new materials.


In what colors can you print?

All the Sintratec kits come with grey PA12 powder. Other colors are in development. The PA’s unique chemistry means the prints can easily be dyed or spray painted.


Can you print with metal powder?

No, the Sintratec is not able to print with metal powder.


Where can I get more powder?

We are going to open our online shop readily in time before the shipment of your Sintratec. You will be able to order the same material with the same high quality in our online shop. Depending on the progress of our research, new materials will also be available in our online shop.


Can I reuse the powder after printing?

Yes, with regular prints almost all of the powder can be reused after sieving. However, if you print many different parts simultaneously, we recommend to use a higher print temperature to counteract warping effects, resulting in a bit less reusable powder.


What is the retail price of the Sintratec?

We don’t have fixed retail prices yet, but it’s going to be above our lower crowdfunding prices. Because you make low-cost laser sintering possible in the first place, you get the best offer.


What is the powder going to cost?

Exact pricing is not yet fixed but you can expect the price of 1 kg to be below USD 149. One kilogram of powder is already included in each perk.


How many parts can I print with 1kg of powder?

This really depends on the objects you print with the Sintratec. To get an idea, the printed wrench weighs only 28g.


What operating system is supported by the Sintratec software?

The Sintratec software is cross-platform, running on Win, Mac and Linux. We will though only provide official support for Windows 7+ and can’t guarantee compatibility to your Mac or Linux build. Please have a look at the more detailed software requirements.


What are the requirements to operate the printer after I build it?

  • You need a ventilated room, access to running water is helpful.

  • You need some space to handle the powder, filling it into the printer and sieving it afterwards. It is advisable to wear a dust mask while handling the powder.

  • You need a computer that satisfies the Sintratec software requirements as well as an internet connection to download the software.

  • You need access to power and possibly a different power cable than the one provided if your country has special wall sockets. (You need one that fits in your countries sockets. The cable should have the “C13/14 coupler”, those are the absolute standard cables for computers and peripherals and are found in every electronics store.)


What resolution does the printer have?

Our galvo scanner system can position the laser beam with an accuracy of 16 microns on the surface of the powder. At the moment we are printing with layer heights between 100 microns and 150 microns. Keep in mind the apparent resolution is much higher compared to filament 3D printing due to the completely different process. The minimum layer height is dependable on the grain size of the powder, which is about 60 microns, with a bit of a buffer on top,.


How fast is the printer?

The speed of the laser and therefore the print time depends on your settings. You can print with laser speeds of 70-120mm/s without issues and above. The swiss army tool for example was printed in 60 minutes.


Are there any safety concerns?

Compared to toxic resins used in stereolithography the printing powder has a very low reactivity. You only need a dust mask while sieving and pouring the powder (provided with the kit). If you have to calibrate the laser spot because it’s out of focus or misaligned you need to wear the Laser Safety Glasses that come with the kit while following the calibration guide.


What are the main advantages of laser sintering compared to other 3D printing techniques?

Compared to stereolithography:

  • Significantly more durable

  • Stable when exposed to UV light

  • Freedom of form - no support structures needed

Compared to filament 3D printing:

  • Significantly more durable

  • Higher resolution

  • Freedom of form - no support structures needed


Can you send me a sample part or print my own file?

Our main priority is to ship all Sintratec printers to our backers, so we don’t have the resources to print and send you individual parts right now. However, we always need parts from different applications and fields to improve our software and printer. If you send us a sample part of your application and we decide to use it as a test part, we will happily send you the part after printing it.


How long does it take to assemble the Sintratec kit?

It will take you one to two weekends depending on how fast you work.
story_txt:
We did it! Thank you so much for this amazing Indiegogo campaign! You made the Sintratec 3D printer possible.
Do you think that the currently available DIY 3D printers are just too limited for your application? Let's change that! We offer you the world's first affordable laser sintering 3D printer.



Sintratec takes low-cost 3D printing to the next levelWe started using low-cost 3D printers back in 2010. As engineers we were fascinated by this technology but were quickly let down by the gap between desktop 3D printers and industry 3D printers. We wanted to print usable, solid parts; not toys. Ever since then we’ve been dreaming of our own industrial laser sintering 3D printer.But since these machines are sold at six/seven digit prices. The only way to get one, was to build one. So, three years ago, we embarked on this mission. Since then, we’ve built several prototypes, went through countless all-nighters, won the Swiss UpStart Award 2014 and are now ready to present you the Sintratec, the world’s first desktop laser sintering 3D printer.You can make low-cost laser sintering a realityWith your help we are ready to take the Sintratec into production and deliver you a ready-to-assemble kit. By supporting this project, you’ll not only be one of the first who have ever built and used a laser sintering 3D printer, but you will also help us to bring laser sintering out of its exclusiveness to makers and developers.Although we have developed a great machine, it's you who has the opportunity to make low-cost laser sintering a reality. Together, let’s take 3D printing to the next level.Be a pioneerBy supporting our campaign you’ll belong to the first pioneers who have ever received, built and used a desktop laser sintering 3D printer. We put all the numbers together and decided that we need a total funding of $175k to successfully produce the first generation of Sintratec printers and ship the first units in July 2015. Read on for more details about the Sintratec and how to get one.Enjoy absolute freedom of formBoth filament and stereolithography 3D printers need dedicated support structures to be able to build complex forms. All too often, an object can’t even be printed in one go and needs to be divided into several parts. The Sintratec on the other hand does not need any additional support structures and can even build movable parts without issues.Perfect for your applicationWhatever parts you need for your project, the Sintratec brings your digital objects to reality better than ever. You can print functional parts for your drone or RC gadgets, bring your crazy shaped design concept to life or build a prototype of your device before putting it into production. Create a model of your architectural drawing, print a master pattern for investment casting or even use a CT scan to print out models of body parts. These are just a few applications where  laser sintering excels. What will you print with your Sintratec?Print like the “big ones”PA12, a Nylon, is the most commonly used plastic powder in industrial laser sintering. Even better, we are actually printing with the same quality powder used by machines which cost over $200,000. It is extremely durable, strong and at the same time flexible enough to prevent brittleness. Because the powder is sintered together, the final parts have a high mechanical load capacity in all directions and are not suffering from the weak bond between layers as is the case with filament printed parts.  Make functional partsThe laser sintering technology and the superior properties of the printing material makes it possible not only to print prototypes but also to print functional parts. This is the reason why laser sintering is widely used in the industries such as: automotive, aerospace, medical and the tooling. Take advantage of this by printing high duty objects for your projects. The SpecsCompact Size: 550x530x360mm. Fits on your desk.Build Volume: 130x130x130mm. Laser sintering allows you to stack objects or place them diagonally in the build volume resulting in a maximum build dimension of 225mm and thus, making the build volume quite large. Diode Laser: 2300mW, blue laser. The laser is compact and comes with high quality optics. The laser light is visible, making optical adjusting safer. Laser safety glasses are included in the kit.Main Print Material: Nylon PA12 Powder. Very strong and high resolution parts. Flexible if printed thin. Dark in color to better absorb the laser.Heated Laser Sintering: Both with a heating coil and optical heaters. A heated build chamber opens a whole new world of 3D printing: Objects don’t have to be fixed down on a build plate as it is the case with cold laser sintering, stereolithography or filament 3D printing.HardwareThe Sintratec is built with custom manufactured aluminum parts. Because of the heated build chamber the parts are made out of metal and fit together neatly. When you first look at and touch your Sintratec printer you will appreciate the high quality standard. We have designed the Sintratec not only to be functional but also to be straightforward to assemble and operate. For maintenance you can lift the “core” of the Sintratec out of the print chamber to get full access to all parts of the system.ElectronicsWe have designed a custom electronics board from the ground up to give you a solution dedicated to laser sintering. The board features the SAM3X8E, a 32-bit MCU from ATMEL, that comes packed with our own custom firmware. Among others, the Sintratec Electronics allow:
Driving of all the motors necessary for printing, as well as the scanner system and the laser.
Controlling of the powder surface temperature using an optical heating system with infrared sensor feedback.
Controlling the chamber temperature using the heating coil with thermistor feedback
USB communication with your computer.
SoftwareThe hardware is only one side of the coin. To allow for a good user experience, we’ve developed our own software to streamline the process from 3D file to actual print. The software reads in .STL 3D files that any 3D CAD software can export and lets you print and monitor the print.The Perks


The prices are without any VAT or taxes your country may charge. To ship to a EU country, the USA or Canada please add USD 200. To ship to a Swiss address please add the 8% MWST, shipping costs are free.To customers within Switzerland we offer an additional perk: Get the Sintratec fully assembled and tested, as well as delivered to your door, with a one day introduction at your place!Limited number of printers to guarantee 1:1 support3D printing is challenging, but all too often wrong promises are made during crowdfunding campaigns, resulting in frustrated backers and unused 3D printers. We are fully transparent and name these challenges to prevent wrong expectations.To be able to use your Sintratec laser sintering 3D printer you need to:
Assemble your ready-to-assemble Sintratec kit with basic tools like Allen wrenches and screwdrivers
Wire the electronic components as shown in the manual
Calibrate the printer
Become familiar with our easy-to-learn software
With a limited number of Sintratec printers we are able to give you 1:1 email support and can therefore guide you through possible issues that may occur during the assembly, calibration and usage.Furthermore, with your help we will be able to implement the features you request to make the Sintratec even better.Where are we now and where are we going?We have built and tested the fourth generation of Sintratec printers and the fourth generation of the Sintratec Electronics. The software is up and running. We already have fixed suppliers. What we need now is a successful crowdfunding campaign, so that we can start production.The TeamWe are three electronics engineers and share much of our background. Throughout the last few years we have been working hard and have learned a lot in the process. On the technology side Christian is responsible for the hardware, Dominik for the software and Joscha for the electronics, but we do much of the actual development and tasks, such as business development, in a collaborative process. From left to right: Joscha Zeltner, Dominik Solenicki, Christian von BurgRisk and ChallengesThe most important thing for us is transparency, because not only do you trust us but you also enable us to bring low-cost laser sintering to the world. Like in many other crowdfunding campaigns we face key risks and challenges:Hardware: Building a laser sintering 3D printer is complex and challenging. It involves the development of a whole system including software, mechanics, electronics and materials and we won’t stop to continue developing our toolchain. We have been working for the last three years on this project and have iterated through four complete prototypes along with custom electronics and the continuously improved software to produce a high quality product.Supply Chain: A hardware project and its lead time is always dependent of parts availability and suppliers in general. We have experience in putting together and selling filament 3D printer kits since 2010 and have a solid network of suppliers. Suppliers and Manufacturers for the parts for the Sintratec are already fixed and wait for the final number of kits.Team: A great project needs a strong team which is not only focused on its goal but also passionate and persevering. We have known each other for a long time and are working full time to fulfil our ambition of making laser sintering affordable. Should a team member be unable to continue, we can compensate.

FAQ
Do you ship to my country?
We ship to EU countries, the USA, Canada and Switzerland. If you are not living in one of those countries, you may contact us at info@sintratec.com, so we can check with our forwarding agent if an individual shipping to your country is possible.
How much does shipping cost?
Please add $200 if you are living outside of Switzerland. Shipping within Switzerland is free. You can also pick it up at our location.
Are there any additional costs involved in receiving my Sintratec?
If you are living in Switzerland, you have to add 8% VAT (MWST) for all perks except the fully assembled printer. If you are living outside of Switzerland there are no additional costs coming from us.  BUT, don’t forget to consider your local import regulations on which we don’t have any influence. We recommend to use http://www.dutycalculator.com/, where you can quickly get an overview of the involved local import duty and taxes (use “3d printer kit” in the field “product description”).
Is VAT included in the perks?
No, there is no VAT included in any perks except the fully assembled perk. See the answer above for more details.
When will the Sintratec printers be shipped?
We expect to ship the Early Bird and Batch #1 printers at the beginning of July ‘15, Batch #2 printers in August ‘15 and Holiday Special printers in September ‘15. The shipment of the assembled and tested units will individually be arranged with our backers. Check our timeline above to get further details. These dates are based on our best knowledge and calculations, but as is the case with hardware projects, delays are possible. We will be blogging about our progress to keep you up to date and allow for best transparency. 
Can I get an assembled printer if I’m living outside of Switzerland?
Unfortunately, we only ship those first few assembled and tested units within Switzerland. However, local customer collection is possible.
Does the Sintratec come as a kit or fully assembled?
Apart from the limited assembled perk, the Sintratec comes as a ready-to-assemble kit. This means that you can assemble everything with basic tools like screwdrivers and wrenches. The kit comes along with a detailed manual for easy assembling. However, you will need to put in some time and effort into this kit. If you expect the printer to be plug-and-print after unboxing, this kit is not suitable for you.
What material do you use?
We are printing with an industrial grade Nylon PA12 powder. It is the same material used on expensive laser sintering 3D printers in the industry. We also successfully printed with wax powder and are actively doing research on new materials.
In what colors can you print?
All the Sintratec kits come with grey PA12 powder. Other colors are in development. The PA’s unique chemistry means the prints can easily be dyed or spray painted.
Can you print with metal powder?
No, the Sintratec is not able to print with metal powder.
Where can I get more powder?
We are going to open our online shop readily in time before the shipment of your Sintratec. You will be able to order the same material with the same high quality in our online shop. Depending on the progress of our research, new materials will also be available in our online shop.
Can I reuse the powder after printing?
Yes, with regular prints almost all of the powder can be reused after sieving. However, if you print many different parts simultaneously, we recommend to use a higher print temperature to counteract warping effects, resulting in a bit less reusable powder.
What is the retail price of the Sintratec?
We don’t have fixed retail prices yet, but it’s going to be above our lower crowdfunding prices. Because you make low-cost laser sintering possible in the first place, you get the best offer.
What is the powder going to cost?
Exact pricing is not yet fixed but you can expect the price of 1 kg to be below USD 149. One kilogram of powder is already included in each perk.
How many parts can I print with 1kg of powder?
This really depends on the objects you print with the Sintratec. To get an idea, the printed wrench weighs only 28g.
What operating system is supported by the Sintratec software?
The Sintratec software is cross-platform, running on Win, Mac and Linux. We will though only provide official support for Windows 7+ and can’t guarantee compatibility to your Mac or Linux build. Please have a look at the more detailed software requirements.
What are the requirements to operate the printer after I build it?

You need a ventilated room, access to running water is helpful.
You need some space to handle the powder, filling it into the printer and sieving it afterwards. It is advisable to wear a dust mask while handling the powder.
You need a computer that satisfies the Sintratec software requirements as well as an internet connection to download the software.
You need access to power and possibly a different power cable than the one provided if your country has special wall sockets. (You need one that fits in your countries sockets. The cable should have the “C13/14 coupler”, those are the absolute standard cables for computers and peripherals and are found in every electronics store.)

What resolution does the printer have?
Our galvo scanner system can position the laser beam with an accuracy of 16 microns on the surface of the powder. At the moment we are printing with layer heights between 100 microns and 150 microns. Keep in mind the apparent resolution is much higher compared to filament 3D printing due to the completely different process. The minimum layer height is dependable on the grain size of the powder, which is about 60 microns, with a bit of a buffer on top,.
How fast is the printer?
The speed of the laser and therefore the print time depends on your settings. You can print with laser speeds of 70-120mm/s without issues and above. The swiss army tool for example was printed in 60 minutes.
Are there any safety concerns?
Compared to toxic resins used in stereolithography the printing powder has a very low reactivity. You only need a dust mask while sieving and pouring the powder (provided with the kit). If you have to calibrate the laser spot because it’s out of focus or misaligned you need to wear the Laser Safety Glasses that come with the kit while following the calibration guide.
What are the main advantages of laser sintering compared to other 3D printing techniques?
Compared to stereolithography:

Significantly more durable
Stable when exposed to UV light
Freedom of form - no support structures needed

Compared to filament 3D printing:

Significantly more durable
Higher resolution
Freedom of form - no support structures needed

Can you send me a sample part or print my own file?
Our main priority is to ship all Sintratec printers to our backers, so we don’t have the resources to print and send you individual parts right now. However, we always need parts from different applications and fields to improve our software and printer. If you send us a sample part of your application and we decide to use it as a test part, we will happily send you the part after printing it.
How long does it take to assemble the Sintratec kit?
It will take you one to two weekends depending on how fast you work.

story:
Overview:

Tanuki Pocket Ninja is an 11'0"/335 cm long telescopic fly rod when it is fully extended from a  13" / 33 cm collapsed length. It weighs 2.3 oz/ 65 gram. It is based on the Japanese ancient art of fly fishing, called tenkara. Tenkara fly fishing requires just a rod line and a fly. 
Tanuki Pocket Ninja is designed and built for fly fishers who love outdoor adventure and traveling. It is pleasant to cast and fun to fish with.  It is very compact and lightweight. 
The compactness means easy to carry around and convenient to use.

Press:

 


 

Select Packages:
There are two basic rod packages: 
The Pocket Ninja Rod this package for fishers who already have all the accessories.
The Pocket Ninja Rod and Starter Kit Package includes everything thing you need to start fishing. 

 


Feedback:

 "Hey Luong... Rod performed flawlessly!!! The flex was amazing with every nuance felt from the hook set. Brought in a 13-14 inch rainbow; had great bend and control. I transferred the energy to the bottom of the rod, with a good bend and it was solid as the fish did a few feisty laps in the water, before tiring out, and I brought to net effortlessly... I loved it !!!! Yes,"  Jayms  Ramirez (a backer for project, a Professional Outdoor Adventure Guide Service and  Outdoor Photographer.)



Fly Fisher's Best Friend

If you love fly fishing, would you like to have a fly fishing rod that is ready to fish when you are, in the glove compartment of your car? Over half a century, why haven’t rod makers created one?

Flexibility is the Name of the Game

"Rod's flex" is the most frequently asked questions for Pocket Ninja when any amazed fly fishers find out it is only 13". I believe, "Flexibility is the Name of the Game for a Rod with Short Sections. " We all know that the shorter the sections are, the stiffer the rod become. For decades, fishing rod makers have been struggling to make a flexible rod with decent rod actions/flex with shorter collapsed sections that are less than 17”. We thought the solution is in the materials. We used fiberglass and carbon fiber to solve the problem. Despite the fact it has thirteen sections and is made with mixed of fiberglass and carbon fiber, it weighs less than 2.3 oz/66 gram.


Pocket Ninja is a fantastic rod fishing with Japanese fly pattern Kebari and dry fly.  It is also  an excellent rod for contact nymphing/Euro-Nymphing /Highstick Nymphing:

1. It is a very high SENSITIVITY rod which would help fisher to feel fly contact with objects in deep water. This is an additional indicator and helps fisher to feel the depth of water.

2. Designed to cast with a very fine line. The fine line would sink faster because it is less friction.

3. It is better ergonomics than Nymphing fly rod because Pocket Ninja weight only 2.2 oz /60 gram vs about 24 oz/ 680 gram of nymphing fly rod.

SENSITIVITY:

The fishing line directly connects to the rod which would help to transmit the vibration directly to the rod. A nymph fly rod, the line rests on the eyes of the rod, fishers have to depend on the visual indicator.

Secondly, it is more sensitive than a rod with a handle(grip) because Pocket Ninja does have grip.

FINE LINE:

Most of the time trout like to hang out in deep water. Casting a very fine line and small nymph, the rod requires good flexibility. I highly recommend using Nissin Pal fluorocarbon level line #2.5 or any fluorocarbon 10lb / 11 lb test. Nissin Pal is a hi-vis orange color. Fluorocarbon line is stiffer than nylon and has better a transmission property than nylon line. If you need Nissin Pal line, please let me know. I have a very limited quantity of #2.5.

ERGONOMICS:

Pocket Ninja rod's last section is swelled up so fisher would feel more comfortable than with the narrow style. The lightness of the rod would help fisher for a long day of fishing.

 

The rod Flex
Easy to cast with a good flexible rod and fun to fish with



The Starter Kit: :
rod, line, saucer line holder and 12 flies



12 flies:



 
 
 

Pocket Ninja Kit: - Everything you need to catch a fish
 

Product details:

Rod Cap


 


 

About


The Tanuki Pocket Ninja is developed by Luong Tam, a member of the Oakland, Golden Gate Angling, Long Beach and Pasadena Casting Clubs in California. They are the homes of many casting world champions and rod makers like Chris Korich, Steve Rajeff, Maxine McCormick among others and rod makers like Sage, Winston Rod, Loomis and more. He loves mountain fishing and backpacking and has been fly fishing for more than 20 years. In the last few years, he got hooked on tenkara fishing and became obsessed enough to quit his software engineering day job, devoting all his time in developing telescopic fly rods. Four years ago he started developing a short section rod for traveling and backpacking. He wanted to create something that is as convenient to use as a microwave because these days we don't have much time.

 

Risks & Challenges

Tenkara Tanuki has been around for five years now and has a good solid track record of being able to deliver superb a quality product that provides consistently high performance. Last Tanuki Ninja project was very successful and backers are very happy.

There is no risk, rods are ready to ship,  perhaps a couple of weeks' shipping delay because I may have been on the road to promote the project or the fishing clinics. Follow Facebook Tenkara Tanuki Rods for more info of rod in action. 

Developing this rod has long been in the works ( more than 3.5 years). The biggest challenge has been creating a super high-quality rod while keeping the price affordable. With a similar collapsed-length and flex of Tenryu TF39TA (a top-quality Japanese tenkara rod) model which is 0.5 oz heavier and costs $550 USD.  With the Indiegogo campaign, we will be able to bring the production cost down and pass it to everyone.

After we reach our funding goal, we will start getting the package ready and fund the accessory package. 

We are offering free lifetime warranties. – no questions asked. We strongly recommend that international backers add on the emergency kit because shipping would take time and is costly.

Other Ways You Can Help and I need your help:

  • Thank you for sharing the link to your friends to support us, 
  • Please Share

story:
Made with carbon fiber durable enough to survive the first flight on Mars, the Cnoc Trekking poles have easily repairable parts—in case you make a rough landing. They’re made in the United States with a newly developed quick lock for secure adjustment, tips that are simple to replace, and comfortable grips made of natural, compressed cork or soft EVA foam.

The Cnoc Poles are designed and built to be the last poles you will ever need to buy, ready for years of adventures with you. 

 

 

Since 2016 there has been no large-scale domestic manufacturing of trekking poles, so we had to reinvent the wheel. When looking for production partners, we wanted to source expertise and innovation from people and companies with whom we could develop strong and long-lasting relationships. 

One of the companies we found was Goodwinds Composites. They make carbon fiber tubes of such remarkable quality that NASA contracted with them to make parts for the landing gear of the Mars helicopter, scheduled to land on the Red Planet in 2021.

Why be content with average poles made of terrestrially-bound carbon fiber when you could back our Indiegogo for the ultimate trekking poles in the solar system?

Our partners are small companies, like us, that seek to create, innovate and lead the market with exciting new products. By supporting this campaign, you are supporting real factories, with real people, that will see big growth opportunities in their area.  

 

The Mars helicopter needs to survive temperatures down to -200 degrees Fahrenheit, or -129 degrees Celsius, so your trekking poles will be able to handle all four seasons on Earth. It is uncertain whether flight is even possible on Mars. The helicopter is considered a high-risk mission. Our trekking poles will take some of the risk out of your hiking by providing you with reliable landing gear in case you fall. 

 

The right to repair is not just a motto, but how we design. Though most of our parts are made by our factories, most can be replaced by off the shelf parts, especially high wear parts like tips.

Our Easy Tip solution can fit the housing of any carbide tip on the market.

 

Surprisingly light for how durable they are, The Cnoc telescopic poles are the kind that makes people say “wow” when first held. Try it yourself. 

 

No matter your pack or your adventure, the Cnoc poles will fit the side pocket of your choice when not in use, and your shelter.

 

The Cnoc Poles offer a great range of usable length, allowing everyone to use them in ease: from 71 cm to 158 cm, they offer the same durable feel.  The extra-long deployed length allows for the Cnoc Telescopic poles to support most shelters in the market. 

 

To make adjusting the Cnoc poles easy, fast and secure we took the traditional quick lock to the drawing board, remaking it into a simple, light but truly secure lock. By adding TPE on the inside of our quick locks, we are using friction rather than compression to create a secure lock.

Introducing: the Friction Quick Lock (FQL):

 

Whether you are a cork user or foam user, we have the right grips for you:

  • Long handled, comfortable compressed cork for the telescopic poles, or
  • Long handled, ultralight and soft EVA foam
  • Ultralight and soft EVA foam in a short form for our UL staff

 

We’re making two types of extremely light carbon fiber poles to fit your needs, whether you’re a thru-hiker, alpinist, or simply in need of some support while walking. Take some weight off your joints when going downhill. Give those grinding knees a rest. 

 

Designed for the ultralight hiker: extra long shafts and a simple, short handle grip make the UL Cnoc poles a truly utilitarian tool and the right solution for backcountry challenges: from holding up a mid to crossing rivers.

 

Our TELESCOPIC POLES are durable, robust and ready for some abuse. These poles are perfect for thru-hiking, long backpacking trips and for anyone who needs some extra security when they move.

 

 

We are a small team of four hikers in Portland, Oregon, creating the amazing gear that we've always wanted—but no one makes—with minimalist design, fair manufacturing, and reduced impact on the earth. We like to say, "We make gear lists come true."

Back in the spring of 2016, Gilad Nachmani was hiking in the Scottish Highlands where he broke his expensive trekking poles from a company that shall not be named near Cnoc na-Gareig (hence the name of our company). Frustrated with the idea of spending hundreds of dollars on a new pair, he set off to prove you can make trekking poles cheaper and more repairable. It’s been a long, difficult, uphill-both-ways journey to get to this point, but we made it to the end of the trail and we’re ready to bring these poles to you.

We contacted nearly a hundred factories until we found the right ones. Most refused to work with such a small company or couldn’t make what we were looking for. Part molds costing tens of thousands of dollars had to be changed and some were lost in transit. New tariffs made our trekking pole parts more expensive since our US manufacturers have to pay extra for raw materials that aren’t available within the country and they passed the higher prices to us.

The main reason we didn’t give up on the poles is sheer stubbornness and a reluctance to quit. We are doing something that no one else is doing. We’re not relying on mediocre, off the shelf parts. By backing this Indiegogo you are backing something new and revolutionary in the outdoor industry from our small but mighty company. 

 

Being a small company taking on big projects is hard and very, very expensive. We have been pouring all of the company’s revenue from the last 2 years into designing, prototyping, testing and finalizing the Cnoc Poles. Here is what it looked like so far: 

It wasn’t just the time and creative process, creating a supply chain requires heavy investment in infrastructure: molds, tooling, machinery. All this is very expensive, and we’ve been carefully and diligently funding it ourselves, but now we need your help:

Our factories have big minimum order quantity to make our bespoke, one of a kind, made in the US parts. Some parts are made by the hundreds, but some can only be made by the thousands, so in order to make one pole, we have to make thousands of parts.

 

 

 

Goodwinds Composites has humble beginnings as a retail carbon and fiberglass rod and tube supplier but now manufactures  everything from composite airplane parts to guitar truss rods. Their company motto is "excellence" - they strive for excellent products, excellent relationships, and an excellent working environment. We're proud to be working with a company that values their employees and is producing carbon fiber components with remarkable quality. 

 

Rex Plastics is a second-generation, family-owned and  operated plastic injection molding contract manufacturer founded in  1971. Whenever possible, Rex uses domestically manufactured plastics. In  the early days, their first product was an emergency vehicle antenna base. Rex Plastics have been focusing on small batch, experimental  parts, happy to test, test again and yet again to get parts just right.  Working in small batches allows Rex Plastics to make more parts and adjust material easily, it also means that they can offer their services to smaller companies that can’t afford making thousands (and sometimes  tens of thousands) of units in each production round. 

 

Founded in 1980, The Federal Group USA (TFG USA) have  been providing metal works and engineering services to every possible  industry except the outdoors. Focusing mainly on high volume auto  industry, they use any of their factories in the US or Asia to fabricate  parts from any metal in any form.This extensive experience with metal,  allowed them to really help us in finding the best materials for our  poles. Borrowing from engine valves (our Easy Tip), their in house  engineers had the knowledge and experience to dissect a part and think  about how it works, which forces applied to it and how no make it  lighter but keep it strong enough to work in the field.

 

Portland Packaging Company is a Portland  institution, serving the PNW since 1952 for packaging and shipping  supplies. Working with several mills in the Oregon and Washington area,  they offer a wide range for recycled and recyclable paper solutions.

We have been working with PPC since we started shipping our Vecto, and we are happy to be able to work with them now on designing and making packaging for our new poles.
story_txt:
Made with carbon fiber durable enough to survive the first flight on Mars, the Cnoc Trekking poles have easily repairable parts—in case you make a rough landing. They’re made in the United States with a newly developed quick lock for secure adjustment, tips that are simple to replace, and comfortable grips made of natural, compressed cork or soft EVA foam.

The Cnoc Poles are designed and built to be the last poles you will ever need to buy, ready for years of adventures with you. 

 



 

Since 2016 there has been no large-scale domestic manufacturing of trekking poles, so we had to reinvent the wheel. When looking for production partners, we wanted to source expertise and innovation from people and companies with whom we could develop strong and long-lasting relationships. 

One of the companies we found was Goodwinds Composites. They make carbon fiber tubes of such remarkable quality that NASA contracted with them to make parts for the landing gear of the Mars helicopter, scheduled to land on the Red Planet in 2021.

story:
We are Phoenix, Arizona’s newest entrepreneurial business, Cool Floater. We are passionate about launching our first product, The Cool Floater, which is a floating chlorine dispenser with a cool emoji design. We want to add fun, style and innovation to your pool and get away from boring chlorinators on the market. We have worked hard from initial prototypes, to CAD and engineering our product to make it the best it can be. The team has spent over a year in design and development on the Cool Floater. 

 

Support the Cool Floater Today!

About The Cool Floater 

The Cool Floater makes your pool cool. The new innovative design for a pool chlorine dispenser adds style to a category that is prized to grow this year as more people will be enjoying their pool this summer. The product features an innovative, easy-to-use adjustable flow control ring. The cool floater canister can hold up to 4 three-inch chlorine tablets. Cool Floater even uses a high-tech plasma treating process in the manufacturing process. 

SPECIFICATIONS

  • Holds up to four 3" chlorinating tablets
  • Utilizes innovative adjustable flow control ring 
  • Designed for ease of use

TIMELINE

Currently Working With Our Factory For Production

We have made it through the design process and have started to work with a factory on getting the product manufactured. We have invested in initial tooling for our product but still need your help to make the Cool Floater a reality. Support us today and help share our vision for the Cool Floater!

Risks and Challenges

Like all products moving into manufacturing, there can always be a delay in production. We have worked hard to find a factory that will be our partner in manufacturing and work within our schedule for launching our product. We are confident in our production times and will keep every backer of the product informed of the process.

story:
Gnarpoon

 

Since Day One

 

This was the first bike we were supposed to make.

When sitting in the woods at our local trail, this is the bike we wanted.

 

The Gnarcissist hardtail actually started as a geometry test bed for this very frame, so you know the handling is spot on.

 

Never before has one project caused us so much trouble. We had very defined traits we wanted out of this bike and we wouldn't settle for anything but perfection.

We have a workshop full of various Gnarpoons that fell short of that and were taken out in a field and shot.

 

Although it drove us crazy, it was never far from the forefront of our minds.

 

Whilst it is simple, it leaves no room for mistakes; every few millimeter tweaked, every degree altered changed something, it was like spinning plates.

A few months ago Lee solved it. We just needed the right guy to make it happen.

 

Now, after many iterations of full suspension and hardtails, and many hundreds of happy customers across the globe, we wanted to go back to our original pet project.

 

As the brand has grown, a considerable amount of sales end up being shipped to the USA and Canada, which is now by far our largest market.

One of the problems is the complexity of shipping in volume from the UK to USA. We figured if we could make and ship frames in the USA, then we could cut waiting times and costs. We just needed the right fabricator.

 

In steps Frank Walderton, AKA, Frank The Welder.

Chances are, if you rode hardcore in the early 2000s, then you would know this guy. The go-to fabricator for a number of hardcore freeride projects.

Frank has been churning out beautiful sculptured pieces for the cultured hellian from his Vermont workshop for longer than I've been alive. A decade honed skill in a machine shop crammed with various vintage and hard working contraptions. A man who shaped the industry. Talk about good timing.

 

Frank had some space in a warehouse to rent, we got chatting and naturally one thing lead to another. We had the opportunity to make Sick a transatlantic brand. A brand designed to appeal to hardcore riders, and to make and assemble complete bikes in Vermont.

 

The end goal isn’t so much the building of Gnarpoon, although it is certainly one off the bucket list, but to create a complete manufacturing and bike distribution hub in the USA.

It sounds crazy, but it’s relatively straightforward.

We have the space, we have the skills, we just need the funding and the employees.

We’re in contact with the local business development group in Vermont and we are ready to make this dream a reality.

 

So what IS Gnarpoon?

 

Simply put it's a simple yet brutal, all mountain bike ready for anything, made with care by a true craftsman, an investment and commitment to your sport.

A frame as flexible as you need it to be.

Trail Life, or Freeride Hero.

Choose 160/150 or 180/170 Builds

 

What is your ideal bike? Trail and Enduro race weapon? Freeride and Park-Bike monster? Kinda missing that old DH rig you had?

 

We offer 2 styles of build kits at 2 different price points, from a big hucking dual crown and coil sprung rig, an agile and speedy weekend warrior race bike to a nimble and affordable trail bike.

Travel is adjusted via the shock with a choice of 230 x 65 or 230 x 60 so if you change your mind down the line, the option is there.

29” or 27.5+

 

Not much more to say other than this just makes sense.

All Gnarpoon frames can take either wheel choices, or both if you're feeling spicy.

 

One Shape, Two personalities.

Real steel feel or hair trigger control.

 

We offer 2 choices of mainframe. Choose 6061-T6 Aluminum or Double butted 4130 Steel. Identical in geometry and completely interchangeable with the same rear swingarm and cable mounts.

 

It's no secret we are BIG fans of steel full suspension bikes; they are completely unmatched in terms of fatigue fighting ride and wild amounts of grip.

For some people, they prefer the precision and response of an aluminum frame.

Riders have personal preferences and we want to offer that option too, in fact we’ve too quickly become just as keen on aluminum when used the right way.

62:77 – Progressive geometry.

 

If you've not ridden a progressive geometry bike, you are in for an experience. Longer top tube, shorter stem, slacker head angle, steeper seat tube and lower centre of gravity.

 

What does all this jargon add up to? A bike that feels that you are in it, not on it.

Most test riders get the same feeling, that the bike feels like it's slowing time down. More reaction time and more focus returning faster Strava times (we've all done it, I'm not even apologising).

Stability is the key. Without a twitchy front end, you have less calculations to make, you can stay on-line easier and hit speeds you never thought possible.

In the air, the bike is balanced with the rider, leading to predictable take-offs and landings. You can pick a line through root or rock gardens rather than just hitting and hoping.

A steeper seat tube means the front wheel is planted on climbs and dropper posts means it's tucked nicely on the way back down.

Future Proofing

 

There is no point in building a bike that will become obsolete. We took onboard lots of real world rider concerns:

 

No weird standards.

 

ZS tapered headset, 31.6mm dropper post, 148 hub, 73mm threaded BB, ISCG05.

All these standards we expect not to change anytime soon.

 

Off the shelf bearings and fixtures.

 

We designed every part of the frame with simplicity in mind. The bearings and bolts found on the bike are all easily and affordably obtained.

 

Replaceable dropouts.

 

Good for damage control in the event of a bad accident, but also give you a bit of choice if new hub standards or mech mounts evolve

 

The money will fund a production run; the CNC machining, raw materials and Franks time and expertise.

If we overfund, we can include the necessary equipment and tools for complete bike assembly, refurbishment of the working space, pay for training of new staff and a provide a solid job offer giving a future for some lucky locals.

We’ve funded the R&D and prototyping out of our own savings.

Lee has put in hundreds of hours of design work optimising the choices.

Our vendors have hooked us up with amazing component deals. We are ready to rock.

 

Custom, but, not custom.

 

We wanted our production complete frames to match how our customers build there, so you can choose a coloursplash for your components, and if you wish a decal with you name, or nickname and flag will be added to the frame, we can do that. Factory AF.

Where possible we will colour match decals etc, to keep that custom shop vibe.

 

Any questions - gnarpoon@sickbicycle.co



 

Challenges

 

This whole funding process is a test, it’s a learning experience to help us overcome the challenges of opening such a challenging business. But we are ready to meet it head on.

With 10 years experience in Lean Manufacturing, meeting Franks dedication to the craft and innovation, we feel that we are ready to push this company further than anyone dared dream.

 

We are grateful for the challenges the last 2 years have provided us, it has made us very risk averse.

Our successful Sleipnir crowdfund also taught us timing and pricing, but there are very real challenges.

We’ve identified some of the key ones here, we always prepare for the worst and hope for the best, however unlikely, given our past successes.

 

Production undercosting.

 

We’ve been as careful with costout as possible including a number of scenarios, we feel confident we can absorb any undercosting by self funding.

 

Production delay / contingency

 

When you are dealing with manufacture lead production, we always build in extra weeks for delays, raw material shortages, equipment failure.

This is part of ‘on time in full planning’, should exceptional delays occur these will be communicated.

 

We have a small team that relies on hand crafted products. With that in mind there is always a human element. We could have one of the team suffer an illness or injury (we all ride bikes after all), we have taken in to account contingency planning with other in industry experts who can fill in if needed.

Of course this would be clearly communicated to all investors, and a vote be taken.  

 

Component Shortages

 

We have provisionally pre-ordered stock for these builds and there is no foreseeable delays. Should there be a delay, we will offer a partial refund or alternative component of same or greater retail value.



 

How you can help.

 

Sharing is free, we think the bikes and perks we have offered are keenly priced and reward the investment, but if you would like to support us, please consider sharing our project. On facebook, instagram, reddit, pinkbike or any forums you may lurk on. Your share could make the difference between success and failure. Reach is everything!

We took onboard lots of real world rider concerns: No weird standards. ZS tapered headset, 31.6mm dropper post, 148 hub, 73mm threaded BB, ISCG05.
All these standards we expect not to change anytime soon. Off the shelf bearings and fixtures. We designed every part of the frame with simplicity in mind. The bearings and bolts found on the bike are all easily and affordably obtained. Replaceable dropouts. Good for damage control in the event of a bad accident, but also give you a bit of choice if new hub standards or mech mounts evolve The money will fund a production run; the CNC machining, raw materials and Franks time and expertise.
If we overfund, we can include the necessary equipment and tools for complete bike assembly, refurbishment of the working space, pay for training of new staff and a provide a solid job offer giving a future for some lucky locals.
We’ve funded the R&D and prototyping out of our own savings.
Lee has put in hundreds of hours of design work optimising the choices.
Our vendors have hooked us up with amazing component deals. We are ready to rock. Custom, but, not custom. We wanted our production complete frames to match how our customers build there, so you can choose a coloursplash for your components, and if you wish a decal with you name, or nickname and flag will be added to the frame, we can do that. Factory AF.
Where possible we will colour match decals etc, to keep that custom shop vibe. Any questions - gnarpoon@sickbicycle.co
 Challenges This whole funding process is a test, it’s a learning experience to help us overcome the challenges of opening such a challenging business. But we are ready to meet it head on.
With 10 years experience in Lean Manufacturing, meeting Franks dedication to the craft and innovation, we feel that we are ready to push this company further than anyone dared dream. We are grateful for the challenges the last 2 years have provided us, it has made us very risk averse.
Our successful Sleipnir crowdfund also taught us timing and pricing, but there are very real challenges.
We’ve identified some of the key ones here, we always prepare for the worst and hope for the best, however unlikely, given our past successes. Production undercosting. We’ve been as careful with costout as possible including a number of scenarios, we feel confident we can absorb any undercosting by self funding. Production delay / contingency When you are dealing with manufacture lead production, we always build in extra weeks for delays, raw material shortages, equipment failure.
This is part of ‘on time in full planning’, should exceptional delays occur these will be communicated. We have a small team that relies on hand crafted products. With that in mind there is always a human element. We could have one of the team suffer an illness or injury (we all ride bikes after all), we have taken in to account contingency planning with other in industry experts who can fill in if needed.
Of course this would be clearly communicated to all investors, and a vote be taken.   Component Shortages We have provisionally pre-ordered stock for these builds and there is no foreseeable delays. Should there be a delay, we will offer a partial refund or alternative component of same or greater retail value.
 How you can help. Sharing is free, we think the bikes and perks we have offered are keenly priced and reward the investment, but if you would like to support us, please consider sharing our project. On facebook, instagram, reddit, pinkbike or any forums you may lurk on. Your share could make the difference between success and failure. Reach is everything!

story:
As Seen On CNBC'S New Hit Show 'Pop Up Start Up'

                           

Watch the show and support MyKoolBox!!! The six part series on CNBC International (Sky Channel 505, Free Sat 201, Virgin Media 613) on 27th January 2017 at 22.00 GMT. Check out http://www.cnbc.com/pop-up-start-up/

Meet MyKoolBox

With increasingly hot summers people require efficient cool boxes for their picnics. In most cases they also take some music play-out system and use their smart phones to find locations, chat and exchange comments with others.  

The regular sight of holiday makers heaving rucksacks, cool boxes and audio speakers like desert explorers, stomping across sand dunes, or even setting up for a party in the back garden indicates that a more integrated solution is needed.

Experience MyKoolBox

The design of MyKoolBox is focused on being smart, fun and useful. Initially there will be 3 color options: white/blue, white/pink and stretch goal Black/Orange. This is important as  MyKoolBox wants to cater for all ages and tastes. Keeping the signature box shape, handle, speaker design and connectivity panel makes MyKoolBox stand out from the crowd.

Drinks on me!!

The container handle has been ergonomically designed for comfort and the interior bucket is fully removable and watertight. The top of the box has four cup holder indentations that stabilize drinks and also act as footings for stacking more than one box. 

Rain or Shine – The Party never stops!

Located behind the control panel is the battery, amp, connectors and wires allowing for maximum use of the interior bucket volume as well as a fully removable lid. The speakers are also fully splash proof and situated high on the side of the box to protect from sand/debris (one major downside of portable Bluetooth speakers).

Be Unique, Be ‘Appy’

The audio system built into the cooler allows users to play music or use speakerphone  via Bluetooth connectivity (which 90% of smartphone’s and 100% of all tablets & computers currently have.) Song choice, volume and other amazing functions can be controlled from over 30ft (10 metres) away using our high quality Bluetooth system.  

Be in ‘Charge’ of the Party

The speaker system is powered by a rechargeable (USB) long-life battery positioned behind the panel on the side of the box. There is a 3.5mm jack point to connect headphones or non-Bluetooth mp3 players/phones so everyone can enjoy this product.

MyKoolBox - My Way!!

Customers can replace both panels with accessories and personal branding. (£79 super early bird perk and above).

 

Customizing MyKoolBox is easy. Simply look through 100's of photos from our website or even upload your own, pay through PayPal and we will send you your new panels directly to your door. In the near future you will be able to browse through our special collection of accessories such as Solar panels for charging your mobile, fishing tackle boxes, and side storage bags to really customize your MyKoolBox.

Who is MyKoolBox for?

Beach Party ...

Picnic Or BBQ ...​

Our Story.

We’ve come a long way since 2013 when we first came up with the idea to create a cool box that plays music. Since the age of 18, I have worked with young people as a holiday rep in amazing, sunny places like Spain, Greece and Mexico. 

                

I was sat with friends at a beach party in my hometown of Bournemouth, UK, when a friend came up to me cradling a blue cool box in one arm and a large work stereo in the other. First of all I thought ‘Wow! he’s carried those things miles – poor guy!’ and secondly ‘I wonder if you could put them together to make it easier??'

Later that night I trawled through the internet and found no cool boxes that played music and none that could be customized. I strongly believed there was room for improvement in the efficiency of how we hold beach parties, BBQs, picnics, gatherings or get togethers. Through combining two essential party needs: music & chilled food & drink, our lives can be kooler than ever before. 

Armed with my strong belief in this concept I have spent countless nights designing, creating multiple prototypes, testing, programming, and travelling across the globe to pitch my idea and receive feedback.

Team.

MyKoolBox Limited is made up of international superstars. We bring more than half a decade of experience from the earliest stages of prototyping, product sourcing, product development, international distribution and accounting. We have advisers who were directors of multi-million dollar companies who have expertise in shipping huge quantities of products all around the world.

                                       

What you get when backing us.  

Indegogo isn’t a store — it’s a new way for creators and audiences to work together to create things. The reward for us is that we would see the product we’ve been working on for almost 2 years finally go into production and soon be playing your favorite music!

We have rewards for you on every level of contribution. Our rewards start as low as £1 and we would love to include you in our ever-growing MyKoolBox community where you will be the first to know about our latest announcements and special offers.  

                                                

The best super early bird reward? Getting your hands on one of the very first MyKoolBox for almost 15% off the estimated retail price.  

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you don't have the funds to contribute, you can still help us!

  1. 'Like' us on Facebook/ Follow us on Twitter!
  2. Share our campaign with your friends on social media!

Thank you for showing your support.

What’s in the Box*

When you receive your MyKoolBox we’ll make sure the package contains all you need to get started. Here’s what you can expect:

  • 1x MyKoolbox
  • 2x Removable panels (special early bird and above)
  • 1x FOC App Download (subject to stretch goal being achieved)
  • 1x User manual
  • 1x USB adapter

Tech Specs:*

  • Length: 40in
  • Height: 40in
  • Width: 25in
  • Weight: 1.5kgs
  • Speaker : 2.5W x 2 / Frequency response : 100HZ- 20000HZ
  • Bluetooth Range : 10 m
  • Splashproof rating : IP54
  • 3.5mm Auxiliary jack point
  • Single charge battery life: Avg 6- 8  hours*

* Subject To Change

Manufacturing

In October of 2016 we went to China to meet some of the best audio manufacturers in the industry. We chose wisely and set them a challenge in advance; to make a prototype that would meet our high expectations on audio, construction and finish.

Since then we have worked closely with these factories to preempt and solve all challenges prior to manufacturing. We have improved the design of the handle for extra comfort, updated the speaker and Bluetooth unit, created an attractive packaging design and we have detailed specifications regarding design finish. We are perfectionists when it comes to MyKoolBox and have set up a meticulous Quality Control arrangement with the factory.

Stretch Goal Mobile App Development

Acheive £100K +

Through achievement of our stretch goal we will develop the MyKoolBox App.  We will outsource the iOS and Android mobile app development to a partner agency with extensive experience in creating hardware interaction apps. The MyKoolBox companion app will be available through free download. This will allow you to select/upload new images and photos to purchase for customization of your panels. Through partnerships with other apps there will also be additional features such as playlists, connecting multiple MyKoolBox’s together for an incredible sound, review locations, locate other parties, weather reports and karaoke.

                                       

The idea of MyKoolBox is it’s MY box – we want the user to be one with the box... stylistically, ascetically and digitally connected!  I want the app to be the brain of the box giving the user a one stop shop for all their party, vacation and customization needs.

MyKoolBox app will eventually be a free giveaway that customers will receive when they purchase their MyKoolBox via retailer or online.

Here is a hypothetical intro into each app feature if we achieve our stretch goal*…

  •  Customization & E-commerce

Customizing MyKoolBox is easy. Simply look through 100s of photos or even upload your own. Pay through PayPal and we will send you your new panels directly to your door. Remove your old panels, fit your new ones and really make MyKoolBox as individual as you are. Browse through our special collection of accessories i.e. Solar Panels for charging your mobile, fishing tackle boxes, and side storage bags to really customize your MyKoolBox.

  • Sound Settings and Bluetooth Personalisation

The MyKoolBox Equalizer is a new generation feature that will extend your sound capabilities. Use the fully customizable five – band equalizer to custom tune the sound so it’s just right for you. Need a little more bass?  Done! More highs and mids? No Problem. You set it how you like. Wireless Speaker Update and Personalize your visible Bluetooth name, language and much more…

  •  Music Download & Playlist Creator

Stream the latest music for free with MyKoolBox and discover over 12 million songs, download music to listen offline and play free radio stations directly through your MyKoolBox.

– Play new music from every genre, dance, rock, RnB, plus loads more…

– Listen offline; download any radio station including the UK Top 40 and US Billboard charts

– Create playlists and share your favorite songs and music

  •  Karaoke

 Sing & Record your performances with MyKoolBox .

Choose between 60,000+ karaoke song and sing along with YouTube and other sources curated by the MyKoolBox team. Share your videos and get fans with more than 5million members waiting to hear you sing!  Press play and follow the words on your connected device whilst the backing music is emitted from MyKoolBox!! The Perfect Party Partner!!

  • MyKoolBox Tribe Chat Function

The MyKoolBox Tribe is a fun place to chat and meet new friends chat instantly with other MyKoolBox users and invite friends and contacts from around the world.

  • Nearby Activities

In a new place The MyKoolBox feature will quickly allow you to find out information about your surroundings. MyKoolBox will identify your position and allows you to choose the nearest picnic spot, bank, petrol station, hospital, hotel, restaurant, supermarket, taxi rank and much more. Fast, easy and accurate, the interactive map will show you the way!

  • Weather

Stay connected to the latest weather forecasting with MyKoolBox 

– Immediately descriptive weather animations illustrating the weather forecast for right now, each of the next 72 hours and next 14 days.

– Easy swiping between screens for your weather details

– Forecasting for your favorite locations worldwide.

  • Reviews

Let MyKoolBox help you choose your next trip or share your experiences. With the help of the best search and review apps , weather you looking for that secret beach or wanting to review that perfect picnic spot – MyKoolBox will keep you informed and ahead of the pack.

* Subject To Change

Production Timeline.

 

 

Thank you.

We cannot thank you enough and we are sure MyKoolBox will add fun and ease to your life. 

Please share the story of MyKoolBox (www.mykoolbox.com) with your friends, family, colleagues and the rest of your network. We can only do this with your help!

Distributors.

If you would like to work with us to distribute MyKoolBox globally following successful completion of this Indegogo campaign please contact us at info@mykoolbox.com

Risks and challenges.

While manufacturing a product has become easier in today’s well-connected world, it’s still quite a complex challenge. To best prepare for the challenges ahead, we’ve partnered with supply chain and manufacturing experts and have recruited advisers who can provide expert advice and help us tackle challenges in production, engineering and retail management.

We have spent the late part of 2016 in China trying to mitigate risks, and are cooperating with several high-quality suppliers.

Still—unforeseen events happen and if delays in delivery occur we commit to being transparent about the challenges we are facing.

In order to alleviate the genuine fears of non-funding of crowdfunding products, funding for MyKoolbox is also being sought from a number of avenues including UK and EU governmental funds, seed money and other non-diluting finance, brand sponsorship's and traditional venture capital. 

We pledge to keep our backers well-informed in a timely manner throughout the entire production process and to do everything we can to deliver MyKoolBox to you as planned.
