story:
Van Tastic Awning Screens

A few months ago I acquired a preloved wide format printer for my outdoor blind business, the idea was so we could print images on our blinds for our clients, Like scenery shoots for creating a theme in cafe,  restaurants and around peoples homes.

Around the same time I needed a new awning screen for my caravan, so decided to make one at work out of our outdoor blind mesh as it is much better quality then the standard cheap shade cloth that is currently available. To take it one step further for a bit of fun we decide to try out the printer and printed an old english cottage, the print came up amazing so we welded and stitched on all the trimmings to make it suit a caravan annex awning.

Once we had the screen up in the caravan park the screen  became a major talking point and it was amazing how many people started enquiring where I purchased it from and how they could aquire one. With all the excitement I decided to put some photo's on Facebook to see what reaction I would get, it was overwhelming the amount of likes, shares and comments we received it was incredible.

 Based on the positive feedback we had received, the team at work and I decided we would make a go of this and call it Van Tastic as everyone kept saying how fantastic the screens were. We had our web consultants design a Van Tastic web page from where people can order from and supply or chose an image from the data we have arranged. 

We have been receiving orders and manufacturing with all going well, until one of the print ink heads stop working and had to be replaced which took a couple of weeks to rectify, this made me realise that if anything major ever went wrong we had no back up to keep working to provide our screens on time and provide a quality service.

This is why you are reading this, I have chosen the assist of Indiegogo and the crowding  funding concept to purchase a new printer with better technology so we can print faster whilst keeping up the quality and always have a safe backup plan.

We are seeking your assist via donations or you taking advantage of our early bird specials to be able to raise the capital required to purchase the new machine with the relevant accessories our commitment to you is to make this a real success by always producing the best quality product and service to make Van Tastic the market leaders and a house hold name in the caravan awning industry.

Thank you for any assistance you can offer and look forward to possibly service your requirements in the future.
story_txt: Van Tastic Awning ScreensA few months ago I acquired a preloved wide format printer for my outdoor blind business, the idea was so we could print images on our blinds for our clients, Like scenery shoots for creating a theme in cafe,  restaurants and around peoples homes.Around the same time I needed a new awning screen for my caravan, so decided to make one at work out of our outdoor blind mesh as it is much better quality then the standard cheap shade cloth that is currently available. To take it one step further for a bit of fun we decide to try out the printer and printed an old english cottage, the print came up amazing so we welded and stitched on all the trimmings to make it suit a caravan annex awning.Once we had the screen up in the caravan park the screen  became a major talking point and it was amazing how many people started enquiring where I purchased it from and how they could aquire one. With all the excitement I decided to put some photo's on Facebook to see what reaction I would get, it was overwhelming the amount of likes, shares and comments we received it was incredible. Based on the positive feedback we had received, the team at work and I decided we would make a go of this and call it Van Tastic as everyone kept saying how fantastic the screens were. We had our web consultants design a Van Tastic web page from where people can order from and supply or chose an image from the data we have arranged. We have been receiving orders and manufacturing with all going well, until one of the print ink heads stop working and had to be replaced which took a couple of weeks to rectify, this made me realise that if anything major ever went wrong we had no back up to keep working to provide our screens on time and provide a quality service.This is why you are reading this, I have chosen the assist of Indiegogo and the crowding  funding concept to purchase a new printer with better technology so we can print faster whilst keeping up the quality and always have a safe backup plan.We are seeking your assist via donations or you taking advantage of our early bird specials to be able to raise the capital required to purchase the new machine with the relevant accessories our commitment to you is to make this a real success by always producing the best quality product and service to make Van Tastic the market leaders and a house hold name in the caravan awning industry.Thank you for any assistance you can offer and look forward to possibly service your requirements in the future.

story:
Breathe ONCE. Roll up. Flux it!

Everybody hates blowing up anything inflatable, be it air mattresses or pool toys. We made a revolutionary new kind of air pump:

  1. Breathe once: Blow into the Fluxbag just once .
  2. Roll up: Close the Fluxbag and capture the air.
  3. Flux it: Push the air into your inflatable.

That´s it. You´ve fluxed it!

Faster & effortless inflating without electricity

The Fluxbag inflates items about twice as fast as a foot pump and is almost three times faster than using your lungs and diaphragm. It works as effortless as an electrical pump – without the need for any electricity however. Instead, the Fluxbag uses the Bernoulli effect from physics, which together with a single breath also propels the surrounding air into the 160 liters /42 gallons bag. 

Super small and lightweight

Packed up, the Fluxbag fits into the palm of a hand. With all the fittings it weighs less than 200 grams / 7 oz., not even as much as an apple. Much smaller than other pumps and perfect for packing lightly.

Connects with all kinds of valves

The Fluxbag supports 98% of valves that are commercially available. The four exchangeable nozzles fit standard pinch valves, flat valves and also screw-cap valves like those of ThermaRest™ mattresses.

Doubles as a dry bag or beach pillow

Its airtight and waterproof design allows multi-use of the Fluxbag. Put stuff in, and it becomes a sizeable dry sack. With the air outlet closed, you have a comfy lounge pillow to rest your head or back on at the beach.

In the news

What you get: Limited Edition with all the fittings

Every Fluxbag pack contains

  • Fluxbag 
  • 4x exchangeable valve adapter nozzles
  • 3x connector tubes for ThermaRest-like screw-top valves
  • Storage pouch 

Here on Indiegogo you get one the last 400 Limited Crowdfunding Edition Fluxbags with a special print. We had 1,700 of them manufactured and will not make them anymore after they´re gone.

How your Fluxbag has been made

Here is our engineering co-founder Lucas demonstrating the mass-manufactured Fluxbag in front of the workers dorm of our Dongguan factory in China. Less than two fluxes are needed to inflate that huge dolphin without any wind nor physical effort. It´s really that simple: Breathe once. Roll up. Flux it!
 
 
 
From top left clockwise: (1) Production manager Charlie, factory owner Ahto and Lucas discussing how to layout the pattern on the fabric (2) Mockup transparencies for layout fitting (3) Ahto explaining the seam seal taping machine (4) Cutting department (5) the sonotrode used to weld the boston valve onto the fabric (6) Sewing the closure incl. care instruction label (7) TPU coating for perfect and durable air impermeability (8) Color swatch samples for our custom made PA fabric and fittings for the pouch.

 

March 2017: We are shipping now!

 

Meet Team Fluxbag

Jens came up with the idea for the Fluxbag and leads the project. He currently focusses on marketing & sales. Jens has a background in Business & Economics, has founded multiple companies and used to work as a startup consultant. Here is his consulting company website and his LinkedIn.

Lucas is in charge of our design engineering and also handles our supply chain. He comes from a family of fashion designers and artists, trained as a cabinet maker and studied Architecture. Here´s his LinkedIn.

Together we set up HILFE Industries, a product accelerator, and we work full time on the Fluxbag, our first product so that there are no distractions and less risk.

Worldwide shipping with DHL

Many exciting crowdfunding projects are spoiled by high international shipping costs. To make the Fluxbag affordable & accessible for everyone we negotiated a special deal with DHL eCommerce Hong Kong and offer fast shipping worldwide. Your package will go on a plane and arrive within a few days. You will receive a tracking code.

Risks & Challenges

No significant risks and challenges any more as of 24 Jan 2017. Production of the first batch of about 2,000 Fluxbags is finished and we will begin shipping after the Chinese New Year holiday break in February.

story:
Hey Guys, thank you for visiting my Indiegogo page! I created this page to give you more information on what I'm going to be doing in Nicaragua, who I'll be going with and why I'm doing this. I love to help other people and right now is an opportunity for me to push myself further in not just making a difference in the States, but in another country as well. 

Come March 25th I will be leaving with Westside Church, which is located in Omaha, Nebraska, to go to Nicaragua. While we are there we will be serving two different communities, Santa Marta and Santa Maria, by helping with getting school supplies, building houses, implementing water solutions and more. There are over 164 families combined in these two towns. Most have no electricity and over half have no clean water to drink. They are also in dire need of medical supplies, with the only hospital in the area well over 10 miles away. Children have died because their parents were unable to get them to the hospital in time to be treated. We plan on gathering these necessary supplies and beginning the process of building health posts in both communities. There is a lot of work to be done in these two towns, but with your help we can make a difference and change the lives of the families and individuals who live in these communities for the better. 

Overall I am asking for $1400 to go on this missions trip. Half of that is going towards my plane ticket and the other is going towards food and living arrangements. To contribute your funds to this cause is as easy as hitting the pink "Contribute Now" button on the upper right-hand side of your screen. Once I reach my goal, the money I've raised will be going directly to Westside Church to pay for this Missions Trip.

It doesn't matter if you contribute $5 dollars or $500 dollars, your donation will not be overlooked. By funding me, you are providing for and blessing the families/individuals of Santa Marta and Santa Maria in Nicaragua. Spread the word and let people know that they can have the chance to make a genuine impact!!

Thank you so much for stopping by my Indiegogo page; I hope this was informative for you. (Please don't hesitate to let me know if you have any questions.)

Thank you for your donation and know that you helped to make a difference!

If you want to know more about Westside Church, the church I will be going with.  Just follow the link below to their website.  Thanks!

http://wchurch.tv/

story:
August 31st Update: 

Thank you so very much to all of our contributors that got us 69% of the way to our goal - you all are awesome!!  If you found us a little too late, please come on over to our Phase Two page where we are going for the balance ($1,575) to make the full amount.  There's a story...you'll see why we have decided to open a Phase Two campaign :)   We're over at http://igg.me/at/michaelmatlach2

About Michael Matlach

Mike is a humanitarian photographer who has spent his career exploring the world and bringing back images of its people.  His ability to interact comfortably in situations where compassion and patience is required is one of his strengths.  Some of his portfolio can be found at www.michaelmatlach.com

India holds a special place in Michael’s heart, having travelled both north and south during his dozen visits, so when he heard about Counsel to Secure Justice and it’s mission, he was compelled to act.  After spending the day with CSJ consultant, Jonathan Derby, he volunteered to give his time to document through photography and video, the challenges and victories of being an advocate for the survivors of sexual violence.


What He Needs & What You Get

Here’s where you come in – as is often the case, where volunteerism and reality collide, Mike is willing to spend the month of October in India helping document their mission, providing image and video content for their website, collateral material and possible documentary content to be used to raise awareness of their cause, but he needs your help in funding the trip.  Expenses for the airfare, lodging, food and equipment total $5,000. 

As a thank you for your generous donation, Mike is offering the following:

Ø  At the $25 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes where he serves as Art Director, so you can send e-cards to celebrate life!  With over 500 global images to choose from (many of them from India), you’ll be sure to find just the right photo, quote and music to express yourself.  More info at: www.harmonywishes.com

Ø  At the $50 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and a scarf from India which Mike will select for you while there and send with a special thank you when he returns.

Ø  At the $100 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and his fine art print “Washing in the Ganges”, a 6” x 9” image on 8.5” x 11” archival paper. Location: Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, India (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)

Ø  At the $250 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and two fine art prints “Faded Love: Man” and Faded Love: Woman”, 6” x 9” images on 8.5” x 11” archival paper.  Location: Dungapur, Rajasthan,India  (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)

Ø  At the $500 level, a 20 card pack from HarmonyWishes and his most popular image, “A View of the World”, 21” x 33” on 24” x 36” archival paper. Location: Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India  (see our gallery tab on this page for a peek at the image)

Ø  At the $1,000, THE WHOLE ENCHILADA!  HarmonyWishes 20 card pack, ALL prints from each donation level and a huge THANK YOU! 

All gifts are from the heart.  Namaste.
Note: Donations above the $5,000 goal will be given to CSJ to support their mission, so don't stop giving!!

The Impact

About CSJ: CSJ is a young organization that provides survivors of sexual violence free legal and psychosocial support throughout criminal proceedings, from when they report the abuse to police till judgment.  CSJ’s current project focuses on survivors of child sexual abuse in Delhi. CSJ advocates work on the ground—at the police station, hospitals and courts—advising government authorities on the law, supporting clients and monitoring the progress of cases.  They work with trustworthy partners to ensure clients and their families receive the care and support they need to begin healing from the trauma they have suffered. 

For a short video on CSJ, please check out the video in our Gallery tab.  Their website can be found at www.csjindia.org


The Facts and Why you should help

The need for legal support to victims of child sexual abuse is huge

·  Child sexual abuse is a serious problem in India.  53.2% of children had experienced sexual abuse; 20.9% of children had suffered severe forms of sexual abuse, including rape. These percentages are staggering when you consider India has 1.2 billion people.

·  More women and girls are coming forward to report sexual abuse in Delhi. Likely because media attention has increased after the gang rape and murder of a 23-year old physiotherapy student in December 2012, there were 1,636 rape cases registered with police in 2013, an increase of 132% from 2012 when 706 rape cases were reported.

·  Low conviction rates and delayed justice. In 2013, only 27.1% of rape cases in India ended in conviction.  A 2012 CSJ internal study revealed a 20.5% conviction rate in Delhi and criminal proceedings took an average of 28.7 months to complete. 

Victims and their families need advocates to support and fight for them during criminal proceedings, so justice and healing are possible.

You’ve read the statistics.  Now here is a snapshot of CSJ’s cases:

Our clients’ average age is 10 ½ years old. We represent ten clients who are six years old and younger.  Two clients are one year old.  We have four gang-rape cases, nine incest cases, one client who has a mental disability, one client who is blind and one who is deaf and mute.  While their stories are disturbing, their vulnerability demonstrates the critical need for CSJ’s legal and psychosocial services.

Your money will help us share their stories and give them support

“Your presence gave me strength,” Rekha (name changed to protect identity) told CSJ lawyer Eliza Rumthao after she effectively testified against her abuser.  In a basic sense, Rekha’s words illustrate what CSJ does: we support our clients in times of their greatest darkness.  


Risks & Challenges

The challenge of the cultural sensitivities surrounding the topic of sexual violence in India is foremost in everyone's mind.  It's a topic that can be deeply shocking and can illicit deep grief and anger.  The combination of CSJ's experience in advocacy and Mike's genuine compassion will be a formidable force for good!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand if your heart is bigger than your wallet, so if you can’t donate, we’d appreciate you sending out this message to your circle of friends via email, social media or word of mouth. 

    “ Never doubt that a small group of committed citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has.” ~ Margaret Mead


    Blessings,
    Mike and the CSJ team

story:
The youth travel segment make up 20% of the travel market and spend $165 USD annually (StayWyse 2013). These travellers have been shown to spend more money on average when they are using backpacker specific travel resources versus more traditional travel resources (USE-IT Europe survey, 2013).

The Alternative Travel Guide Ottawa features recommendations from locals for backpackers. This subgroup of travellers are looking for local experiences in the city (i.e. to do what the locals do) and the #ottawamap helps to support this. More traditional guide books focus on large tourist spots - this map offers an alternative by giving backpackers approx. 40 local recommendations about what to do in the city. This also helps to support smaller local businesses as people search for something that is 'off the beaten path'. They are also looking for information prior to their trip, the map is currently available online at http://thealternativetravelguide.org/ottawa-map/


This is a paper based foldaway map which will be distributed for free to backpackers in hostels in Ottawa, Montreal and Toronto. It is two sided and features information on what to do in Ottawa (sights, bars, restaurants, clubs and free things). There are also sections on 'How the locals live', culture, public transport, a walk and a pub crawl.

But don't just take our word for this map being great. We've printed 1,500 maps to prove the concept and here is some of the great feedback we've had so far:

From local business, The Laff: 'This is the only map of #Ottawa you'll ever need! @AltTravelGuide #OttawaIsNotBoring #backpacking #travel #beer #fun'.

From a local: 'What a fantastic idea! When I was in Europe there was a series of maps, by City Spy, like this that were very useful. When you're backpacking, often you are without an active cell phone. These maps would have local establishments, sights and tons of tongue in cheek humour. Still have mine from Prague and Amsterdam. They're useful for getting off the beaten path.'

From a traveller: 'I only went to Chez Lucien because it was on the map'.

I'm Katrina Mitchell – the founder of The Alternative Travel Guide and a backpacker. I understand the benefit of these maps as I have used similar ones in Europe. By going to businesses featured in these maps I have many great memories from cities all around the continent. I've worked in a hostel in Ottawa and I was disappointed that people were missing out on the local experience due to a lack of targeted information available to them. By presenting people with a choice of relevant things to do in the city they are more likely to go and have great experiences. I've created a similar map in Glasgow, where I used to live, and I intend to create more maps for other cities. I want people to see the alternative side of a city when they go there, make great memories and avoid the chains which you can find anywhere.


This project has been completed through a love of travel and creating great local experiences. The project team are volunteers who are passionate about travel and their city. Funds raised will go to the cost of printing 30,000 maps (enough for one year), distributing these maps and the cost of running this campaign on Indiegogo. 

Please donate to our campaign, spread our message and support the local businesses!

This also helps to support smaller local businesses as people search for something that is 'off the beaten path'. They are also looking for information prior to their trip, the map is currently available online at http://thealternativetravelguide.org/ottawa-map/This is a paper based foldaway map
which will be distributed for free to backpackers in hostels in Ottawa,
Montreal and Toronto. It is two sided and features information on
what to do in Ottawa (sights, bars, restaurants, clubs and free
things). There are also sections on 'How the locals live', culture,
public transport, a walk and a pub crawl. But don't just take our word for this
map being great. We've printed 1,500 maps to prove the concept and
here is some of the great feedback we've had so far:

From local business, The Laff: 'This
is the only map of #Ottawa you'll ever need! @AltTravelGuide
#OttawaIsNotBoring #backpacking #travel #beer #fun'.From a local: 'What a fantastic idea!
When I was in Europe there was a series of maps, by City Spy, like
this that were very useful. When
you're backpacking, often you are without an active cell phone. These
maps would have local establishments, sights and tons of tongue in
cheek humour. Still have mine from Prague and Amsterdam. They're
useful for getting off the beaten path.'
From a traveller: 'I only went to
Chez Lucien because it was on the map'.I'm Katrina Mitchell – the founder of
The Alternative Travel Guide and a backpacker. I understand the
benefit of these maps as I have used similar ones in Europe. By going
to businesses featured in these maps I have many great memories from
cities all around the continent. I've worked in a hostel in Ottawa
and I was disappointed that people were missing out on the local
experience due to a lack of targeted information available to them.
By presenting people with a choice of relevant things to do in the
city they are more likely to go and have great experiences. I've
created a similar map in Glasgow, where I used to live, and I intend
to create more maps for other cities. I want people to see the
alternative side of a city when they go there, make great memories
and avoid the chains which you can find anywhere.This project
has been completed through a love of travel and creating great local
experiences. The project team are volunteers who are passionate about
travel and their city. Funds raised will go to the cost of printing
30,000 maps (enough for one year), distributing these maps and the
cost of running this campaign on Indiegogo. 

Please donate to our campaign, spread
our message and support the local businesses!

story:
Our Adventure:

We are Manuel,  Sarah & Yvonne - an Austrian, an English and another Austrian, and we share a love of the wilderness and adventure, prepared to do crazy things, in order to keep wild places safe.

Doing The Mongol Rally seems to be suitably crazy; we're going to try to drive a small car (1.2 litre car engine is the biggest we're allowed) from Europe to Mongolia, via some wild and woolly places. We'll do this to raise funds for and awareness of the projects of SOS Children's Villages - we hope to stop off at one of their projects along the way, to see the awesome work that they do for children across the world. Manuel has worked for SOS Children's Villages and has seen first hand the work that they have done and their brilliant impact on children's lives.

We'll also be doing it for Cool Earth, a fantastic charity that protects the lives and habitats of rainforest dwelling peoples, in order to protect the rainforests themselves. My Mum works in a zoo so I have been taught all my life, and have helped Mum campaign against, the devastating effects of the loss of our forests across the globe.

We'll be using Manuel's photographic skills as well as my rusty old film making skills, to bring you images of the incredible places and people that we hope to see and meet on this (depending on how many times we get lost) 10,000 + mile / life changing journey. We're not allowed to take our car / lawn mower on the main roads, and our route will be as we decided between ourselves - so long as we reach Ulan Bator, Mongolia, so we'll be bringing you footage of places rarely seen (especially if we get lost!).

Please help us by getting involved with this adventure. As well as raising funds for our charities, there are numerous and vital things that we need in order to complete our mission.

What We Need & What You Get:

It turns out that slow travel, like driving a third of the way across the world, instead of flying, is environmentally responsible, and quite pricey. And the car breaking down, will make it reeeealllyyy slow travel.

(Thank you Tom Archer, rally survivor, for the use of the photos)

So, this trip requires a massive amount of planning. We will be driving through harsh enviroments and possibly fighting for survival so there will be many things we will need for our trip, we're raising money for tools and fan belts, the tights trick never works.. where our mechanical skills fail, we may eventually concede defeat and need an expert to help fix our car. Because we're lovely people, we don't want to be irresponsible and leave the car there, so to transport it back to Europe is a hefty bill. Visas turn out to be pretty expensive, when there are over 6 countries worth to get through! They haven't yet made petrol free, although we'll try some bartering techniques.. ahem.. and as well as the car needing fuel, we'll need a bit too. My Dad has expressed a wish to see me again so there's travel insurance to consider. See how it all builds up..

Costs of the Wacky Races here in detail:

Car = £700 (he he he - that's why we're assuming it's going to breakdown!)

Breakdowns we can't fix: £500

Pimping the car to deal with the ditches & puddles of the world, oh yes and tax and insurance = £800

Fuel (petrol & oil for 10,000 miles.. well this makes me realise how far it is!) = £1500

Shipping the car back = £1000 (we're leaving nothing behind but our footprints) 

Visas = £750 EACH! Ouch!

Food for us = £600 - we'll take a lot of pasta to cook by the side of the road!

Funds raised for our charities = a minimum of £1000 

If you can help us with anything like donations of food, equipment, tools, lodging, and anything else you can think of it would be greatly appreciated. The two easiest and fastest ways to help us make this adventure happen are to donate directly to us here on our Indiegogo page (and potentially snag youself a cool gift) and to GET THE WORD OUT! Tell everyone you know! Many hands (pockets) make light financial sacrifice...!  And then you will know that you helped us realise our dream, whilst also helping fellow human beings worldwide.

And in return for your generosity and spirit of adventure dear sponsor,

You could get one of our many perks located to the right. Personally I'd like our car to look like the real deal - no spare inch of space without someone's logo, even if you don't have a business to promote - but if you do, give us more money for an even bigger logo! Or bag yourself a gift from somewhere you're never likely to go. How about a print from one of the many incredible photos that Manuel's going to take. We would very much like this to be a team effort, in fact we can only get there with your help, so thank you.

story:
• introduction

Hi everyone My name is William Guey . I am a 14 years old boy living in Brasil, i got the idea of solar charger bag because i travel a lot and i have many problems with the battery of my cell phone and computer etc ,so i took 2 month of my vacation to design and build this solar bag. let me introduce to you !!!

===SORRY FOR THE BAD ENGLISH BECAUSE I AM BRAZILIAN===


  • About the bag

The bag have two 13cm x 18cm 4w Solar panels (26cmx18cm 8w total), and the solar bag have a 20000mAh battery that can charge 13 times iPhone 5(A iPhone have 1440mAh of battery)  

The revolution of this project is because is a truly useful solar charger , because most of solar charger in the market  only have 5cmx5cm of  Solar panels size(1w) (that needs 9 hours to charge an IPhone) ,BUT with the new solar bag you can charge a IPhone 5 (1440mAh) WITH ONLY 72 MINUTE and to fully charge the 20000mAh bag battery needs 14 hour in the sun.


You can also "close" the Solar panels when you not using it

,

(closing and opening the Solar panels)


the removable 20000mAh battery with two usb plug

(with battery our side)


the removable 20000mAh  battery 

(with battery our side)

the removable 20000mAh battery charging a phone(with battery our side)


WELL this bag is just a prototype ,the next generation much better, i will release new models( like Men or Woman's Shoulder Bag)

story:
My name is Justin and I'm excited to present Chill Charters.  I provide unforgettable boating excursions in sunny San Diego.  Thank you for taking the time to check out my campaign!

Chill Charters is set to officially launch in July.  My goal with this campaign is to provide discounted boat excursions for the people in my community, and raise funds to help cover the startup costs. There are two primary perk levels that will get you and your loved ones out on the San Diego Bay.  For any contribution under $300 I will send you a gift card that matches your contribution.  You can use this on any Chill Charters excursion in the future.  

I appreciate your support in turning this dream into a reality.  

 

Let's Go.

 

Over the past five years, while launching and growing the US program for Kiva.org, I met many entrepreneurs and involved myself in countless crowdfunding campaigns.  I coached small business owners on how to effectively engage their network, and time and time again I saw the power of crowdfunding in helping them succeed.

Now I'm doing it -- and it's actually pretty scary!  I'm hoping that this idealistic vision of community and connection and family and friends all align.  In many ways, crowdfunding is the most public way to succeed and fail.  As this gets off the ground, I feel I have the support to hit my goal -- but it's a risk and it's taking more courage than I thought.  

 

How it Started

 

When I first thought of launching a boat business it was pretty random.  It sounded like a unique way to break away from the corporate-tech hold in San Francisco -- the opposite of a desk job.  

I started to do my research.  Other charter captains liberally shared their advice, and the deeper I got the more hooked I became.  So I took the first step -- I bought a little baby boat to test the waters.

(that's my little blue boat, Kirby, there in front of all the white sail boats) 

I loved my 12 foot, flat bottomed, way too tiny boat.  It could barely handle the waters in the San Francisco Bay, if you went out with me you experienced that first hand.  It was almost laughable but I loved it.  It didn't take long before I was 100% locked on the idea.  Eventually I had to jump -- and here I am.  

 

Connections -- Memories

 

San Francisco is a beautiful city, with access to so many amazing things. I loved my time there, but the intensity of tech and its influences on the city didn't always vibe with me.  I felt a lack of connection -- phones and apps and stocks and money and more and more and more of that.  

When I was out on the boat people stopped checking their phones.  We had real conversations that were authentic.   There was a true sense of presence.  

It's the water... the ocean has a force that impacts us in a profound way.  It forces us out of the day to day mindset, it allows for reflection and perspective. The tiny boat created a special channel for me to connect with my friends.  Every boat trip turned into a memory that I cherished (shout out to all the homies who got to see it first hand!).   

I became obsessed with the concept of memories.  That was the impact I could make with this business.  Create real connection amongst friends and family -- and memories that would last forever.  That's the driving force for me.  That's my why.  

 

Where I'm At

 

In January I moved from San Francisco to San Diego to do this full time.  Over the past three months I've purchased and outfitted my boat, received my Coast Guard sanctioned captain's license, developed branding and marketing content, and figured out all the legal logistics in getting the business off the ground.  I'm finally ready for my official launch and I couldn't be more excited!

San Diego Bay is perfect.  Whether you're looking to cruise and explore or anchor and chill, it's ready for you to come enjoy.  Summer is right around the corner and there's nothing I want more than to take you out for some fun in the sun.  

On my boat I have a large tube that can fit up to four people and two stand-up paddle boards. You can also go explore the open ocean and search for seals, dolphins, and whales. Or you can find your own little cove and soak in the sun.  The San Diego skyline is beautiful and there's no better place to watch the sunset color the sky.  Bring your family, your friends, and especially your dogs!  The opportunities for fun are endless.  

With this crowdfunding campaign, I'm offering discounted boat excursions in order to get an initial injection of capital to sustain the business through the first year.  

Having more capital will allow me to better manage irregular cash flows and establish the appropriate runway to get the business off the ground.  All the funds will be used to support the month to month business costs.  This includes boat payments, docking fees, gas, maintenance, licenses, legal fees, marketing, and other business expenses.  Being able to manage cash flows and have that buffer is critical to my success.  

Here are my business plans and financial projections in case you want to learn more about what I'm doing.  I'd love to hear your thoughts, suggestions, and advice! 

 

The Perks 

 

I have three funding levels.  

1) $300 buys you three hours out on the San Diego Bay for you and 5 friends.  A $50 discount from the retail price!  You'll also get a bottle of champagne (when on the boat) and my signature Stay Positive sunglasses for everyone on board.  

2) $500 buys you one full day out on the San Diego Bay or 2 three hour excursions for you and 5 friends.  A $200 discount from the retail price!  You'll also get two bottles of champagne (when on the boat) and my signature Stay Positive sunglasses for everyone on board.

3) Any amount under $300 can be used as a gift certificate in the amount of your contribution.  This can be gifted to a friend or used on your next trip to San Diego!

Whether you are looking to relax, explore, or party (or all three!), you're going to have a blast out on the water. Let's go!

You can explore the different tours available and learn more at chillcharters.com.  

 

Peace. Love. Positivity.

Peace. Love. Positivity.

story:
Who We Are

I live in Downtown Las Vegas, and I truly love it, however, the area outside of Fremont Street has been neglected for many decades and has not received the attention that more commercial sections have. I felt that if I can do something to turn one of those dilapidated buildings in one of those forgotten corners of downtown into an artsy, fun, multi-themed hotel, that would not only be a dream come true, but help the area that I love the most in Vegas. So I bought this rotten pumpkin of a building and I'm transforming it into a magical must see destination!

 

Even though we have three operational themed rooms, significant work still remains to complete the renovation of the four unfinished units. Hired professional services from licensed contractors, painters, and craftsmen will be required to make these units fully operational.

The Range of Work Includes:

ADA Accessibility: Add ramps in concrete to existing sidewalk structure for ADA access. 

Interior Walls: Demolish sections of the interior and widen halls and doorways for ADA accessibility. Repair the remaining walls. 

Heating: Install a new HVAC

Plumbing:  Add new hot water heaters. Add in ADA accessible fixtures. 

Electrical & Lighting: Add walkway lighting for safety for our guest at night. Repair and update all electrical wiring, and switches. Provide new interior lighting fixtures. 

Cabinetry: Repair or replace existing cabinets and install new appropriate counters.

 Acquire or purchase necessary appliances and furniture to allow Clairbnb to become fully operational.The construction costs and the funds for necessary professional and technical services are too high to be paid from the revenue that Clairbnb currently generates from our three renovated rooms. 

With the help of each of you pledging we can complete this first phase in revitalizing our corner of Downtown Las Vegas, while creating a landmark to be enjoyed for years to come. Along with our crowd-funding efforts, we hope to share this opportunity, expanding an already great section of revitalized Downtown Vegas further into it's residential corridors. Clairbnb will provide a beacon and lasting presence in improving the safety, comfort and visual appeal of our historic neighborhood. 

Risks and challenges

It was a great challenge, but after many difficult months, the city of Las Vegas gave me their blessing to officially pursue this dream, by granting me one the only special licenses to do this mult-i unit themed B&B concept in Vegas, and now with everyone's help we will get to complete renovating this neglected piece of downtown historic Downtown Las Vegas. 

Renovating any project of this scope has it's share of unforeseen complications and challenges, as we've experienced over the past year. Even with a strong and diverse team, issues and risks that we do not currently anticipate could arise.

Our team is dedicated to improving Downtown Las Vegas, and has already put in over a year of time to curate the Clairbnb experience into something visitors will take back with them and relish after their stay. 

Clairbnb has taken over a year to reach this point. The funds we raise through the support of our generous backers, like yourself, will greatly shorten the time needed to complete this project. It will provide a one of a kind home away from home. 

All backers will be added to our email list and provided with pictures and updates following our progress. Thank you so much for believing in this project, supporting us, and sharing this story!

Clairbnb will provide a beacon and lasting presence in improving the safety, comfort and visual appeal of our historic neighborhood. Risks and challengesIt was a great challenge, but after many difficult months, the city of Las Vegas gave me their blessing to officially pursue this dream, by granting me one the only special licenses to do this mult-i unit themed B&B concept in Vegas, and now with everyone's help we will get to complete renovating this neglected piece of downtown historic Downtown Las Vegas. Renovating any project of this scope has it's share of unforeseen complications and challenges, as we've experienced over the past year. Even with a strong and diverse team, issues and risks that we do not currently anticipate could arise.Our team is dedicated to improving Downtown Las Vegas, and has already put in over a year of time to curate the Clairbnb experience into something visitors will take back with them and relish after their stay. Clairbnb has taken over a year to reach this point. The funds we raise through the support of our generous backers, like yourself, will greatly shorten the time needed to complete this project. It will provide a one of a kind home away from home. All backers will be added to our email list and provided with pictures and updates following our progress. Thank you so much for believing in this project, supporting us, and sharing this story!

story:
Get $10 18 in 1 Tool Card FREE - just pay $1 S & H after you share our campaign.  Click here or

just use this link: http://www.paywithapost.de/pay?id=6764b7a4-d341-4ab2-8228-e2e57483df2e  

Ninja: covert, stealth, and invisibility

The design team for Ninja Backpack is a group of college students and young professionals that wanted a minimalist and sleek backpack with hidden anti-theft features. It has to be secure and expandable for travel or every day use in the subway, on a plane or campus.

The hidden expansion bag nearly doubles the storage area when pulled out and unfolded. It is made of lightweight nylon with a zipper, and 2 hardened steel hooks with adjustable straps. 

 

The anti-theft cover keeps water and thieves out of the back zipper. 

Internal padded pocket protects both a laptop (up to 17") AND a tablet.

There is a hidden compartment with more pockets.- just unzip the 5 Pocket liner to access it.

External zippered pockets provide handy access without opening the main compartment.

USB power port - store your favorite power bank inside and connect to charge without taking it out.

Nearly one inch thick cushions lighten the load, with cool fabrics and air channels. 

What makes Ninja Backpack better:  

  • No other backpack has 3 layers: foam padding between the waterproof shell and inner nylon liner. 
  • Waterproof Oxford Canvas has a more refined look and feel than common nylon. 
  • The thick back and shoulder straps and padding, heavy duty zippers, and metal pulls.
  • Quality craftsmanship reflect the distinction from other backpacks .

Safety and convenience of strapping onto your luggage handle. 

Ninja Backpack Team - we are a group of college students and young professionals with family businesses involved in the design and manufacturing of bags, and accessories.  Therefore, it was a natural for us to draw up what we wanted and get the prototype handmade in a couple months.  We hail out of New York where we get our inspiration, and field tested the prototype for a month in December.  

This campaign will help us launch a line of high quality backpacks with the hidden expansion bag design theme.  Our results here will help us prove the market acceptance needed to get into retail outlets.  That is why we are giving such heavy discounts and FREE Shipping to you guys.

Drawings, materials swatches, and hooks - part of the design process. 

Working with our partner - our subcontractor is an OEM factory for Swiss Gear, and several quality international brands.  

Rewards $130 Retail (FREE S & H)

All Rewards will be shipped with tracking to your door starting in July.

Risks and challenges

Ninja Backpack Team - we are a group of college students and young professionals with family businesses involved in the design and manufacturing of bags, and accessories. Therefore, it was a natural for us to draw up what we wanted and get the prototype handmade in a couple months.

Working with our partner - our subcontractor is an OEM factory for Swiss Gear, and several quality international brands. They have an exceptional record within the industry and we see no problems getting the Perks delivered on time.

story:
Heath Nielsen gave me my first job working in sports and public relations as a student at Baylor. Without him taking a chance on hiring me, I wouldn't be where I am today.

On Tuesday, the Big 12 Conference fined Heath $1,000 for actions he took on his social media account during the Baylor-WVU game on Saturday afternoon.

As someone who once worked in the sports information world, salaries are not the highest and a fine of $1,000 is highly unreasonable and unwarranted by the Big 12 Conference. 

Help support Heath and Baylor Athletics by covering his fine. Any additional funds will help fund additional students workers in the Baylor Athletic Comms office.

#SicEm #BGOD #WOTS

Any additional funds will help fund additional students workers in the Baylor Athletic Comms office.#SicEm #BGOD #WOTS

story:
When you hand around, you may notice many unlocked bicycles, motorcycles, and strollers on the street. Mainly there are no portable and safe locks for them. For this, Anysafe U-lock is a good choice for you.

Anysafe U-lock has the functions of traditional lock and fingerprint lock and can be used in different use scenarios, such as bicycle locks, shop locks, door locks, and warehouse locks. This exquisite smart fingerprint lock exudes the dual charm of technology and fashion, bringing an unprecedented security experience to your life.

Anysafe U-lock is a secure fingerprint lock for daily life. It combines semiconductor fingerprint sensing technology, biotechnology, material technology, and other complex cutting-edge high-tech research and development results under the light and exquisite appearance.

In daily life, when you try to open the lock, you may not find the keys. The keys are easy to be lost and it may cause a lot of trouble after losing the keys. Unlike the traditional locks, U-lock is more convenient and safer. After a lot of trials, U-lock is here for you. It's equipped with a high-performance CPU, intelligent sensor and complex algorithm, which greatly improves the speed of fingerprint unlock and makes the finger become the real intelligent key.

The Anysafe U-lock has built-in semiconductor fingerprint sensing technology that intelligently recognizes fingerprint changes and automatically collect new fingerprint features, complement, and update fingerprint data, which can quickly identify the fingerprint changes that have been entered, even if for the kids and the elderly.

The newly upgraded intelligent learning algorithm dramatically improves the speed of fingerprint recognition and can effectively prevent the input of fake fingerprints.

 

If you unlock the bicycle when you are out, in the face of the cumbersome mechanical lock, you often need to go through the wallet, find the key, align the hole and other complicated actions. Even if it is a mechanical code lock, there are still easy to rotate errors, and even forget the password, which makes it difficult to open in a short time. And the Anysafe U-lock smart fingerprint lock can be instantly turned on with a single touch of a finger.

 

Anysafe U-lock has the current top-level touch recognition capability. In the case of traditional keys or mechanical passwords that are difficult to unlock, especially in the dark environment, Anysafe U-lock can also speed up unlocking. It is precise because of the configuration of the planetary geared motor and the high-end sensor that the unlocking speed of the fingerprint lock can respond quickly. The user does not have the trouble of aligning the keys, solves the problem that the different fingerprint angles are difficult to recognize, and makes the process of unlocking smooth as desired.

--

It is also such intimate details that the Anysafe U-lock is the only fingerprint lock on the market with a fingerprint cover. Unlike the general fingerprint lock, the Anysafe U-lock is designed with full consideration of the challenges that may be faced in different scenarios, especially when it is used outdoors, it will face rain and wind and sun. A fingerprint cover is configured.

The fingerprint cover can protect the fingerprint chip from external impact, avoid accidental touch and frequently activate the fingerprint lock, and even avoid the state of conductive activation after the fingerprint lock is accidentally touched by the rain, without these frequent accidents. The cruising ability of this lock is also greatly improved, and it can reach 2 years of standby time.

The Anysafe U-lock can also store 10 different sets of fingerprints to support 10 people unlocking at the same time. Only after recording the fingerprints for everyone who needs to use the lock, everyone can open the lock smoothly, without having to assign keys to everyone. Not only is it convenient for more people to use, but it also saves the cost of keying.

 

The whole lock is made of zinc alloy, and the high-end Q235 carbon structural steel is used in the lock body and the lock beam. It is equipped with the thickest chain on the market, safe and not easy to cut, and can even withstand 500 kg the above pull.

Anysafe U-lock has rock-solid safety performance. Even tools that deliberately use hydraulic tongs cannot be cut open, and the safety factor is extremely high.

This design not only looks high-end elegance, but also because of the high strength and toughness of the material itself, the careful design in the manufacturing process, and the strict quality control.

In order to allow users to use the traditional locks for a long time, the Anysafe U-lock has gradually transitioned to the current convenient and easy-to-use fingerprint lock. Two unlocking methods have been specially designed. The traditional unlocking method the fingerprint lock is retained so that the user can slowly change the unlocking habit. 

 

Considering the difference in the use of the scene and the outdoor environment, Anysafe U-lock is IP67 waterproof, and the fingerprint cover protects the lock, especially in the rain. 

Unlike other fingerprint locks on the market, Anysafe U-lock has long-lasting battery life. It only takes a single charge and can stand by for up to 2 years. And other fingerprint locks on the market, only up to half a year of battery life. And don't worry about the Anysafe U-lock will have no power, even if it is used frequently, it can be used for more than 1 year. In the unlikely event that there is no power, don't worry, just use the mobile power to quickly charge it.

 

 

Anysafe U-lock team members have a world-renowned college education background and have rich R&D experience in the mechanical lock industry and smart electronic equipment industry. Most of the members have served the world's leading companies and brands, and have participated in many research and development of security products that are popular in the market as a major member. They have rich experience in the development of fingerprint locks.

story:
We are enthusiastic to launch our new production of  Keelcrab Sailone 2018 with delivery starting from July. Order here on Indiegogo  to get Keelcrab OFF PRICE NOW!

 

 Who is our target ?

 

If you are a BOAT OWNER and want to order  Keelcrab Sailone for your boat, that means you have decided to simply  solve many of  all your problems and costs for the maintenance of the hull.

If you are a manager of  PORT/CLEANING SERVICE/YACHT CHARTER/RENTING BOAT service  and want to order Keelcrab Sailone, that means you can start from  DAY 1  to run a succesfull business model with all the support of our company thanks to our already tested  Keelcrab Point Platform that make you visible to your client!

 

KEELCRAB SAIL ONE: THE PRODUCT!

 

 

We design Keelcrab Sailone to create an extremely engaging and user-friendly product,  and to improve the experience of cleaning and maintaining  the  hull of your boat. Easy to use, easy to mantain! 

 

 

              


HOW TO  USE KEELCRAB?

 

VERY SIMPLE to approach at the hull! 

Keelcrab can be used by everyone. Is vacuum engine is setted so that you need just to put Keelcrab in a good position in the water and the Keelcrab  will SELF DIRECTING to the hull of the boat. Watch the video below

Keelcrab can be used by you, your son or by the person who takes care of the maintenance of your boat.  It has been developed to be an user-friendly ROV and as such it can be commanded by anyone on his own in order to perform the hull cleaning .

HOW IT WORKS!  Have a look!

 

GREAT VISIBILITY AND CONTROL !

The  remote control device with 7 inches display, the IP68 video camera with LED lights installed on the drone make the operation fun and simple.  By looking at the screen you are able to move your Keelcrab with the simple directional buttons on the remote control as well as to monitor and check the conditions of your hull in the same time. 

 

HIGH MOBILITY!

KEELCRAB is characterized by an exoskeleton in plastic material with neutral hydrostatic balance. The vacuum / aspiration force is generated by a central impeller or turbine (propeller), driven by an brushless motor, which performs the dual function of keeping the robot attached to the hull and removing algae formed thereunder. The movement is driven by rubber brushes on tracks that allow movements in all directions as you cas see in this video.

 

We have also available to complete and enhance the Keelcrab SailOne 2017, different optionals (possible to puchase also in the after market contacting us) here below visible clicking on the link. You can contact at info@keelcrab.com to order any of them. 

click here->ACCESSORIES LIST - TAKE A LOOK! 

 

 

IS IT POSSIBLE TO INTEGRATE KEELCRAB WITH OTHER ORDINARY SOLUTIONS ? 

Absolutely yes!  indeed by solving the problem acting on the effect and not on the cause, Keelcrab can be perfectly integrated OTHER SOLUTION (ultrasonic paints  or ultrasonic antifouling ) which you are already using for your boat

 

WHAT ABOUT THE  ANTI-FOULING ?

     KEELCRAB SAILONE IS COMPATIBLE WITH  ALL ANTI-FOULING PAINTS  AVAILABLE ON THE MARKET AS IT DOES NOT REMOVE ANY OF THE PAINT

 

 

 Keelcrab drone is a solution that respects the waters and the marine environment.  First of all, in order to perform efficiently its function Keelcrab is equipped with certified brushes ( soft-medium-hard ) with nylon bristles. 

Maximize the effect and duration of your paint. 

We designed 3 different brush to better fit for specfic need

Indipendent from the fact that your paint is with biocide or without, the following picture explain the 3 kind of different brush we have designed for Keelcrab SailOne

          

 

 

OUR BRUSHES ARE VERY EASY TO INSTALL!

DO IT YOURSELF!

 

 

 

The certification (A.N.C.C.P. ), obtained after several tests performed in a simulated environment , establishes that such brushes are not able to remove neither toxic fixed anti-fouling paints streched on the hulls nor the biocidal substances present in them but  just the overlying vegetation. When the vegetation begins to grow it means that the anti-foluing is losing its biocidal effect and in fact, numerous tests have demonstrated that the constant removal of the first layer of algae (3 mm) dramatically prolongs the efficiency of the anti-fouling agent making it possible to reduce the quantity used over time. As a result of that barnacles cannot form in the medium term as they don't find vegetation and then a cleaner hull allows the boat to perform better reducing on the same time the fuel consumption

  

OUR SUCCESS SO FAR!

 

"Our greater challenge is to change the mindset of many people and their beliefs!"

Fabio Terzaghi - CEO at Keelcrab

 

Here below 5 stories of our success!

 

  • Keelcab Sail One installed on Cobra 41 Sail Boat.

 

  • Mr. Bernt Fernström of the company http://dalarobatvard.se/ first importer who believed in us and our project, has obtained a 50% subsidy for the purchase of keelcrab in Sweden from Swedish Agency for Marine and Water Management since Keelcrab has been recognized as Eco-friendly investment in water quality improvement. Not only that Gothenburg University invited him on their research vessel ”Hrimfare” for using and evaluating the KeelCrab drone. They are already ten the harbours which have become Keelcrab point and have chosen Keelcrab drones for the hulls maintenance.  Soon it will be the remedy most used on our shores.                                                                                                                                       

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • Capt. Diego Comuni, currently embarked on "Xasteria" (Perini Yacht) has chosen Keelcrab for the care and maintenance of the hull.  

 

  • Our Keelcrab Point Platform in 18 months achieved the target of 16 Keelcrab Point

           

  • Our dealer network is starting to grow, including partner outside Italy such as in Spain, The Netherlands, South England, Sweden, Greece and New Zeland. 

 

 

Help us to continue in the right way!

 

ORDER NOW! 

 

 KEELCRAB SAIL ONE 

 2859 €

 Including:  

  • 1 CONTROLLER 7 inches screen
  • 1 ELECTRONIC BOX 220 VOLT
  • 20 mt cable robot  & 7 mt cable controller 
  • 1 High Resolution Board cam (700 tvl SOY CCD-EFFIO-S)
  • 2 white led (200 lumen each) 
  • 1 Nylon brush (medium) 0,35

 

PROFESSIONAL PACK 

Price: 499 euro

This reward is for who wants to start up a business with our Keelcrab!

Including:

  •  3 trolley transportation case (robot,commander and electronic box) 
  •  2 Cable extension set: 5 mt remote control cable and 10 mt cable robot
  •  1 Keelcrab bag reusable 100 times
  •  A set of 3 brushes (see picture below) 
  •   Subscription to Keelcrab Point Platform 

 

       

      THE KEELCRAB TEAM THINK BIG!

       

      Our start up derives from a strong passion for automated mechanical solutions and their business  up-scaling united with the love for sea and boats.

      We are a team of 8. We are young and able to boast a variety of excellent skills ranging from electronics to mechanical design, as well as information technology and diving.

       

                

      Our first goal was the European patent filed in Italy on 18 May 2009. Since then, the company focused all its energy on product research and development. With an high quality Italian design imprint we developed and manufactured  Keelcrab, a  custom-built underwater vehicles for the maintenance of your hull.

      The team can now boast a high specialization in modern construction techniques, a strong engagement in on-going research and development, a flexible approach to customization according to the customer’s needs and an efficient service and post-sales customer care.

               

               

               

       

       

      click here 

      FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTION

The certification (A.N.C.C.P. ), obtained after several tests performed in a simulated environment , establishes that such brushes are not able to remove neither toxic fixed anti-fouling paints streched on the hulls nor the biocidal substances present in them but  just the overlying vegetation. When the vegetation begins to grow it means that the anti-foluing is losing its biocidal effect and in fact, numerous tests have demonstrated that the constant removal of the first layer of algae (3 mm) dramatically prolongs the efficiency of the anti-fouling agent making it possible to reduce the quantity used over time. As a result of that barnacles cannot form in the medium term as they don't find vegetation and then a cleaner hull allows the boat to perform better reducing on the same time the fuel consumption
  
OUR SUCCESS SO FAR!
 
"Our greater challenge is to change the mindset of many people and their beliefs!" 
Fabio Terzaghi - CEO at Keelcrab
 
Here below 5 stories of our success!
 
Keelcab Sail One installed on Cobra 41 Sail Boat.

 
Mr. Bernt Fernström of the company http://dalarobatvard.se/ first importer who believed in us and our project, has obtained a 50% subsidy for the purchase of keelcrab in Sweden from Swedish Agency for Marine and Water Management since Keelcrab has been recognized as Eco-friendly investment in water quality improvement. Not only that Gothenburg University invited him on their research vessel ”Hrimfare” for using and evaluating the KeelCrab drone. They are already ten the harbours which have become Keelcrab point and have chosen Keelcrab drones for the hulls maintenance.  Soon it will be the remedy most used on our shores.                                                                                                                                       

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Capt. Diego Comuni, currently embarked on "Xasteria" (Perini Yacht) has chosen Keelcrab for the care and maintenance of the hull.  

 
Our Keelcrab Point Platform in 18 months achieved the target of 16 Keelcrab Point

           
Our dealer network is starting to grow, including partner outside Italy such as in Spain, The Netherlands, South England, Sweden, Greece and New Zeland. 


 
 
Help us to continue in the right way!
 

ORDER NOW! 
 
 KEELCRAB SAIL ONE 
 2859 €
 Including:  

1 CONTROLLER 7 inches screen
1 ELECTRONIC BOX 220 VOLT
20 mt cable robot  & 7 mt cable controller 
1 High Resolution Board cam (700 tvl SOY CCD-EFFIO-S)
2 white led (200 lumen each) 
1 Nylon brush (medium) 0,35

 
PROFESSIONAL PACK 
Price: 499 euro
This reward is for who wants to start up a business with our Keelcrab!
Including:

 3 trolley transportation case (robot,commander and electronic box) 
 2 Cable extension set: 5 mt remote control cable and 10 mt cable robot
 1 Keelcrab bag reusable 100 times
 A set of 3 brushes (see picture below) 
  Subscription to Keelcrab Point Platform 


 




 
THE KEELCRAB TEAM THINK BIG!
 
Our start up derives from a strong passion for automated mechanical solutions and their business  up-scaling united with the love for sea and boats.
We are a team of 8. We are young and able to boast a variety of excellent skills ranging from electronics to mechanical design, as well as information technology and diving.
 
          
Our first goal was the European patent filed in Italy on 18 May 2009. Since then, the company focused all its energy on product research and development. With an high quality Italian design imprint we developed and manufactured  Keelcrab, a  custom-built underwater vehicles for the maintenance of your hull.
The team can now boast a high specialization in modern construction techniques, a strong engagement in on-going research and development, a flexible approach to customization according to the customer’s needs and an efficient service and post-sales customer care.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTION

story:
BlinkLight is a premium led belt powered by Li-Po battery, remote controller and Arduino open source. Bike lights are engineered to be 360° visible and increase other traffic user’s attention. For day and night use. Designed to be worn on you or on a bike. From now on you don't need to take off your hands from the handlebar while making a turn. So minimalistic, so simple, so effective and so affordable!

 

 

 

 

 

Research done by the university scientists for the UK traffic police department prove that "visible does not mean recognizable” – it means that wearing any blinking colored lights does not guarantee your safety on the road. It can cause a distraction, and as a result you can be hit by another traffic user.

BlinkLights have been designed to be visible from all directions and well recognized – we used the same colors and modes of operation as in cars and motorcycles. We have combined the most modern led lights with a great visibility – we are proud of it!

 

 

 

You can wear it however you want. You can use it as a belt on your sport wear and it’s very comfy due to lightweight and elastic strips. You can put it on the rain jacket, strip it to your bag and backpack. Easy to mount to every bike. Compatible with a child seat and child bike trailer.

 

 

 

Radio operated remote controller has been designed to fit every bicycle steering bar. Remote is easy to fit. Two buttons are for operating indicators, one is for pedestrian crossing mode.

 

 

 

Currently, the best led strips on a market which allow to program every single led point separately. Best light quality during the day and at night! It will even light thru your long shirt :) Leds are protected by a silicone tube. BlinkLight is fully waterproof including remote controller.

 

 

You will get three lighting modes already installed as a standard: 

  • front white light with indicators (animated or classic blinking)
  • rear position and stop light with indicators (animated or classic blinking) both have pedestrian crossing mode
  • dynamic rainbow mode  

You can switch between those modes while turning BlinkLight on.  

 

 

Arduino compatible

We also give you the Arduino open source which is easy to program. Just plug it in to your PC and you can do everything by using C++. Every BlinkLight set will come with manual ,,How To''.

 

 

Stop light turns on automatically due to accelerometer installed on Arduino board. Our algorithm filter will know exactly when you slow down and when you speed up. Operating is very smooth and without any delays. You can count on it!

 

 

 

This function is designed to raise your safety when you want to cross the street. Just press the middle button on the remote controller and the pedestrian crossing mode is turned on.

 

 

 

One remote controller can operate five BlinkLights at a time. When you are cycling with family or friends, the leader can turn on the direction indicators simultaneously for the entire group. 

 

 

 

 

You can use two BikeLights on one bike - one on the rear with red light and one on front with white front light. Both sets can be controlled by one remote controller. Each BlinkLight can be set as a front light or break light.

 

 

 

When you run out of power just plug it in to any phone charger. You can also use any power bank and charge it while cycling. Charging time with standard 5v phone charger takes up to 20 minutes and play time is around 3-4 hours.

 

 

Adult size fits most. We will make every BlinkLight length on individual request. We will send a survey at the end of campaign. Thanks to elastic strips you can adjust it to your needs. Works with bags, backpacks, bike racks, baskets, child seats and trailers.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • 14 Days No question asked return
  • 1 Year Warranty

 

 

 

 

Our team consists of creative young people. We love developing creative ideas, and we thrive on inspiring one another. We love creating something simple but useful.

Come and help us in our adventure and become safer on the roads!

 

 

We’re a team of designers, engineers, and operational workers. We understand what goes into making this product. Our factory partners are ready to go and need a minimum financial commitment from us to get started on a larger manufacturing run. We have already produced a small sample run – and some of our lucky friends are already enjoy them. We anticipate being able to fulfill orders within around 8 weeks. If order volumes exceed our expectations, it might take slightly longer to fulfill the orders.

 

 

 

 

Credits:

  • Cyclists icons by mikicon from the Noun Project
  • Paper Airplane by George Vasjagin from the Noun Project

story:
The Project

You can make the difference and help the elderly population of Costa Rica. The Wheelchair Project Costa Rica’s goal is to empower people to fight inequality in the region helping disabled and elderly people have a better quality of life. 

This time our objective is to help part of the elderly population in Costa Rica that is left in retirement homes by their family, this for someone else to take care of their needs. More than 90% of the medical equipment used day by day in the Elderly Retirement Homes is not enough for all patients. The equipment is normally in bad shape, with rust, broken, etc. What we intend to do is to make these people’s life a little bit easier, giving them reliable medical equipment to supply their needs.

We have the opportunity to help hundreds of disabled patients that because of their age need constant medical care and attention, by giving them new and trustful equipment. We are helping also all the nurses, doctors and volunteers that fight against the lack of good and high quality medical equipment every day.

 

Who are we helping?

In this phase of the project we are trying to help more than 20 different elderly retirement homes that are with an urgent need of wheelchairs. Each one of these retirement homes have more than 25 patients to take care of, and in average each one own no more than 4 wheelchairs. The retirement homes are located in 5 provinces of the country, you can check out which ones will receive the donation in our facebook fan page.

The Goal

We need to raise a total amount of $60 000 in order to buy approximately 207 wheelchairs that will be distributed within the organizations that need them the most. This will be phase one of the whole project. After our research we found that we will need to donate more than 1000 wheelchairs to cover part of the needs of disabled population in Costa Rica.  

Outcome


Our goal is not only donate some wheelchairs to people that need them the most. The lack of medical equipment for patients in need is a regular problem in Costa Rica, and we want to stop this problem once and for all. How? We are going to donate high quality wheelchairs with a guarantee of minimum 5 years, this to ensure the next generations in need to be able to rely on secure medical equipment. 

Transparency


Our goal is to provide high quality medical equipment to patients in need. The wheelchairs we are donating are made with high durability materials. Each of them cost $290 without the sales tax. Depending how many we buy we are going to be able to negotiate a better deal and we will be able to buy more!

The Wheelchair model is: MDS806300EE

Guarantee: 5 years.

 

Perks

  • $25. Your name will be published in the project facebook fan page as a Bronze donator for the campaign.
  • $50. Your name will be published in the project facebook fan page as a silver donator for the campaign.
  • $100. Your name will be published in the project facebook fan page as a Gold donator for the campaign and and you will receive a personalized thank letter.
  • $300. Your name will be published in the project facebook fan page as a Rubi donator for the campaign and you will receive a photo from the person that received the wheelchair you donated with a personalized thank letter.
  • $900. Your name will be published in our website and facebook fan page as a Platinum donator for the campaign and you will receive a photo album showing all the donation activities.
  • $1200. Your name will be published in our website and facebook fan page as an Elite donator for the campaign and you will receive a DVD showing all the donation activities.

 

In case we don’t reach the goal in this phase one, we will donate as many wheelchairs as we can!! The funds will be used ONLY to buy wheelchairs.

We will improve the quality of life of many patients that suffer every day because of their limitations by just giving them what they need. Making them smile and feel a little bit more comfortable it’s priceless!!

Please check out our facebook fan page for real time news and information of the organizatons we are trying to help:

https://www.facebook.com/TheWheelchairProjectCR

If you have any question or concern please feel free to contact us at: info@bioledcr.com

There are many ways you can help us! Please share the campaign to all your network!

story:
Do you like to travel?

The thrill of meeting a new place, different traditions and customs... sounds, flavours and colours... making new friends and having new adventures to share.

The freedom of discovering the riches that our planet has to offer.

Freedom that should be experienced by EVERYONE!

Did you know that 15% of the world population has some kind of disability?
That’s a lot of people, who, like any of us, like to travel.

HereWeGo

HereWeGo is an Accessible Tourism platform where you can get information on accessibility of the places around you, and the opportunity to book a local host who will show the city you choose to visit in a more casual and friendlier way.

Our Goal

With HereWeGo we aim to have all the information needed for a tourist with disability in one single place. So he can have more choices when choosing his travel destination, and plan is journey comfortably.


  • Book a local host, experience adapted activities, and choose your accommodation:

  • Rent a car adapted to your needs, and some equipment that you might be in need:

A little of our history

On June 2013 we started working on one of our dreams, the HereWeGo project. We love travelling and having Luísa Aguiar’s experience on organizing travels for an inclusive dance company (whose cast consists of people with and without disabilities) was crucial. Allied with Filipe Freitas knowledge on graphic design and the sensibility on accessibility issues, HereWeGo was born during the StartWEB 2013 edition, in Funchal. The difficulty to obtain information about accessible places and how to get a different touristic approach in a city visited by a tourist with disability was the problem that we identified and proposed ourselves to offer a solution.

After 8 months of hard work developing HereWeGo into prototype phase, we knew it was time for another big challenge, so here we are… We have been selected, from almost 400 startups from 46 different countries, to participate in the Lisbon Challenge Spring’14 Edition.


Lisbon Challenge

Lisbon Challenge is a 3 months acceleration program for international startups. There will be mentors, instructors, entrepreneurs and investors who will held a number of workshops and master classes. A big opportunity for us to continue developing HereWeGo, and with passion, hard work and dedication, make it bigger.


Help us help them! Help us help you!

We believe we can improve and expand the HereWeGo platform, but for that we need your help. Our participation on Lisbon Challenge is an investment of dedication, hard work and money. 

Help us to cover some of our living and travel expenses for the duration of the program. With your donations we will also be able to pay for an extra developer so we can expand our platform, in order to include all the information we want to provide a tourist with disability.


  • 1000 EUR will be used to cover part of our travel and living expenses in Lisbon
  • 2000 EUR will be used to pay for some of the extra developing team
  • Any other amount will be invested in developing and advertising of our platform


What you'll get for helping?

Since we are good hosts we would like to offer you some traditional souvenirs from our home island, Madeira, or from the city that welcomes us, Lisbon

! This way you will get a small taste of these regions, but we hope to meet you in any of these places, or in any other accessible destination throughout the world!
