story:
Painful when sleeping on the seat especially overnight

The passenger was so painful that it take you some time to guess what he was doing.

The Sit-rest is specially designed to help people to sleep for hours in the airplane

 It is so amazing that it can provide hours of comfort continuously!

Proven comfort technologies from gadgets for retina detachment patients 

Most of the retina detachment patients need to sleep or rest face-down either on bed or seat for 24 hours a day and 7 days a week for at least several weeks. Our comfort technologies are improved based on retina detachment patients' feed back for years and so our comfort design are proved by the retina detachment patients, which is the huge difference between our product and other products. The retina detachment patients are the best judges for comfort technologies because no other people need to sleep longer than them on a seat. We have sold hundreds of gadgets to the retina detachment patients over the world.

A retina detachment patient was sleeping on a Sit-rest like headrest.

Please click here for more patients' pictures.

Lots of patient's pictures is the only trust-able proof for hours of comfort

Quotes may be fake or a picture in airplane just shows minutes of comfort. You can invite your friends easily to praise your product just because you are friends; a picture in the airplane can only shows that the actor enjoyed the comfort at the time point when he was taken a picture. We sold hundreds of gadgets to the patients. The patients shared their pictures with public only because our gadgets relieved their pains. We have showed more than 10 pictures of patients on our web page. These lung cancer patients in the picture were almost at the end of their life and so they would not lie. Why I mention these lung cancer patients because it is impossible to forge their pictures.

A lung cancer patient was sleeping on a Sit-rest like headrest

Most similar products are much much less adjustable than Sit-rest and can only fit very small portion of passengers.

Easy to use

My story

I always took the train to my university or for traveling when I was a young university student. I slept on the economy class coach seat but it was very painful to sleep on a train seat overnight and sometimes so painful that I slept under the seat by laying myself on the train floor just for comfort. I thought I never needed to sleep on the seat anymore after I found a job because I can afford a sleeper class train ticket easily. but I found myself in the same painful situation again when I took long international flights, I still needed to sleep on the seat but in a different place, the airplane. I cannot endure this pain any more and decide to invent something to help economy class passengers sleep.

I have spent more than 14 years making sit-sleeping products since I moved to New Haven, CT. The Sit-rest is not my first sit-sleeping product but an improved one over previous products. My strong recommendation: Please take this with you to the airplane if you feel uncomfortable or worse than that before boarding because a sound sleeping can help you recover quickly.

Other specs

Net weight: around 740g or 1lb 10Oz; for people with age>=10 years old. We don't have a chance to test children less than 10 years old in the airplane yet. The cover of all the cushions are velvet made of 80% cotton which is often seen in the baby cloths to protect the baby's gender skin. Final product may be a little bit different from the picture above because we are still fine-tuning the headrest.

About the reward

Every set of the Sit-rest will includes a fold-able headrest, a height-adjustable tray, a piece of anti-skid mat and a bag. The bag is easy to carry by being attached to the top of the luggage case and over the pull rods. The bag will save you from holding it in the hand or slinging it over the shoulder by attaching it on the top of the luggage case. There are some Velcro fasteners for you bind the bag over the pull rods easily in the back of the bag.

Warranty

We stand firmly behind our products. Each Sit-rest comes with a 30 day (after it is delivered) money back guarantee and 1 year limited warranty. The shipping and handling cost is not refundable.

You can invite your friends easily to praise your product just because you are friends; a picture in the airplane can only shows that the actor enjoyed the comfort at the time point when he was taken a picture. We sold hundreds of gadgets to the patients. The patients shared their pictures with public only because our gadgets relieved their pains. We have showed more than 10 pictures of patients on our web page. These lung cancer patients in the picture were almost at the end of their life and so they would not lie. Why I mention these lung cancer patients because it is impossible to forge their pictures.A lung cancer patient was sleeping on a Sit-rest like headrestMost similar products are much much less adjustable than Sit-rest and can only fit very small portion of passengers.Easy to useMy storyI always took the train to my university or for traveling when I was a young university student. I slept on the economy class coach seat but it was very painful to sleep on a train seat overnight and sometimes so painful that I slept under the seat by laying myself on the train floor just for comfort. I thought I never needed to sleep on the seat anymore after I found a job because I can afford a sleeper class train ticket easily. but I found myself in the same painful situation again when I took long international flights, I still needed to sleep on the seat but in a different place, the airplane. I cannot endure this pain any more and decide to invent something to help economy class passengers sleep.I have spent more than 14 years making sit-sleeping products since I moved to New Haven, CT. The Sit-rest is not my first sit-sleeping product but an improved one over previous products. My strong recommendation: Please take this with you to the airplane if you feel uncomfortable or worse than that before boarding because a sound sleeping can help you recover quickly.Other specsNet weight: around 740g or 1lb 10Oz; for people with age>=10 years old. We don't have a chance to test children less than 10 years old in the airplane yet. The cover of all the cushions are velvet made of 80% cotton which is often seen in the baby cloths to protect the baby's gender skin. Final product may be a little bit different from the picture above because we are still fine-tuning the headrest.About the rewardEvery set of the Sit-rest will includes a fold-able headrest, a height-adjustable tray, a piece of anti-skid mat and a bag. The bag is easy to carry by being attached to the top of the luggage case and over the pull rods. The bag will save you from holding it in the hand or slinging it over the shoulder by attaching it on the top of the luggage case. There are some Velcro fasteners for you bind the bag over the pull rods easily in the back of the bag.WarrantyWe stand firmly behind our products. Each Sit-rest comes with a 30 day (after it is delivered) money back guarantee and 1 year limited warranty. The shipping and handling cost is not refundable.

story:
You.  On the slopes.  Shredding gnar.

The Carve was designed from the snow-up to shred.  With a full-suspension frame, all-condition skis, and a tune-able ski retention system, you avid mountain bikers can hit the chutes, jumps, trees, or anything in between while improving  your mountain biking skills all winter.

 

You.  On the slopes.  Again.

Ski biking is a low-impact, lower-effort snow sport, and the Tngnt ski retention system provides an extremely predictable ride.  Adaptive riders and others with knee injuries or strength limitations will be back on the slopes in no time.

 

You.  On the slopes.  With something new.

For you season pass holders who have explored the entire mountain by the third week of the season, rediscover your home mountain all over again in a new way with a Tngnt Carve.  And everyone will be asking you where they can get one.

 

You.  On the slopes.  With your family.

Tired of sitting in the lodge while the kids are on the mountain all day?  No more.  The low-impact, lower-effort nature of the Tngnt Carve will have you enjoying more of the mountain with your family.

 

You.  On the slopes.  For your first season.

With a natural bike-like ride and motion, the Tngnt Carve has the shortest learning curve of any snow sport.  If you  are new to snow sports, you will be making turns down the mountain faster with a Tngnt ski bike.

 

You.  On the slopes.  No limits.

The best thing about the Carve is that it is whatever you need on the mountain, regardless of what level you are.  Want to go big?  You can do that on the Carve.  New to snow sports?   Learn faster.  Need low-impact?  The same full-suspension frame that allows the big hits also makes the Carve lower effort for those who want to enjoy a day on the slopes.  You.  On the slopes.  No limits.  With the Tngnt Carve.

 

Meet the founders

Founders Scott Carr and Bill Pierce are avid mountain bikers.  Both live in cold climates, and both have skied and snowboarded for years.  But going four or five months in the winter without the ability to ride their bikes was unacceptable.  By combining Scott’s vision for ski biking and Bill’s engineering skills, the result is the only cost effective, truly all-mountain ski bike – the Tngnt Carve.

 

Specs

 

"I want my two dollars!"

We appreciate your consideration of the Tngnt Ski Bikes Indiegogo campaign.  If you’re ready to buy a bike and have it in-hand before Christmas, do it!  You won’t regret it!  But we also realize that maybe ski biking isn’t for you (we’re not sure how that could be, but it IS possible).  If that’s the case, you can still help us.  Almost everyone is familiar with the Better Off Dead newspaper boy that is the OG ski biker.  In honor of him, we’ve got the "I want my two dollars!" perk.  Help us reach 1000 "I want my two dollars!" perks.  THANKS!!

story:
Featured On:

We travel all the time. In fact, 4 Billion people travel on airplane every year. Whether it’s a business trip, a long-planned family trip, or a weekend getaway, most of us needs to pack.  

Packing is a boring, time-consuming task. We all have better things to do than planning what to bring and folding everything carefully into a small bag only to be unpacked again.

Bring PAQ with you the next time you pack!

Added to the inconvenience is the concern that our stuff will not get there safely. Many of us have been there. Whether it’s a broken sunglasses or a spilled shampoo bottle, it can spoil the whole trip and makes us regret not putting more care into packing.     

Did you know that 20 million luggage are lost every year? No one knows how many more are mistreated. We’ve all heard horror stories of how our bags are thrown around, dragged and shoved into cargo. Imagine what all that would do to the stuff inside.

We roll, we fold, we bundle. We pick the smallest bag possible so that the bag is a tight fit and won’t have empty space inside for things to tumble into a big mess.  

We take precautions. placing each item into the bag with space maximization in mind. We use packing cubes and vacuum packs, wrapping anything breakable with shirts and pajamas, zip-locking all the bottles, cover our shoes with plastic bags to protect our cloths from dirt and shoeprints, etc.  

Folding, zipping, compressing, wrapping and zip-locking is not the sexiest thing to do. Plus it takes up valuable vacation time.

Some take 2 hours just to pack. My girlfriend did and we missed our flight. (A lot actually happened that day)

Some just grab everything they need and shove it all into the bag. I did, and it costs me my good camera lens.

The Game Changer  

Wouldn’t it be better if we can choose any bag we want, fill it up with everything we need, and never have to worry? No spill, no broken glass, no wrinkled cloths. PaQ lets you do exactly that, and more….

 

PAQ Protects your stuff!

 Packing with PaQ is simple;    

1. Pick a luggage  

2. Fill it with all the stuff you need  

3. Spread PaQ over the content.  

4. Press the big yellow button (or use PaQ mobile app)  

5. PaQ will auto-inflate until the bag is filled.’’

Packing with PAQ, No straps required.

 How PaQ Works  

PaQ expands and fill any remaining space inside your luggage, creating a tight cushioning fit. The tight fit that PaQ creates holds and protects everything in the bag together through bumps and swings. So, when you get to your hotel room, your stuff will also get there in one piece.

How about the return trip? When our bags are so filled with souvenirs and crumpled clothes? No worries! PaQ can be folded to as small as a rolled T-shirt to save space.  

 PaQ can be used on all sorts of bags. So, wherever you go, however you plan to get there, PaQ has got you covered.  

*PaQ helps protect your stuff inside a luggage/case.    

**PaQ keeps your duffle bag/backpack in shape all the time.  

***PaQ tracks your baggage’s whereabout and notify you.  

PaQ does all this while needing minimal input from you. Guaranteeing to save you time, protects your stuff and lets you focus on your vacation.

So, the next time you pack, just PaQ and Go

 PAQ ships with 1 year limited warranty. The warranty covers accidental damage to the PAQ bladder and and electronic malfunction. We will replace and malfunctioned PAQ Free Of Charge but will requires inspection and shipping charge on accidentally damaged PAQ.

 PaQ is powered by 2 AA batteries,    

Why not rechargeable Lithium battery you ask? Well there are two main reasons:  

1. Lithium batteries loses their charge over time and are completely drained within 3-6 months. In a time when there are dozens of things we have to recharge every night (Smartphone, smartwatches, power-bank, tablets, camera battery, another power-bank, another camera battery, a laptop, headphone, portable speaker, etc. We simply do not have enough electrical socket! PaQ can last over 2 years without needing a new battery, even if you use it every week! 

2. Lithium batteries are banned from check-in baggage. This regulation is relatively new but is starting to become international standard. The reason being that Lithium batteries (especially low-quality ones) can burst into flame. Alkaline battery, being safer, is allowed on all flights.

 PAQ x chipolo

With PAQ x chipolo add-on, you’ll be able to track the location of your luggage and be notified when your luggage is in range. This frees you from the much-hated never-ending luggage-watching crowd at the airport.  Now you can just sit back, relax, and wait for the prompt on your smartphone.

 For Business opportunities, please contact us at paqcompanion@gmail.com

More pictures for press can be found here.

Risks and challenges

We have a working prototype of PaQ with planned layout of the mobile app. 
PaQ body will be made with injection-molded ABS plastic and Inflatable PVC. The air pump is a common type compact pump reliably used in fish tanks. 
As You know, we have taken precaution not to use lithium battery in our product and so shipping them should be straightforward. 
We do not expect it to have any customs implication. 
Since anything can happen with something as new as PaQ and we are prepared to help every backer through the process and get PaQ into your hands as soon as possible.

story:
NOMATIC was born and raised in crowdfunding. In 2014 we launched the BASICS Wallet, in 2015 the BASICS Notebook and in 2016 The NOMATIC Travel Bag. Thanks to our incredible backers and supporters, over 200,000 people worldwide are now enjoying our products every day.

The NOMATIC Travel bag became the most funded travel bag in crowdfunding history. We’ve partnered with the same manufacturer and now with one successful bag under our belt, you can expect to see the same quality or better on these backpacks.  Here is what our customers are saying about our travel bag.

 

 

The NOMATIC Backpack and Travel Pack look similar to one another and share some incredible features. However, the back half of these bags were each designed specifically for its purpose, making the Backpack perfect for everyday use and the Travel Pack perfect for 1-3 day trips. First let’s go over what makes them different from each other, then we will discuss the shared features.

Outside

 

Inside 

Both Bags Provide Access From All Sides

Capacity

 Laptop Comparison 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Each Travel Pack includes a compression packing cube made of Rip-Stop Nylon to help you pack even more. The packing cube has 2 compartments, a side for clean clothes and a side for dirty clothes. Simply put in the clothes and let the zipper compress the cube down from 5 ½ inches to 3 ½ inches.  

 

The following images show the awesome features that can be found on both The NOMATIC Backpack and The NOMATIC Travel Pack. 

 

The innovative strap system adds a level of versatility to the bag that can help you look professional or escape the demands of your profession. Simply unsnap the back panel, tuck in the straps, and snap it back down to carry like a briefcase. 

  

The water bottle pocket is magnetic, it snaps shut and looks sleek when it’s not in use, and expands when you need the space.  

 

Next, we added a retractable key leash.  Easily lockup with one hand, release the key, and watch it effortlessly returns to its pocket in the bag.

   

 

  

 

 These 5 travel accessories are available now at www.nomatic.com.  However, we will offer these accessories to all backers at a discount after our campaign ends and they will ship with your Backpack or Travel Pack rewards in December.

 

 

 

 

 

 

We love creating innovative products that help people simplify, organize and improve their lives. We are so grateful to all of our backers and supporters who helped us successfully launch the Basics Wallet, Basics Notebook, and the Nomatic Travel Bag. Thanks for all of your support! 

PRODUCT WARRANTY

Here at NOMATIC, we stand behind all of our products.  If you are not 100% satisfied with the quality simply send it back and we will refund you, no questions asked.  But don't worry, we know you are going to love it!

CUSTOMS & DUTIES INFORMATION

Cannot mark as gift, this is illegal, so we will not be able to do this.

Our prices do not include VAT, GST or other country taxes.

As many of you know, our terms of sale for international orders are FOB Destination. This means that you pay all freight and duties or taxes. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location.

We found this handy tool, that can assist you in calculating duties. Remember to convert the U.S. dollars to your local currency:

http://www.dutycalculator.com/new-import-duty-and-tax-calculation

As many of you know, Canadian Customs are very strict on products imported into Canada. All products over Canadian $25 are subject to duties and GST or Vat tax. Our invoices are in U.S. dollars.

Here's a link to find the CBSA offices where you can actually go and do the clearance, and save some significant dollars:

http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/do-rb/services/lvs-efv-eng.html

SHIPPING POLICY

Within 24 hours of your order being shipped you will receive a tracking link with your shipping details. When you receive your tracking #, please keep an eye out for the package. We use a shared post shipping method to have your order delivered at an affordable price.

Your order will ship out from our shipping facility in Salt Lake City, UT with a major shipping company. Your order will be handled by UPS, USPS, or DHL up to entry of your country. Once your order enters your country your order will be handed off to your local post office for final delivery. International transit will have a 7-21 Business day delivery time. U.S Domestic shipments will take 3-5 business days.

story:
The nXtbag is a collaboration of a small group of like minded people.

It was our dream to create a bag that was not just useful and environmentally friendly but also great to look at. We combined many months of trial and error to come up with a bag perfectly sized that doesn't weight to much but can carry your daily lunch either hot or cold. nXtbag is made of 8oz waxed canvas with an insulated lining, carry strap and removable shoulder strap and three external pockets to keep those extra essentials, like you phone, iPad, books, wallet, purse, keys or whatever else you may have.

After years of taking an ugly plastic bag, Cheap backpack or your kids lunch box to work the idea for nXtbag came about - nXt Bag - The first truly practical and stylish insulated everyday use lunch bag!

The nXtbag is extremely durable, looks great and makes you look great tool! With 3 colours to choose from you can really make a statement of style and practicality!

The reason we came up with nXtbag is we wanted a bag that was old school and great for the environment looked great and had many uses. The classic look and functionality with ease of use.  nXtbag looks like the old lunch bag but we have made it out of Waxed canvas and insulated it inside. The nXtbag has 3 pockets which are great for keys, wallet, phone and the larger pocket will hold an ipad and book. So it’s great to take to work and use for your lunch or take it on picnics outings or its great for grocery shopping as its insulated.

nXtbag is fully lined with food grade insulated foil that is spill proof and easily cleaned.

The bag in constructed from 8oz waxed canvas with heavy duty stitching, three pockets, one on each side and a large pocket on the back of the bag

Old school retro look.

Environmentally friendly totally reusable.

 

OTHER INFORMATION:

The dimensions of nXtbag are 7.5” x 6” x 11” ( 190mm x 150mm x 380mm ) when closed and 7.5”x6”x15”  ( 190mm x 150mm x 380mm )  When Open.

The purpose of a bag is pretty straightforward: to carry and to hold. However, sometimes a bag is more than this, and has its own story.

  • HIGH-QUALITY stitching and seam work means this bag is built to last.
  • BIODEGRADABLE - free of any synthetic or plastic-based materials.
  • PACK YOUR LUNCH WITH STYLE: Waxed canvas body provides waterproof protection and stylish look for the workplace and beyond.
  • KEEPS FOOD COLD OR HOT: Insulated lining keeps food and drinks cold or Hot through the lunch hour. Wide base designed to fit cooler packs.
  • ADJUSTABLE SHOULDER STRAP: Strap is durable.
  • EASY TO CARRY: Handle makes it convenient to carry, unlike traditional lunch bags.
  • FEATURE:  Waxed canvas makes them unique, stain resistant and water resistant, we makes them durable. It is pretty large that can easily fit a medium size Tupperware container. Insulated lining keeps your food fresh Hot or cool for hours when you go to work, school and picnics. Also a good choice for a daily portable bag. Shopping bag
  • EASY-ACCESS OUTER POCKETS : Features wide opening for easy loading and unloading. There are 2 side pockets for storing your mobile phone,car keys wallet or purse. A deep rear pocket for putting snacks, candies, napkins, cards, books, Ipad and other small things.

Why take a ugly plastic bag,. Cheap backpack or your kids lunch box to work when you can take the nXtbag - NXT Bag - The first truly practical and stylish insulated everyday use lunch bag!

We would like to help you eliminate disposable products from your daily life. We will continue to look for new opportunities to create sustainable reusable products that replace the single-use items our world has grown accustomed to using and throwing away every day. The time for change is now and we hope we can make the transition just a little easier with well-made creatively designed products you will enjoy using for many years to come.

Please Join the Growing Movement of People Who Are Finding a Way to Stop Using Single-Use Plastics

 

  • PREMIUM CONSTRUCTIONS & INSULATION: The exterior of the Lunch Bag is constructed out of 8oz waxed canvas fabric for durability and easy cleaning. The interior lining was made of food grade aluminium foil for great thermal resistance. Equipped with rolled down top for smooth access.
  • VERSATILITY : Premium aluminum foil lining offers great thermal resistance which keeps the food fresh and warm/cold. It’s ideal for storing foods to bring to school, workplace, picnic, beach and BBQ. It’s also great for maintaining cold drinks or ice pack temperatures at the gym or in the car.
  • EASY-ACCESS OUTER POCKETS : Features wide opening for easy loading and unloading. There are 2 side pockets for storing your mobile phone,car keys wallet or purse. A deep rear pocket for putting snacks, candies, napkins, cards ,books Ipad and other small stuff.
  • CLASSIC DESIGN : Classic waxed canvas and Aluminum lining eliminates leakage problems, And a classic waxed canvas outer  with a carry handle and a detachable/adjustment shoulder strap that you could carry it in 3 modes：crossbody, shoulderbag and handbag, totally customizable for your different needs.
  • MEASUREMENTS & CAPACITY : The overall dimensions of the lunch Box are Sizes 7.5”x6”x15” ( 190mm x 150mm x 380mm )
  • The Lunch Box is spacy enough to store 12 tins of coke (330ml),6 bottles of beer or meals for 2-3 persons. Hot or cold food will keep your food drinks cold or hot.
  • MATERIAL: The surface material is 100% 8oz cotton canvas with all natural beeswax. The interior lining is high quality aluminum foil. The focus on details, even antic bronze buckle and sturdy stitching for presenting the perfect stylish functional lunch bag.
  • FEATURE Waxed canvas makes them unique, stain resistant and water resistant, we makes them durable. It is pretty large that can easily fit a medium size Tupperware container. Insulated lining keeps your food fresh Hot or cool for hours when you go to work, school and picnics. Also a good choice for a daily portable bag.
  • CARE: Wipe dry with a damp cloth or soft scrub brush if needed. Do not use detergent or dry clean.
  • HIGH-QUALITY stitching and seam work means this bag is built to last.
  • BIODEGRADABLE - free of any synthetic or plastic-based materials.
  • PACK YOUR LUNCH WITH STYLE: Waxed canvas body provides waterproof protection and stylish look for the workplace and beyond.
  • KEEPS FOOD COLD: Insulated lining keeps food and drinks cold through the lunch hour. Wide base designed to fit cooler packs.
  • ADJUSTABLE STRAP: Strap is durable.
  • EASY TO CARRY: Handle makes it convenient to carry, unlike traditional lunch bags.
  • PLENTY OF SPACE: Large capacity provides maximum space for oversized containers and drink bottles. 7.5” x 6” x 11” ( 190mm x 150mm x 300mm ) when closed
  • Size =7.5”x6”x15”  ( 190mm x 150mm x 380mm )  When Open
  • Weight = 304gm
  • Material =8oz Waxed Canvas

The nXtbag is great for all chapters of your everyday life, work life, social life, shopping life, your other life?.....this bag will go with you anywhere!

The nXtbag is extremely durable, looks great and makes you look great too! With 3 colours to choose (Dark Brown, Tan, Blue) from you can really make a statement of style and practicality!

The nXtbag is made from highly durable waxed canvas and is insulated on the inside and pockets, which will keep your food warm or cold and you looking cool!

The nXtbag also features 2 insulated pockets on each side and a large storage pocket on the back for books, phones, tablets, wallets, keys and more!

Don’t have much to put in the bag? No worries!  It can be rolled down in an easy to carry way!

The nXtbag is perfect for the urban professionals, commuters, students and bag lovers all round!

Take the  nXtbag shopping with you and will hold a generous amount of groceries!

Going to a BBQ or Party? The nXtbag can easily and comfortably hold a 6 pack of beer bottles or cans!

We wanted a bag that would not hurt the environment and be able to reuse many times over and keep looking great. We all need to stop using single use plastic!!

 

Get Yours now!

story:
Stay Up-To-Date
Watch all of our video updates on our YouTube Channel. We just added a video interview with Dr. Joe Keating, MPH Program Director, Department of Global Health Systems and Development, Tulane University School of Public Health and Tropical Medicine. WATCH NOW »

Who We Are

We are Green World Health Net, a non-profit organization founded by a diverse group of people with a shared interest in finding ways to promote better health through the use of green and alternative technologies. Our projects result in healthier people and a more sustainable planet. The Boko Bed Net Project (BBNP) is an exciting and innovative Malaria prevention project that we believe can greatly decrease the rates of Malaria.

Project Summary 

Reducing malaria rates by teaching people to make their own solar panels and solar systems to power fan and light consoles inside mosquito bed nets making them more comfortable to sleep under. Meanwhile providing renewable electricity to villages that have none and creating business opportunities to make and sell solar panels as well as cell phone and battery chargers.

“Boko” means “I am well” in Twi, the primary indigenous language in Ghana.

Malaria Statistics

Malaria is a serious, yet solvable problem. Somewhere in the world a child dies every 30 second from this disease, 1 million people die of malaria each year in Africa alone, and 20,000 children will die from malaria this year in Ghana, the country where our project is being launched.

Our Objective:

  1. Reduce malaria rates by increasing bed net usage while providing renewable electricity to villages that have none. 
  2. Community buy-in and empowerment. This project is not a hand out. Families are required to pay a monthly fee to pay off the cost of their solar system over time, equal to what they now pay for lighting sources. This money will be used to finance future Boko Bed Net Systems thus helping to sustain the project.
  3. Help communities to generate income by teaching them to make their own solar panels and cell phone chargers and selling them.

***Go to the updates to see how we have improved the Boko Bed Net household system meanwhile reducing the costs of the each systems from over $400 to under $200 per household.


What We Need

We need to raise $43,500 to implement this holistic project in two communities in Ghana, West Africa. This includes:

The building and installation of 300 household Boko Bed Net Systems with mosquito nets, solar panels made by villagers, storage batteries, interior and exterior lighting, as well as fan/light consoles to put inside nets. This equates to a average cost of $145 per househlold.

Workshops to teach the communities how to build and maintain their own solar systems and cell phone chargers.

Tools, basic business training, and set up of the community-owned solar business.

What You Get

Be the first person on your block to have a solar-powered cell phone charger made in a remote village in Africa! That's what you'll get for a generous donation of $250 or more. Watch this video to see how they're made:

 

 

The Project In Depth

The Boko Bed Net Project (BBNP) is an exciting and innovative Malaria prevention project that we believe can greatly decrease the rates of Malaria. Malaria currently kills a child every 30 seconds. As the world’s temperatures increase due to global warming, the area where Malaria-carrying mosquitos can live will increase and more people will be exposed to this deadly disease. This is a problem that will not just go away.

The BBNP will prevent Malaria by substantially increasing the use of mosquito bed nets. Currently, mosquito nets are accessible in many parts of the world. However, country-wide bed net use rates are estimated at 5-50%. Getting Malaria net use rates up is an important goal because the nets have proven to be a cost-effective method for preventing Malaria.  Our preliminary research shows a simple fact; people do not use their nets because they are just too hot to sleep under; the mosquito netting reduces air flow by 60-70%. We have a simple solution to this problem.

The BBNP will result in a significant increase in bed net use through installation of a solar-powered fan and light console inside mosquito nets. This console will provide both air circulation and lighting inside the nets. Our system will not only increase bed net use but will bring a clean, safe, and reliable lighting source to houses, an additional health benefit because kerosene and other toxic forms of lighting are eliminated. Furthermore, the power generated by these household solar systems will have zero emissions and will not contribute to global warming.

The BBNP is also an income generating project for the communities that participate. Villagers are taught how to make their own solar panels and cell phone chargers. Cell phones now play an important role in remote communities as they are not only a way to communicate, but vital in emergency and life threatening situations. There is a great demand for affordable solar panels and cell phone chargers, and the low cost manufacturing methods we are introducing will create jobs and allow the village to start and run their community-owned business to meet this demand.

We need to raise $43,500 to implement this holistic project in two communities in Ghana, West Africa. This includes the building and installation of 300 household solar systems with solar panels made be villagers, storage batteries, interior and exterior lighting, as well as fan/light consoles to put inside nets.  Funds will also be used for workshops to teach the communities how to build and maintain their own solar systems and cell phone chargers. Your donation will also go towards an initial investment in tools, basic business training, and set up of the community-owned solar business.

So we're turning to you to ask for help. Your contribution will help us build and install Malaria prevention solar systems for families in Ghana, and will help us in our fight against Malaria and in creating a more sustainable world. Thanks!

Villagers are taught how to make their own solar panels and cell phone chargers. There is a great demand for affordable solar panels and cell phone chargers, and the low cost manufacturing methods we are introducing will create jobs and allow the village to start and run their community-owned business to meet this demand. We need to raise $43,500 to implement this holistic project in two communities in Ghana, West Africa. This includes the building and installation of 300 household solar systems with solar panels made be villagers, storage batteries, interior and exterior lighting, as well as fan/light consoles to put inside nets.  Funds will also be used for workshops to teach the communities how to build and maintain their own solar systems and cell phone chargers. Your donation will also go towards an initial investment in tools, basic business training, and set up of the community-owned solar business.So we're turning to you to ask for help. Your contribution will help us build and install Malaria prevention solar systems for families in Ghana, and will help us in our fight against Malaria and in creating a more sustainable world. Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sindri Hrafn Guðmundsson and I am from Iceland, born in 1995. I have been practising track and field since I was five years old in my club Breiðablik. My friend talked me into trying this sport and I loved it from the beginning and have focused on it since then.  Through the years I have practised and competited in almost all events. The last few years I practised for decathlon but since autumn 2013 I have focused on javelin throw.  I have set sixteen national records in javelin throw and several in hurdles and heptathlon.  I have won the Icelandic Championship in my age group in many events throughout the years, most often in javelin throw but also in other events. 

In 2011 I competed at the World Youth Championship in Lille, France and at the European Youth Olympic Festival in Trabzon, Turkey. In 2012 I competed at the World Junior Championship in Barcelona, Spain and in 2013 I competed at the European Junior Championship in Rieti, Italy.
At this moment I have qualified to the World Junior Championship 2014 in Eugene, Oregeon, USA and have twice set the Icelandic record in my age group, the last with a 72,45 m throw. This last record puts me in the fifth place on the world leading list in my age group. My trainer is Einar Vilhjalmsson who holds the Icelandic national record (86,80 m) and has competed at the Olympics and at World Championships. 


My campaign focuses on my goal which is the 2014 IAAF World Junior Championship in Eugene, USA in July, the European Championship in 2015 age 20-22 and also to get to the Olympic Games in Rio in 2016. To be able to do so I have to buy javelins that suit my ability. I also need to travel abroad to warmer countries to practise and compete because Icelandic javeliners can not throw over the wintertime in Iceland due to weather conditions. And because Iceland is an island in the Atlantic it is expensive to travel abroad.

What contributors to my campaign would help me achieve is to buy javelins and to help me to travel to warmer countries to practise and compete.  That is a necessary part of my training as I am  determined to be one of the best javelin throwers in the world.


What I Need 

Javelin that suits my ability cost approx. $1500 and I would need at least two of them, front wind and tail wind javelins.
A flight ticket from Iceland to Europe is approx. $2000 for me and my trainer. And then there is hotel and food and many other things, such as physiotherapy, massage, training clothes, javelin shoes and so on.


Other Ways You Can Help

To all of you who will support me, thank you so much!! I am very grateful and I hope that in the future I will be able to show you that your support helped me in reaching my goals. Hopefully you will see me competiting in Rio in 2016 and then you can say: "This is my javelin thrower and I got him to Rio"! :)

If you are not able to contribute to my campaign I would be grateful if you could share my campaign to others. It is easy, you can use the Indiegogo share tools and help me in that way to reach my goals,

story:
Steam Joe

The Kayrank Helmet Rank System is a military grade, durable, tactical device used to identify the rank of the individual wearing the Kevlar Helmet. The patented design is a rank device that snaps into the Night Vision Device (NVD) bracket on the Army Combat Helmet (ACH).  The device can be easily removed when the NVD’s require reattachment.

The idea was borne through my numerous military deployments that found Soldiers were unable to display their rank on their helmet due to the mandatory wear of the NVD bracket.  In addition to not wearing the rank on the helmet, the rank on the Soldier’s uniform was often times obscured by secondary protective gear.  This subdued device ensures a Soldier/Airman/Marine can be identified while wearing the helmet. 

check out the video above!

The rank design was tested in a deployed combat environment.  The first designs of the rank were tested to ensure they fit in all NVD brackets and were also tested on their durability and ability to be identified at different ranges. 

The subdued design allows the wearer to be identified from ten meters or less and is not readily identified at farther distances in order to eliminate unwanted attention.

             Only CPT and E-7 have been made.

The device is a one piece construction with no moving parts. Nothing to break.
The rank can easily be removed and stored while the Soldier dons his NVD’s.

At this time I have designed and produced two individual Army ranks.  This is where I need the assistance.  If I can get enough pre-ordered I can make all of the ranks since each injection mold carries significant costs.  There are more ranks to be produced including ranks for other services and civilian counterparts required to wear tactical gear.

The peak population of the Active Duty United States Army is 547,000 personnel.  This is not accounting for the Reserves, National Guard, Marines, Air Force personnel or civilian SWAT members who may also benefit from the rank system.

Made in U.S.A.

I already have a United States Company lined up to start production, so I need the final push.  By funding my project, you will be pre-ordering KAYRANK and kickstarting our first production run of units.

Finally, I have worked for a long time on producing this product from getting my patent approved all the way to working with the injection mold company to produce a product that works and that Soldiers want.  This product will be an asset to all uniformed military personnel. Thank you for your help.

The subdued design allows the wearer to be identified from ten meters or less and is not readily identified at farther distances in order to eliminate unwanted attention.

             Only CPT and E-7 have been made.
The device is a one piece construction with no moving parts. Nothing to break.The rank can easily be removed and stored while the Soldier dons his NVD’s.
At this time I have designed and produced two individual Army ranks.  This is where I need the assistance.  If I can get enough pre-ordered I can make all of the ranks since each injection mold carries significant costs.  There are more ranks to be produced including ranks for other services and civilian counterparts required to wear tactical gear.
The peak population of the Active Duty United States Army is 547,000 personnel.  This is not accounting for the Reserves, National Guard, Marines, Air Force personnel or civilian SWAT members who may also benefit from the rank system.

Made in U.S.A.
I already have a United States Company lined up to start production, so I need the final push.  By funding my project, you will be pre-ordering KAYRANK and kickstarting our first production run of units.
Finally, I have worked for a long time on producing this product from getting my patent approved all the way to working with the injection mold company to produce a product that works and that Soldiers want.  This product will be an asset to all uniformed military personnel. Thank you for your help.

story:
It's been a very ambitious three years. I began this adventure July of 2010 after 6 years in the 22nd Infantry Regiment (Army) and two separate tours in Iraq. And I've loved every moment of it. In a very little amount of time I've shot and worked along side some really great talent!!!! I've shot a lot of cool places from South America to London and domestically NY to L.A. and everywhere in between!!! From Combat Infantryman to Editorial Fashion Photographer, I really never would have expected such a twist. I thank you for the opportunity to compile my burgeoning catalog of work into a volume of my first three years of editorial photography. Love you guys and thanks for the continued support!!!!

 

AHP

story:
Note that our fundraising campaign for motorcycles and gear for the rangers is over.  If you were late getting a gift in, you can still give to the cause through the Blue Waves Campaign.


We thank each and every one of our donors for their support.


Hi I'm Anton Berteaux.

I have always enjoyed the beautiful wilderness spaces available to us all in and around California, and am passionate about preserving undeveloped space for wildlife habitat and the mental health of humans, and have fantasized about exploring other parts of the world, but I am a lousy tourist, and have always thought that the best way to get to know a place is to go there with a purpose!

Over the past few months I have been moved by the beauty of Mongolia and one of the last, ancient largest freshwater lakes in the world, Lake Hovsgol.  The Mongolians call this body of water "The Mother Sea".  The Lake and the wildlife park around it are unique on this planet, and under threat from poachers and illegal developers tooling around in jeeps and 4x4's.   

The park is patrolled by rangers, mostly on horseback or decrepit old motorcycles.  The rangers need better transportation to do their job catching poachers and illegal developers, and the motorcycles they have are old, tired and inadequate.  The horses are even less effective.

I am raising funds to buy two motorcycles and gear.  On my own dime, I am going to go to Mongolia and deliver them to the rangers in person and train them in offroad riding techniques and motorcycle maintenance.

Lake Hovsgol is one of the last best places!

The Lake and surrounding wildlife area is a National Park bigger than Yellowstone and strictly protected as a transition zone between Central Asian Steppe and the Siberian Taiga.  It's one of 17 ancient lakes that are more than 2 million years old, and the water is so clean you can drink it without any treatment.  There are a number of indigenous people that live around it and depend on it for their water supply.  In fact  it contains 70% of all the surface freshwater supply for the whole country of Mongolia.  There is no body of water this clean and this large in America.

So what's threatening it?

Illegal poaching, including illegal drift net fishing: The lake has fish, including two endemic species, and since it's a lake, those fish can easily become overfished as every other fish population in the world has become.  The surrounding parklands are home to a number of really awesome animals, including ibex, argali, elk, wolf, wolverine, musk deer, brown bear, Siberian moose, and sable.

Mongolia has done a good job designating this area as a wildlife preserve to protect the survival of these animals, but enforcement is challenging.  Rangers have been stabbed and injured trying to enforce the law against poachers, who stand to make a great deal of money in the short term.

Illegal development and tourism: It shouldn't be news to Americans that people in and from outside Mongolia are eager to develop properties around the lake.  Rangers have caught individuals simply building around it without permits.  Run off and pollution from illegal development and road building is certain to pollute the lake, as well as impact wildlife habitat.  Additionally outsiders have come in and started developing environmental tourism projects without necessarily caring for the habitat or obtaining permission.

But they have rangers to enforce the laws, right?

Yes, the whole park is about 4,600 square miles (1.2mm hectares) and there are 15 permanent rangers and a few seasonal ones.  Each ranger patrols over 300 square miles of park, which is about the same size as all the boroughs in New York City.  And they do it mostly on horseback.    Imagine if there was only one policeman in a space as big as the five boroughs of New York City, and he was on horseback chasing bad guys in jeeps.

The poachers and illegal users in the park tool around in jeeps, 4x4's, and other vehicles.  Did I also mention the poachers are armed?

The rangers have asked for help by in the form of offroad motorcycles, gear, and training.  With modern offroad motorcycles, they could patrol more effectively and discourage lawbreakers.

So why do I care, and how can I help?

It's true, Mongolia is halfway around the world, but I care, and here's why:

  • We don't have that many wild places left in the world.  
  • We don't have that much wildlife left in the world.
  • I love motorcycles, and it's not often that my love of motorcycles could have such a huge impact for a good cause.

Even if you aren't moved by this situation, I ask that you support me in my effort to keep this wild area as pristine as possible.   You can help by donating to help cover the cost of two motorcycles and equipment.

Where does the money go?

100% of the money you donate is tax-deductible, and goes to buy and ship the motorcycles and equipment. I am paying my own ticket over, and the Mongol Ecology Center is not taking any of it for administration, it all goes directly to equipment for the rangers! 

I am trying to fund two motorcycles and equipment.  Each motorcycle and equipment, along with shipping, costs $7,550. Indigegogo fees on the total amount are $1,170.25.  ($7,550*2+$1,170.25 = $16,270.25)   I am trying to raise enough to outfit two rangers.  Any additional money goes to buying a third and eventually fourth motorcycle if I exceed my fundraising goal.  

If I raise additional funds, but not enough for an entire motorcycle and gear, the Mongol Ecology Center has agreed to pool it with the funds raised by other riders to fund another complete motorcycle.

How you can help and what do I get?

Donate, and donate big to get the very best benefit premiums.  Here's a short video about my favorite.


Scenes from the filming

Indigegogo fees on the total amount are $1,170.25.  ($7,550*2+$1,170.25 = $16,270.25)   I am trying to raise enough to outfit two rangers.  Any additional money goes to buying a third and eventually fourth motorcycle if I exceed my fundraising goal.  If I raise additional funds, but not enough for an entire motorcycle and gear, the Mongol Ecology Center has agreed to pool it with the funds raised by other riders to fund another complete motorcycle.How you can help and what do I get?Donate, and donate big to get the very best benefit premiums.  Here's a short video about my favorite.Scenes from the filming

story:
Print the M.R.E. flyer and share it with friends, family, coworkers and bar mates. Get the word out of this "Unforgettable Montana Hospitality Experience". Go to this direct download link to print it off.   See example at the end of this literature. 

https://drive.google.com/file/d/14IwOgRD0lWhpOaNFWMzK0wcUn5_dMtz7/view?usp=sharing


 A Little Bit About Myself 

          Hello! I am Michael Kayle McCallum from the great state of Montana, and I’d like to invite you to be a part of my dream to start a new hotel. This hotel of mine will be like no other, with hospitality opportunities you won’t find anywhere else. 
         This coming January, I will be completing a personal goal of an 8-year military commitment to this country that I love and the state I believe in. I served five years in the United States Army and finishing my military commitment with three years in the Montana National Guard.
          While I was active, I served under 4-4 Calvary with the 1st Infantry Division out of Fort Riley Kansas and 3-71 Calvary with the 10th Mountain Division out of Fort Drum New York. Now, I’m serving with the 1-189th AVN GSAB out of Helena Montana. I'll be receiving my DD-214 in January 2021.

           Before my military career, I worked for two years in the Bakken oil fields of North Dakota and 3 years as a Union painter (Local 707) in Cleveland Ohio. Prior to that, I worked on the road with the best paperhanging company known throughout the Midwest. I’ve lived in 9 different states in this great nation of ours and loved every one of them. I am looking forward to getting back to my home state of Montana and starting this dream business of mine.

Contact Information:

  • Best way of Contact - Michael.K.McCallum.Mil@gmail.com
  • Please leave a message - (406) 577-3468

 Description Of The Business 

           McCallum’s Riverfront Estates (“M.R.E.”) will be a unique hospitality establishment with Montana’s beautiful scenery as its backdrop. Providing unique outdoor experiences through the development of a multi-use facility providing year-round resort accommodations. This establishment will consist of a restaurant and bar with an area for a variety of entertainment. Rooms will be available for overnight lodging along with a computer classroom for those looking to give a hands-on presentation or a training course.

          M.R.E. will be located along a river for summer swimming, boating, and heart-warming campfires with family and friends. A variety of year-round group camps will include youth camps, ski camps, survival camps, couple/single camps, band camps, Christian camps, football camps, hunting camps, and so many more.

          The facility will also support outdoor activities including ATV riding, tent camping, RV hookups, horseback riding, hunting/fishing, hiking and lots more. There will be a large deck for outdoor relaxation with a variety of lounge seating and grills for personal use.

          The building will house 35 rooms with a footprint approximately 50’ x 100’. There will be four floors with the first floor similar to the style of a walkout basement. The first floor will be the location of the bar, restaurant, classroom and the entertainment area. The wall facing the river will open to a large deck offering outside accommodations. This wall will have large windows reaching to the ceiling of the second floor, giving the bar and entertainment area cathedral ceiling and a beautiful view of the Rocky Mountains.

          The second floor will consist of four rooms that'll have the accommodations of any quality hotel room you’ll find today. These four rooms will be located on ground level giving them their own access to the outside, while having a secondary entry from the balcony above the bar, just like the old western days. This balcony will wrap around the entire entertainment area and offer a quiet setting while admiring the M.R.E.'s beautiful view.

           Most of the rooms will be located on the third floor and won’t have your typical hotel room accommodations. These 10’ x 10’ rooms will have a unique step back in time hospitality feel and share public restrooms. These restrooms will supply the guests on the third floor with their restroom needs. This floor will be the location of the abundant sleeping accommodations needed when hosting the many group camps for which this establishment will be known for. It will also be ideal for those working or hunting for long periods of time in the M.R.E.'s local area.

           There will be a suite located on the fourth floor. This elaborate suite will cater to large groups or for the customers looking for a luxury experience. This suite will consist of three bedrooms, with one being the master bedroom, another with two queen-sized beds, and the third having 4 bunk beds. These rooms will provide plenty of sleeping for larger groups. The kitchen will be fully stocked while having a nice dining area for a traditional sit-down dinner. The large and relaxing living room will house a fireplace with access to its own private balcony. Along with this suite, there will be two bathrooms and an office for guests’ business needs. 

           The outside will consist of many features including a beach for relaxation, BBQ grills for outdoor cooking, campfires to warm up by, and a fenced-in area for guests’ animals to run wild. In time, I will install RV hook ups, small private cabins, docks, and an outbuilding for larger events. The M.R.E. will offer many options to our guests, giving it a wide range of clientele and successfully accommodating needs of all visitors.

 Achievements From The Contributors Funding

          Out of this campaign, I am looking to reach my goal of $485,000. If my campaign goal is met, these funds along with my savings will make up the percentage of personal investment needed to receive my business bank loan.

          The campaign funding will purchase the site of the hotel which makes up the majority of my campaign goal. Installation of the large commercial septic system along with the 6-inch well needed for the M.R.E.'s water supply.  All the excavating needed around the location of the hotel and the pouring of the building's strong foundation. 

          These beginning stages of construction have already been looked at by professional companies and they are all excited to start this positive and lively project. I will be ready to confidently continue funding the rest of this project with my business bank loan. With the completion of the first M.R.E. hotel and reaching my operational financial goals, I’ll be continuing my business adventure by looking for the next location of the M.R.E. hotels.

 My Perks To You 

          It is easy for me to create a wide range of perks for this establishment, due to the variety of options and outdoor activities. These perks will be provided to you at an incredible price. There will be several room perks available, along with perks for ATV’s, Boats, outdoor adventurers, and of course the M.R.E.’s main attraction the “Group Camps".

           The first perk I’d like to offer is for $25 to all my fellow comrades. One-night stay with a burger and drink. If you think you can get another drink on me, I suggest you bring the best coin you have because I’ll challenge anyone, any day, with mine. The next few perks are the rooms for the many individuals in need of some good R-and-R. These low room fares are a steal and you won’t find better deals in such a nicer area. Along with your room you may want to pick up the $100 all day ATV/Boat rental. There is not an ATV/Boat rental shop anywhere that will let you rent an ATV/Boat all day for just $100. Just imagine the amazing weekend you could have for around $200 in beautiful Montana. If you’re coming with a large group, I'd recommend getting the suite that sleeps over 15 and is equipped with everything you need.

           Along with these great room rates I'd also recommend you getting into the action with our amazing "Group Camps". For only a $100 you could join in on one of the many day adventurers that the M.R.E. will be offing. These day adventurers will have everything you will need to enjoy the day that we set up for you. The $500 group camp perk is good for anyone of our many camps that will last up to 5 days and doesn't include any of our supportive camps. These camps easily go for over a $1000 anywhere else. So, get started with your next adventure with the M.R.E. today through these early bird deals.

Thank you all for your contributions to help me start the M.R.E.

 If I Don't Reach My Goal 

          If I do not reach my set goal, no worries. I will get there one way or another. I am not a man that gives up on his dreams, nor one that watches them fade from failure. I will continue to find investors and continue working on the many projects that comes before a grand opening. Once I have the first M.R.E. established, there will be little to slow me down on opening many more of these soon to be well know hospitality establishments. 

 The Impact 

          The impact of the M.R.E. will be tremendous on strengthening any small-town local economy while offering refreshing R-and-R for hardworking Americans. It will assist those that are lost and thirsting to create a new life path with good values. The M.R.E. will have countless motivating stories, and I’m looking forward to contributing to every one of them. I’m looking forward to seeing the positive impact that my establishment will have and the ways it will strengthen the lives of the guests that visit. 

          Along with the positive impact on people's lives through our fun filled activities. The M.R.E. will impact those needing some mental and moral support. The group camps will be a big part of this establishment and I’ll be looking to have at least two a month. Some of these camps will be much more than just a good experience but will be inspirational to ones that struggle with addictions, PTSD, depression, guilt and tragedy.  

          The M.R.E. will have a big impact on people's lives by hosting Terminally Ill Retreats to help family’s come together towards the end of a loved one’s life journey. PTSD camps to help individuals work through and put to rest their traumatic thoughts. Help first responders, our true heroes at home, with their depression that comes from those horrific scenes that they are called to every day. Camps for our wounded soldiers that have sacrificed so much for the freedoms that we have.  McCallum’s Riverfront Estates will be much more than just the location of a hotel or a summer camp but will signify a new beginning for many.

 Risks & Challenges 

           Over the years of collaborating my ideas and putting solutions to obstacles, I have become very confident in succeeding with this dream of mine. It’s natural for every new business owner to have those feelings of fear from failure. I have overcame these feelings because I have done my research and looked into all aspects of how to truly make this establishment accomplish the feat of success. So, when asked what are my Risks and Challenges, there is only one… How am I going to keep the mind of my guests from thinking about their life of stress within the time they are visiting the M.R.E.

The M.R.E. Flyer

Print the M.R.E. flyer and share it with friends, family, coworkers and bar mates. Get the word out of this "Unforgettable Montana Hospitality Experience". I need all the help I can get to render the grand opening of this amazing establishment. Go to this website to print it off:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/14IwOgRD0lWhpOaNFWMzK0wcUn5_dMtz7/view?usp=sharing

 

Contact Information:

  • Best way of Contact - Michael.K.McCallum.Mil@gmail.com
  • Please leave a message - (406) 577-3468

          Out of this campaign, I am looking to reach my goal of $485,000. If my campaign goal is met, these funds along with my savings will make up the percentage of personal investment needed to receive my business bank loan.
          The campaign funding will purchase the site of the hotel which makes up the majority of my campaign goal. Installation of the large commercial septic system along with the 6-inch well needed for the M.R.E.'s water supply.  All the excavating needed around the location of the hotel and the pouring of the building's strong foundation. 
          These beginning stages of construction have already been looked at by professional companies and they are all excited to start this positive and lively project. I will be ready to confidently continue funding the rest of this project with my business bank loan. With the completion of the first M.R.E. hotel and reaching my operational financial goals, I’ll be continuing my business adventure by looking for the next location of the M.R.E. hotels.

 My Perks To You 
          It is easy for me to create a wide range of perks for this establishment, due to the variety of options and outdoor activities. These perks will be provided to you at an incredible price. There will be several room perks available, along with perks for ATV’s, Boats, outdoor adventurers, and of course the M.R.E.’s main attraction the “Group Camps".

           The first perk I’d like to offer is for $25 to all my fellow comrades. One-night stay with a burger and drink. If you think you can get another drink on me, I suggest you bring the best coin you have because I’ll challenge anyone, any day, with mine. The next few perks are the rooms for the many individuals in need of some good R-and-R. These low room fares are a steal and you won’t find better deals in such a nicer area. Along with your room you may want to pick up the $100 all day ATV/Boat rental. There is not an ATV/Boat rental shop anywhere that will let you rent an ATV/Boat all day for just $100. Just imagine the amazing weekend you could have for around $200 in beautiful Montana. If you’re coming with a large group, I'd recommend getting the suite that sleeps over 15 and is equipped with everything you need.
           Along with these great room rates I'd also recommend you getting into the action with our amazing "Group Camps". For only a $100 you could join in on one of the many day adventurers that the M.R.E. will be offing. These day adventurers will have everything you will need to enjoy the day that we set up for you. The $500 group camp perk is good for anyone of our many camps that will last up to 5 days and doesn't include any of our supportive camps. These camps easily go for over a $1000 anywhere else. So, get started with your next adventure with the M.R.E. today through these early bird deals.
Thank you all for your contributions to help me start the M.R.E.
 If I Don't Reach My Goal 
          If I do not reach my set goal, no worries. I will get there one way or another. I am not a man that gives up on his dreams, nor one that watches them fade from failure. I will continue to find investors and continue working on the many projects that comes before a grand opening. Once I have the first M.R.E. established, there will be little to slow me down on opening many more of these soon to be well know hospitality establishments. 

 The Impact 
          The impact of the M.R.E. will be tremendous on strengthening any small-town local economy while offering refreshing R-and-R for hardworking Americans. It will assist those that are lost and thirsting to create a new life path with good values. The M.R.E. will have countless motivating stories, and I’m looking forward to contributing to every one of them. I’m looking forward to seeing the positive impact that my establishment will have and the ways it will strengthen the lives of the guests that visit. 
          Along with the positive impact on people's lives through our fun filled activities. The M.R.E. will impact those needing some mental and moral support. The group camps will be a big part of this establishment and I’ll be looking to have at least two a month. Some of these camps will be much more than just a good experience but will be inspirational to ones that struggle with addictions, PTSD, depression, guilt and tragedy.  
          The M.R.E. will have a big impact on people's lives by hosting Terminally Ill Retreats to help family’s come together towards the end of a loved one’s life journey. PTSD camps to help individuals work through and put to rest their traumatic thoughts. Help first responders, our true heroes at home, with their depression that comes from those horrific scenes that they are called to every day. Camps for our wounded soldiers that have sacrificed so much for the freedoms that we have.  McCallum’s Riverfront Estates will be much more than just the location of a hotel or a summer camp but will signify a new beginning for many.

 Risks & Challenges 
           Over the years of collaborating my ideas and putting solutions to obstacles, I have become very confident in succeeding with this dream of mine. It’s natural for every new business owner to have those feelings of fear from failure. I have overcame these feelings because I have done my research and looked into all aspects of how to truly make this establishment accomplish the feat of success. So, when asked what are my Risks and Challenges, there is only one… How am I going to keep the mind of my guests from thinking about their life of stress within the time they are visiting the M.R.E.
The M.R.E. Flyer
Print the M.R.E. flyer and share it with friends, family, coworkers and bar mates. Get the word out of this "Unforgettable Montana Hospitality Experience". I need all the help I can get to render the grand opening of this amazing establishment. Go to this website to print it off:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/14IwOgRD0lWhpOaNFWMzK0wcUn5_dMtz7/view?usp=sharing


 
Contact Information:

Best way of Contact - Michael.K.McCallum.Mil@gmail.com
Please leave a message - (406) 577-3468

story:
UPDATE!

Canstruction was a great success for our team.  Though we didn't win any awards, we made a very large donation to the food bank in the form of both canned food and cash.  We would like to send out a huge thanks to everyone who helped to make this event come together.  Check out the gallery for a few photographs of our built structure.


RIM Architects, Howard S. Wright and KPFF Consulting Engineers have formed a team to build a can sculpture for the 1st annual Canstruction in San Francisco – a unique community service project sponsored by the architecture, engineering, design and construction industry.  The event will take place June 22 - 26, 2011 at the Metreon, and benefit the San Francisco Food Bank.  See more at www.canstruction.org.


We need sponsors!  Our planning has begun for this design-build project and we’re going to need several thousand cans to build a successful sculpture!  With your help, we hope to build the most amazing can sculp­ture in Canstruction history.  Your donation will be used to purchase canned goods to be used for the sculpture.  All cans will be donated to the San Francisco Food Bank.


Don't forget to come see your donation expressed in sculpture on the fourth floor of the Metreon from June 22-26!


A big thanks to our current sponsors!

Safeway

Union Environmental, Inc.

Finelite

D&J Tile Company, Inc.

Spacetone Acoustics, Inc.

Sprig Electric

J.W. McClenahan Co.

American Technologies, Inc.

Golden State Carpet Service, Inc.

KZ Tile Co.

Professional Machinery Group, Inc.

Alliance Environmental Group

Romak Iron Works

And all our friends and colleagues

story:
Short Testimony

In 2007 my life was coming to an end because of my past life style as a touring rock musican. I was going to leave four wonderful children and a wonderful wife behind. There were no hope to survive due to the incurable diseases the alcohol and drugs had done in my body. For several years I worked with members from Lynyrd Skynyrd, Molly Hatchet, Status Quo and Whitesnake but I can not blame what happened to me on the music or my friends. It was the fear and anxiety inside of me that took over the control of my life. One night I had an encounter with Jesus and He did what was impossible for the doctors.

Now 8 years later I am totally healed, set free from drugs and alcohol and I have a purpose for my life; to be a better father for my children, the husband my wife deserves after all the years she watched me slowly kill myself with drugs and alcohol and I have a bold message to tell about Jesus Christ who dragged me up from the horrible pit of destruction and gave me a mission; to plunder hell and populate heaven.

The last seven years I have traveled around the world with my music and my life story. In 2014 we did 151 events and we saw people receive Jesus Christ into their lives and what is more worth than see people get saved and see people get a new life.

Now it is time to travel back to Florida and we start in Daytona Beach with Daytona Bike Week 2015. For five days we are going to be playing music in the midst of hundreds of thousands of bikers together with the Music For The Soul stage. I personally think Bike Week is a place where Jesus Himself would have gone.

After Bike Week we are staying another two weeks in Florida to minister in youth facilities such as Teen Challenge, alcohol- & drug rehabs as well as be part of some outreach concerts and events. Last March we did 11 meetings in five days and we saw God do wonderful things in the prisons as well. People got saved and not only one or two. I am not into numbers as God is taking care of them. I just want to do my part and do what Jesus told me to do when He visited me on my deathbed:

GO OUT AND TELL ALL THE PEOPLE ABOUT ME AND YOUR LIFE! TELL THE YOUNG PEOPLE ABOUT THE DANGERS AND HELP THOSE WHO HAVE SAME PROBLEMS AS YOU HAVE HAD.


What We Need & What You Get


  • Hotels in Daytona Beach during Bike Week are raising their prices. We have booked one of the lower end motels outside Daytona Beach and for one room we are paying 900 USD for six nights.
  • We need our vehicle as well as be able to eat daily. During our trip we are also going to make more episode of our TV program Life in Him that is soon also being broadcasted on YouTube. A TV program with personal life stories and testimonies from people who have had a change in their life.
  • We are on our way as we have our flights. Besides that we have not been able to raise anything yet and it all starts on Monday, March 9th. We hope to have raised at least the funds for our motel by then. We are going to be there anyway  and if we can't raise all our needs we just have to trust in God that He will provide for all our needs.
  • After Bike week we have rented a room as well as we are going to travel to different locations in Florida to share the good news. We are going to be based out of Okeechobee, Florida where we also are going to minister to children and youth.
  • We are not doing too many perks on this fundraiser as we hope you see it as a blessing to be part of the work. YOU are important and this is something we do together!

The Impact

Watch the video about PJB  and the USA missions HERE!


Other Ways You Can Help

IF you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about ourcampaign.
  • Share our link with your friends.

Lets do this together!
