story:
Hi my name is Charles Werb, the founder of the Outer Edge Polar Challenge ride for Leukaemia.

Whilst the dream to explore Antarctica only manifested itself 4 years ago I can remember at the age of 24 doing some drawings that showed a wind powered vehicle with Big Foot tyres for use on sand or desert exploration.

For years I have played with wind powered “toys” be they kites or sails and when the decision was made to go to Antarctica I thought well why not something that has never been done before do? Let’s attempt to sail around the Polar Plateau in a snow sailer.

Now this is something that you cannot just go and buy from your local adventure retailer. In fact my research took me down the path of ice sailers and some video on guys trying to use kite buggy’s with skis.

Whilst the ice sailers tracked impressively the buggy’s with skis could not hold a straight line, they kept on having a side slip. It was then that I had my first eureka moment…..Why not fit snowboards with ice blades attached below like a keel and see what happens. Now I am not the first to do this, but the method we used can be seen in the results we have produced to date.


So now I realised I had the vehicle, what about the motivation? How am I going to do this. What do I need to put in place to make this happen? The mind went into overdrive and then an opportunity presented itself.

I bought Outer Edge Magazine. Not because of what it had done in the market place but because of what I believed I could bring to this publication - the opportunity to live my dream and to bring into it the undertaking of a World First initiative. And the best part about this is that our readers, sponsors and advertisers are all coming along for the ride.

Within 4 weeks of taking over Outer Edge Magazine my Dad passed away after batting Lymphoma for 3 and 1/2 years. I had the opportunity of confiding in him what I wanted to do, the great thing is that he immediately understood what it was I wanted to do and my reasons why.

4 weeks later Dad had passed and on my way back from the funeral I made the decision to name the event the Outer Edge Polar Challenge Ride for Leukaemia and dedicate in memory of Henry Werb, Papa to all his grandchildren.

 

This is our opportunity to involve others, to inspire them to dream, to encourage them to explore and involve themselves in science, technology and adventure and at the same time help others by raising as much money as we can for the leukaemia Foundation.

So now we had a design, a mission, 2 great fellow adventurers in Dr Adrian McCallum,expedition leader and Jon Moody videographer.


Dr Adrian McCallum is a glaciologist who currently lectures in science & engineering at the University of the Sunshine Coast, Queensland; he manages courses in soil mechanics, geotechnical engineering and climate change adaptation. He is fortunate to have led a life of adventure and exploration around the globe and is an expert in remote area science & engineering.

He holds a PhD from the Scott Polar Research Institute, University of Cambridge and additional degrees in oceanography, meteorology and civil engineering. In 2002 he was awarded the Australian Centenary Medal for his stewardship of the 2001 Australian Army Centenary Everest Expedition and he is a Menzies Scholar and Director of the Menzies Foundation; a non-profit, non-political organisation created to promote excellence in research, scholarship and postgraduate study by Australians.

During twenty years service across the Australian Defence Forces he served in numerous diverse roles such as helicopter navigator, meteorologist and civil engineer and he has led or participated in adventurous scientific expeditions around the globe. These investigations have taken him to many far-flung locations including Svalbard, Greenland, across the Arctic and Antarctica, and to the Himalaya and the ice caps of Patagonia. He orchestrated Sir Ranulph Fiennes' groundbreaking 2013 winter Transantarctic expedition and regularly consults to the Australian Antarctic Division on polar infrastructural and operational matters.

There are a number of reasons why Adrian is very excited to be involved with the Outer Edge Polar Challenge.

Firstly, he is dedicated to the pursuit of remote area scientific and engineering investigations, particularly via lightweight and innovative means. The Outer Edge Polar Challenge is a perfect exemplar of this concept: innovative, lightweight, wind-propelled vehicles, crossing expanses of remote terrain whilst gathering scientific data, in an intimate and efficient manner.

Adrian plans to tow an ice penetrating radar behind his snowsailer, enabling ice thickness estimates to be collected along the entire journey; much of the proposed route is over ice of unknown extent, so these data will contribute greatly to literally ‘filling in the blanks’. Additional science to be conducted on the traverse may include instrumenting the snowsailers to monitor their condition whist traversing thousand of miles of ice and snow and additionally, monitoring surface friction and snow density along the route.

Even more important than the scientific data that he expects to collect, Adrian is enthusiastic about the vehicle that the expedition offers as a means to entice students into a career in Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics (STEM); that being a scientist doesn’t have to mean wearing a lab coat, but can involve travelling to anywhere in the world, gathering data that may otherwise be unobtainable, unless combined with a little adventure…

Finally, with so many families around the world affected by relatives and loved ones afflicted with Leukemia, the opportunity to fly the flag in support of the Queensland Leukemia Foundation and to assist in raising funds for ongoing Leukemia research is the primary factor that drives Adrian and the three other team members to participate in this ground-breaking polar expedition.

Jonathan Moody, Director of Greater West Physiotherapy & Health Centres, with 7 Physio and massage centres in Sydney's West. Recently I engaged myself into a life long commitment into discovering my self imposed limits. After running a marathon in September 2013, I remembered thinking- I wish it had broken me, but it didn't. I never thought I would have ever run a marathon and came to realise that all limitations are self imposed. Anything is possible.

So I started getting unrealistic on my limits. Everest? Lhotse? Badlands Ultra Marathon? They now all seem reachable.  You see, the beauty about testing your limits, is that you don't need a reason. You just do it for the sake of living. Experiencing the lows makes the highs all that much better.

In setting out to start, I knew I needed like minded people to explore the impossible with. Then came Charles. An email, a phone call, an antarctic expedition, raising money for Leukaemia. Now that means a whole lot.

Currently exploring my passion of writing feature films and moving into the film industry, I thought I could combine these two and be the Director/Writer/Producer of a documentary on the expedition. A life worth living is one worth recording.

All we had to do was to build our snow sailers and raise our sponsorship.

We successfully launched the Polar Challenge at the ORA trade show in Sydney and the Explore Australia show, both of these were held at the end of June.

By the end of October we had trialled our snow sailers, finalised our dates of departure, built the snow sailers, secured all of our product sponsorship and started raising our Corporate sponsorship for the individual snow sailers.

The thought then occurred instead of finding a Major Naming Rights sponsor, which would detract from our overall goal, why not take this out to the world and offer the opportunity to be a part of this unique adventure to you.

So how you can be a part of it.

Joining the Outer Edge Polar Challenge and committing to donate/invest in this expedition and this exciting journey isn’t just about getting more information as a follower. It’s about having a genuine opportunity to participate in being involved in an ground breaking expedition.

We have established a number of levels of involvement ranging from $10 – $50 000.

So enthusiasts – explorers or not - can participate in an adventure at the highest level and have the chance to make a genuine contribution.

If you're thinking of taking part in Outer Edge Polar Challenge, then don’t hang around because your support will make a huge difference right now.

Your contribution will allow us to succeed in our aim and raise as much money as we can by getting to Antarctica and achieving our goals.

At the very least share it with someone you know who will want to get involved. Getting our message in front of as many people as possible is also important.

Get involved. To become part of our team just choose your donation level and contribute.

Come join us and become the heartbeat of the team.

How your money will be spent.

To date we have funded the expedition through the generosity of our product sponsors, who have come on board with product and cash, internally through the magazine Outer Edge and now with the Corporate Funding of the individual snow sailers and the explorers.

The money we raise now will go towards our flights from Australia to Antarctica and will free us up to continue our preparation and fundraising.

What you get in return.

We would like to reward you for your contribution and we have created various levels of participation each with their own unique reward.

$10.00 – download of our cardboard model of the snow sailer and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation.

$25.00 – 12 months online subscription to Outer Edge mag plus a download of our cardboard model of the snow sailer and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation.

$50.00 – Outer Edge Polar Challenge cap plus 12 months online subscription to Outer Edge mag, download of our cardboard model of the snow sailer and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation.

$100.00 - Outer Edge Polar Challenge T-Shirt and cap plus 12 months online subscription to Outer Edge mag, download of our cardboard model of the snow sailer and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation.

$250.00 – signed copy of the Outer Edge Polar Challenge Book and DVD and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation.

$10 000.00 – join us as a VIP guest at out farewell event on the 12 December 2014 in Brisbane. Includes all flights and accommodation and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation. Applies to Australian residents living in Australia only.

$50 000.00 – have the opportunity to travel to Antarctica with us in either November 2015 / December 2015 or January 2016 and to snowsail a distance of 1500 km from 83 degrees to the South Pole and back. Includes all training, flights, clothing, food, equipment, accommodation and use of a snow sailer. 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation

Risks & Challenges

The Outer Edge Polar Challenge team appreciates and understands that the polar plateau – specifically the route to the  Pole of Inaccessibility is highly remote, with a fragile and untouched environment that requires careful and considerate management.

Furthermore, the team understands that the expedition must be fully self-sufficient throughout the expedition and only able to access last resort resources from The Antarctic Company (TAC) such as Search and Rescue and supply drops in the event of an emergency. We accept that there is an inherent risk with the proposed expedition to such a remote and potentially hazardous environment and have created a comprehensive risk management plan to handle this.

The Outer Edge Polar Challenge Team takes safety very seriously and recognises the inherent risks involved in a polar journey. As such we have developed a plan to minimise, mitigate and manage the risks associated with the proposed expedition.

The team leader has an extensive level of experience in outdoor guiding and adventure travel over a period of seven years on unsupported expeditions to the some of the worlds’ most extreme and unforgiving natural environments. The team leader will ensure that the entire team is trained to the same standard of independence and self-reliance in the field.

Team members are fit, well trained and extremely capable outdoorsmen, capable of enduring long periods of inclement conditions, and handling the severe cold conditions which can be expected on the plateau.

This previous experience has built an attitude and culture within the expedition team of cautious and well planned expeditioning. Whilst we understand the inherent risks associated with the proposed expedition, we are committed to intelligently managing the factors in our control as part of meticulously planning all aspects of the expedition.

We will take a flexible approach to the implementation of the expedition plan, assessing and taking into consideration weather conditions and weather forecast, sastrugi, and team member’s condition on an ongoing basis, and adapting our plans accordingly to ensure a safe and expeditious approach to the expedition.

This intelligent and calculated approach to risk assessment and risk management has characterised the overall theme that we wish to apply to the expedition for a low risk and maximum gain approach.

A full Risk Assessment and Management Plan, which covers many of the conceivable risks and hazards that may be encountered by the expedition has been formulated. Emergency Procedures have been developed for a number of potential emergency situations, and are documented in our Standard Operating Procedures.. In addition to these specific risk mitigation activities and emergency procedures, the following more general risk management strategies will also be employed;

  • The expedition team consists of four (4) team members, who will stay as close as possible to each other throughout the expedition. This allows for minimum chance of losing one another in reduced visibility conditions and minimum response times for an emergency.

  • The team will spend 4 days acclimating to the conditions and equipment at Novo before setting off on the journey. This will ensure a maximum chance of success in being able to diagnose any last remaining equipment issues.

  • A decision will be made at the geographic South Pole whether the team members feel comfortable attempting the will return directly to Novo as per the route plan.

  • In the case of a medical problem or accident requiring evacuation or support not available from the expedition team, TAC will be contacted by satellite phone and arrangements made for the extraction of the affected team member/team.

  • In a situation where TAC is not able to reach the expedition team to render support and it is not an option to wait for the assistance. The team will haul, sail and evac to an alternate location or support base.

I have more questions. Who do I ask?Please contact Charles Werb, Expedition Founder , on 0418 984 019 or email charles@outeredgepolarchallenge.com.au.

This is our opportunity to involve others, to
inspire them to dream, to encourage them to explore and involve themselves in
science, technology and adventure and at the same time help others by raising
as much money as we can for the leukaemia Foundation.
So now we had a design, a mission, 2 great fellow
adventurers in Dr Adrian McCallum,expedition leader and Jon Moody videographer.



Dr Adrian McCallum is a
glaciologist who currently lectures in science & engineering at the
University of the Sunshine Coast, Queensland; he manages courses in soil
mechanics, geotechnical engineering and climate change adaptation. He is
fortunate to have led a life of adventure and exploration around the globe and
is an expert in remote area science & engineering.
He holds a PhD from the
Scott Polar Research Institute, University of Cambridge and additional degrees
in oceanography, meteorology and civil engineering. In 2002 he was awarded the
Australian Centenary Medal for his stewardship of the 2001 Australian Army
Centenary Everest Expedition and he is a Menzies Scholar and Director of the
Menzies Foundation; a non-profit, non-political organisation created to promote
excellence in research, scholarship and postgraduate study by Australians.
During twenty years
service across the Australian Defence Forces he served in numerous diverse
roles such as helicopter navigator, meteorologist and civil engineer and he has
led or participated in adventurous scientific expeditions around the globe.
These investigations have taken him to many far-flung locations including
Svalbard, Greenland, across the Arctic and Antarctica, and to the Himalaya and
the ice caps of Patagonia. He orchestrated Sir Ranulph Fiennes' groundbreaking
2013 winter Transantarctic expedition and regularly consults to the Australian
Antarctic Division on polar infrastructural and operational matters.
There are a number of
reasons why Adrian is very excited to be involved with the Outer Edge Polar
Challenge.
Firstly, he is dedicated
to the pursuit of remote area scientific and engineering investigations,
particularly via lightweight and innovative means. The Outer Edge Polar
Challenge is a perfect exemplar of this concept: innovative, lightweight,
wind-propelled vehicles, crossing expanses of remote terrain whilst gathering
scientific data, in an intimate and efficient manner.
Adrian plans to tow an
ice penetrating radar behind his snowsailer, enabling ice thickness estimates
to be collected along the entire journey; much of the proposed route is over
ice of unknown extent, so these data will contribute greatly to literally ‘filling
in the blanks’. Additional science to be conducted on the traverse may include
instrumenting the snowsailers to monitor their condition whist traversing
thousand of miles of ice and snow and additionally, monitoring surface friction
and snow density along the route.
Even more important
than the scientific data that he expects to collect, Adrian is enthusiastic
about the vehicle that the expedition offers as a means to entice students into
a career in Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics (STEM); that
being a scientist doesn’t have to mean wearing a lab coat, but can involve travelling
to anywhere in the world, gathering data that may otherwise be unobtainable,
unless combined with a little adventure…
Finally, with so many
families around the world affected by relatives and loved ones afflicted with Leukemia,
the opportunity to fly the flag in support of the Queensland Leukemia Foundation
and to assist in raising funds for ongoing Leukemia research is the primary factor
that drives Adrian and the three other team members to participate in this
ground-breaking polar expedition.

Jonathan Moody, Director of Greater West
Physiotherapy & Health Centres, with 7 Physio and massage centres in
Sydney's West. Recently I engaged myself into a life long commitment into
discovering my self imposed limits. After running a marathon in September 2013,
I remembered thinking- I wish it had broken me, but it didn't. I never thought
I would have ever run a marathon and came to realise that all limitations are
self imposed. Anything is possible.
So I started getting unrealistic on my
limits. Everest? Lhotse? Badlands Ultra Marathon? They now all seem reachable.
 You see, the beauty about testing your limits, is that you don't need a
reason. You just do it for the sake of living. Experiencing the lows makes the
highs all that much better.
In setting out to start, I knew I needed
like minded people to explore the impossible with. Then came Charles. An email,
a phone call, an antarctic expedition, raising money for Leukaemia. Now that
means a whole lot.
Currently exploring my passion of writing
feature films and moving into the film industry, I thought I could combine
these two and be the Director/Writer/Producer of a documentary on the
expedition. A life worth living is one worth recording.
All we had to do was to build our
snow sailers and raise our sponsorship.


We successfully launched the Polar Challenge at the
ORA trade show in Sydney and the Explore Australia show, both of these were
held at the end of June.
By the end of October we had trialled our snow sailers,
finalised our dates of departure, built the snow sailers, secured all of our
product sponsorship and started raising our Corporate sponsorship for the
individual snow sailers.
The thought then occurred instead of finding a Major
Naming Rights sponsor, which would detract from our overall goal, why not take
this out to the world and offer the opportunity to be a part of this unique
adventure to you.
So how you
can be a part of it.
Joining the Outer
Edge Polar Challenge and committing to donate/invest in this expedition and
this exciting journey isn’t just about getting more information as a follower.
It’s about having a genuine opportunity to participate in being involved in an
ground breaking expedition.
We have
established a number of levels of involvement ranging from $10 – $50 000.
So
enthusiasts – explorers or not - can participate in an adventure at the highest
level and have the chance to make a genuine contribution.
If you're
thinking of taking part in Outer Edge Polar Challenge, then don’t hang around
because your support will make a huge difference right now. 
Your
contribution will allow us to succeed in our aim and raise as much money as we
can by getting to Antarctica and achieving our goals. 
At the very least
share it with someone you know who will want to get involved. Getting our
message in front of as many people as possible is also important.
Get involved.
To become part of our team just choose your donation level and contribute.
Come join us
and become the heartbeat of the team.
How your money will be spent.
To date we
have funded the expedition through the generosity of our product sponsors, who
have come on board with product and cash, internally through the magazine Outer
Edge and now with the Corporate Funding of the individual snow sailers and the explorers.
The money we
raise now will go towards our flights from Australia to Antarctica and will
free us up to continue our preparation and fundraising.
What you get in return.
We would
like to reward you for your contribution and we have created various levels of
participation each with their own unique reward.
$10.00 –
download of our cardboard model of the snow sailer and 10% of your contribution
goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation.


$25.00 – 12 months
online subscription to Outer Edge mag plus a download of our cardboard model of
the snow sailer and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia
Foundation.


$50.00 –
Outer Edge Polar Challenge cap plus 12 months online subscription to Outer Edge
mag, download of our cardboard model of the snow sailer and 10% of your contribution
goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation.


$100.00 - Outer
Edge Polar Challenge T-Shirt and cap plus 12 months online subscription to
Outer Edge mag, download of our cardboard model of the snow sailer and 10% of
your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia
Foundation.


$250.00 –
signed copy of the Outer Edge Polar Challenge Book and DVD and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation.
$10 000.00 –
join us as a VIP guest at out farewell event on the 12 December 2014 in Brisbane.
Includes all flights and accommodation and 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation. Applies to Australian residents living
in Australia only. 
$50 000.00 –
have the opportunity to travel to Antarctica with us in either November 2015 / December
2015 or January 2016 and to snowsail a distance of 1500 km from 83 degrees to
the South Pole and back. Includes all training, flights, clothing, food, equipment,
accommodation and use of a snow sailer. 10% of your contribution goes direct to the Leukaemia Foundation
Risks & Challenges
The Outer Edge Polar Challenge team appreciates and
understands that the polar plateau – specifically the route to the  Pole of Inaccessibility is highly remote,
with a fragile and untouched environment that requires careful and considerate
management.
Furthermore, the team understands that the expedition
must be fully self-sufficient throughout the expedition and only able to access
last resort resources from The Antarctic Company (TAC) such as Search and
Rescue and supply drops in the event of an emergency. We accept that there is
an inherent risk with the proposed expedition to such a remote and potentially
hazardous environment and have created a comprehensive risk management plan to
handle this.
The Outer Edge Polar Challenge Team takes safety very
seriously and recognises the inherent risks involved in a polar journey. As
such we have developed a plan to minimise, mitigate and manage the risks
associated with the proposed expedition.
The team leader has an extensive level of experience in
outdoor guiding and adventure travel over a period of seven years on
unsupported expeditions to the some of the worlds’ most extreme and unforgiving
natural environments. The team leader will ensure that the entire team is
trained to the same standard of independence and self-reliance in the field. 
Team members are fit, well trained and
extremely capable outdoorsmen, capable of enduring long periods of inclement
conditions, and handling the severe cold conditions which can be expected on
the plateau.
This previous experience has built an
attitude and culture within the expedition team of cautious and well planned expeditioning. Whilst
we understand the inherent risks associated with the proposed expedition, we are committed
to intelligently managing the factors in our control as part of meticulously planning all aspects
of the expedition.
We will take a flexible approach to
the implementation of the expedition plan, assessing and taking into consideration weather conditions
and weather forecast, sastrugi, and team member’s condition on an ongoing basis, and
adapting our plans accordingly to ensure a safe and expeditious approach to the expedition.
This intelligent and calculated approach to
risk assessment and risk management has characterised the overall theme that we
wish to apply to the expedition for a low risk and maximum gain approach.
A full Risk Assessment and Management
Plan, which covers many of the conceivable risks and hazards that may be
encountered by the expedition has been formulated. Emergency Procedures have
been developed for a number of potential emergency situations, and are
documented in our Standard Operating Procedures.. In addition to these specific
risk mitigation activities and emergency procedures, the following more general
risk management strategies will also be employed;

The
expedition team consists of four (4) team members, who will stay as close as
possible to each other throughout the expedition. This allows for minimum
chance of losing one another in reduced visibility conditions and minimum
response times for an emergency.
The
team will spend 4 days acclimating to the conditions and equipment at Novo
before setting off on the journey. This will ensure a maximum chance of success
in being able to diagnose any last remaining equipment issues.
A
decision will be made at the geographic South Pole whether the team members
feel comfortable attempting the will return directly to Novo as per the route
plan.
In
the case of a medical problem or accident requiring evacuation or support not
available from the expedition team, TAC will be contacted by satellite phone
and arrangements made for the extraction of the affected team member/team.
In
a situation where TAC is not able to reach the expedition team to render
support and it is not an option to wait for the assistance. The team will haul,
sail and evac to an alternate location or support base.


I have
more questions. Who do I ask?Please
contact Charles Werb, Expedition Founder , on 0418 984
019 or email charles@outeredgepolarchallenge.com.au.

story:
Introducing ThirstBat

Designed to bring the best out of your game, the ThirstBat is a fully functioning bat. Its sleek design, mirroring that of the real deal, is made of durable yet lightweight, food grade plastic. The ThirstBat also features a sturdy grip at the handle, enabling that perfect swing or cover drive. 

The ThirstBat is so more than just a bat - it's a drinking vessel, perfect for holding and consuming your favourite cold beverage. Simply crack open your beverage using the in built bottle opener, and pour in your liquid goodness. The valve at the tip of the bat opens and closes to regulate the flow of the liquid. Position it to your mouth and smash that thirst! 

What sets ThirstBat apart is the custom designed valve, built in at the tip of the handle. With a simple twist to the left, the valve releases the liquid in a steady stream. Each bat also features a bottle opener. No teeth will be harmed in operating a ThirstBat!

The ThirstBat will be available in two formats. The slim barreled, baseball inspired ‘Chugger’holds up to 30 fl.oz (900 mL) of your favourite beverage. The wider faced, cricket bat ‘Slogger’holds up to 50 fl.oz (1500 mL). 

The guys behind ThirstBat

Torben is a classic kiwi innovator, intent on maxing life's enjoyment through the introduction of creative new products and services. His nine through five is dedicated to technical and manufacturing start-ups. Like all kiwis he is sport mad and enjoys nothing more than reflecting on a job well done with a cold beverage with friends.

Matt, hailing from the UK and who now calls New Zealand home, is a legend in the manufacturing and product design industry. He has enjoyed international success with his market leading Ozone Kites and impartial to a cold beverage and good times with mates, he brings the next level of enthusiasm to the ThirstBat team.

 
The initial concept
 

The concept of ThirstBat was dreamt up in anticipation of a friend's bachelor party. Two things are certain at a bachelor party – beer and healthy competition between mates – and product designer Torben wanted to bring these to the party in a new and novel way. 

The original ThirstBat was such a hit at the party that requests came in for its presence at other bachelor, university and summer parties. Good times are always had when a ThirstBat is involved, hence the will to share those good times with others all around the world. 

Why we need your backing

The ThirstBat is injection and blow molded to ensure clear passage for your favourite cold beverage. We’ve produced a number of one off samples, and as you can see we have smashed those hard! However in order to scale up ThirstBat and achieve economies of scale, we need to invest in the tooling that shape the custom ThirstBat molds. We want to keep manufacturing costs at a level that enables an affordable retail price point for you. 

Any pledge you make will help contribute to the tooling investment, minimum run size requirements and to taking the ThirstBat global.

Consumer testing

ThirstBat has undergone rigorous consumer testing. From the backyard in Raglan, rural New Zealand, to AT&T Park, home of the San Francisco Giants, and everywhere in between, people have smashed runs and their thirst, downing ThirstBats at pace.

On one of ThirstBats many consumer testing missions, this time to AT&T Park, San Francisco, Torben and Matt met James. Here is what he had to say about the ThirstBat a.k.a. "heaven on earth".  

 

The fine print.           

At ThirstBat, we know how much fun can be had over a few beers. But we're also mindful of the risks - heavy drinking can lead to illness, injury, or something much worse.

When using ThirstBat, you must always take care to drink responsibly. Never drink more than you can handle, and always stay safe when you are under the influence of alcohol. We do not promote binge drinking in any way, shape or form.

All of our products are meant for recreational use and do not require the consumption of alcohol in order to function. A thirst can be suitably smashed with simply ice cold water or a sports drink! We are therefore in no way responsible for any over-consumption of alcohol while using ThirstBat. Anyone consuming alcohol with a ThirstBat does so with the understanding that he or she is solely responsible for the amount consumed, and does so at his or her own risk.

Also, don't ever consume spirits via a ThirstBat! The alcohol content of spirits is far higher than that of beer. There's a reason for why we don't call it a vodka bong!

Find us on social media @Thirstbat

Risks and challenges

Every effort has been undertaken to ensure the ThirstBat will scale up and function effectively. The process of successfully scaling up a backyard innovation comes with some challenges, however these are considered minor and have been mitigated as per below.

1. Manufacturing - we have consulted some of the best blow and injection molding companies in the world to help us bring the ThirstBat to life and to you at an affordable price. We have deliberately chosen to manufacture our first batch of ThirstBats close to home in Hamilton, New Zealand. This way we can directly reside over the manufacturing process, undertake quality checks, and make any required amendments in process. We can confirm that manufacturing has started.

2. Design - we have worked with top notch design engineers to perfect the ThirstBat designs though an iterative process. We've produced a number of one off samples, and as mentioned, smashed those hard, refining the product as we go. We are confident that the design will deliver the desired functionality, both as a sports bat and a drinking vessel, and that it will look smashing too. Design patents and trademarks have been accepted or are under examination in the USA, UK / EU, Australia, New Zealand, Japan and India.

Transparency is key to the team at ThirstBat. If there's another potential issue you're wondering about, chances are, others are probably wondering it too! We'd appreciate it if you'd email any feedback / concerns to us at hello@thirstbat.com and we'll personally make sure a response gets to you.

If you would like to see ThirstBat transform backyards, park and beach fun around the world, as much as we would, then pick your reward level now and we look forward to making it happen with you.

Thanks for your support!

story:
About Antigua & Barbuda

Welcome to Antigua & Barbuda, the land of 365 beaches - that’s right...there is one beach for every day of the year for you to explore.  However, we want you to not only come for the sun, sand and beach, we invite you to explore and enjoy our rich culture in food which has been influenced by the culinary traditions of Europe, Africa, Asia and the Americas

About the Villas at Sunset Lane

A 10-room boutique hotel nestled beautifully on a hillside surrounded by the richest of colors and natural fauna you will find your home away from home – the Award-winning Villas at Sunset Lane.  Guests will enjoy a peaceful, intimate and relaxing experience. From your balcony, you have breathtaking views of the turquoise Caribbean Sea.   

What is Sunset, Sip & Savour

Sunset, Sip & Savour has allowed for the creation of our signature dishes by combining Caribbean dishes with international techniques to create some of the most delicious dishes served to our guests and visitors.  Our style of cooking which is called “Caribbean-Fusion”, has attracted lots of attention worldwide through our Culinary Day tours to the cruise ship passengers.

Guest participate in cooking Antigua & Barbuda’s national dishes, tasting then sitting for a shared lunch over lots of conversations and laughter. This culinary tour is such an ice-breaker as one sees how perfect strangers from all over the world on arrival become bonded through the shared experience.

What We Want to Do?

These wonderful experiences over the years have now given us the confidence to expand our offerings to a wider audience like you, home cooks, food connoisseurs and other visitors.

We would like to achieve the ultimate dream of spreading our Caribbean Culture throughout the world through cooking. We want to show you and our visitors the simplicity of our techniques and how to use locally-grown foods in preparing the most delicious healthy dishes. To accomplish this, we would like to convert our professional kitchen into a culinary studio to introduce Sunset Sip & Savour as a culinary vacation package.

 

Why We Need Your Help?

With your support, Sunset, Sip & Savour can become the leading cultural and authentic culinary experience that you, our guests or anyone can enjoy whether staying with us or tuning in via our live webinar cooking demonstrations.  The upgrade will allow for:

  • Guests to be truly immersed in a Caribbean kitchen experience
  • Guests to enjoy memorable and fun-filled events 
  • Authentic cultural guest exchanges

 

The Perks:-)!

And best of all, you our supporters will enjoy unique opportunities to experience what The Villas at Sunset Lane – Sunset Sip & Savour has to offer.  From recipes that will let you experience a taste Antigua & Barbuda and the Caribbean as a whole wherever you are, plus some of the lowest prices on stays that we will ever offer.  

To learn more about each perk scroll through the list on the right of your screen.  To claim click "Get This Perk" and follow the on-screen instructions.

Thank you for your support and time and we look forward to welcoming you to The Villas at Sunset Lane very soon.

 

Guest Reviews from TripAdvisor

story:
Banale began with a simple idea: in our busy life, there are a lot of ordinary products that potentially have great utility, but suffer from low dignity. Our mission is to innovate these products and get them closer to the people. The company was founded in 2014, and now is a team of 11 passionate people.

 The friendly and informal atmosphere that we have built at Banale headquarter, located in Milan, allowed us to launch and bring to the market 8 innovative products, and design many more, while still having fun.

That's why we feel proud and lucky.

Strategy and Performance by Tross

water resistant
 
compact

power napping has never been so comfortable

story:
Buy RideAir Today on Indiegogo Marketplace

We've shipped all pre-orders! 

 

 

RideAir is the perfect solution for your bike's daily air pressure maintenance and sudden flats that always catch you off guard! 

 

Using compressed air and high-quality mechanisms, RideAir makes tire inflation a much simpler and quicker task by allowing urban cyclist to inflate their tires on-the-go, in literally seconds. Unlimited Refills Included!

THE PROBLEM

 

 

 THE SOLUTION

 

 

 

 

Of course, RideAir has other great applications like helping you inflate lots of other stuff, too.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

  • GET READY - Fill Your RideAir: Simply inflate the RideAir through its 'Inlet Valve' using any air-compressor out there (gas stations, bicycle shops, in house air compressors, etc.). Once it's fully inflated, the RideAir is all set and ready to go! 
  • GET SET - Carry It on Your Bike: The RideAir is equipped with a built-in 'Metal Cable Lock' and protected with a combination lock, that secures RideAirto your bicycle wherever you go. You can even use it to quickly lock-up your bike when at pit-stops. The RideAir is weighing just around a pound. 
  •  INFLATE! - Quickly and Easily Inflate Your Tire: When low air-pressure is encountered, whether from natural seepage or from a small puncture, simply connect the RideAir 'Inflation Tube' to your tire's inlet valve and quickly press the 'Inflation Button'. That's all. In a few seconds you're good to go! TheRideAir's 'PSI Gauge' will let you know exactly how much air is remaining in the capsule so that you can prepare in advance for the next use.

 

 

 

 

When used for regular maintenance of your tire's air pressure, a fully chargedRideAir could provide air requirements for more than a year without needing a refill! 

 

 

AIR TANK CAPACITY

The RideAir Can be filled with up to 300psi! It’s not likely that your local air compressor will go up to such a high psi so when it’s time to refill the RideAir set the compressor to the highest psi it will allow to put the most air in the tank, so you can fill more tire on the go...

 

 

MEASUREMENTS

The RideAir is designed to perfectly fit any bicycle bottle holder in the market, and it's weighing just around a pound so you can carry it with you as you go!

 

 

 

PRODUCT DESIGN

The RideAir is made of top of the line, lightweight materials for a long-lasting, waterproof and anti corrosive design.

 

 

 

  • Combination Lock: RideAir has a built-in lock (4 feet long) with a combination-code, especially to keep your RideAir safely attached to your bike.
  • PSI Gauge: The RideAir is equipped with a PSI gauge that displays the current air-pressure in the RideAir Tank. That way you can always keep track of when a refill for your RideAir is required!

THE BENEFITS

 

 

Think of RideAir as the new inflation option on the block. From now on you have a new choice that offers a quick and easy solution for tire inflation that fits right in your hand or neatly on your bike...

 

 

 

 

 

 

RideAir For Wheelchair Tires

 

 

Help us reach our first stretch goal by sharing RideAir's Kickstarter campaign with your friends and family! Simply click on any of the buttons below and let the magic happen so everyone could enjoy a colorful RideAir: 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

About Us

We at DesignAir Innovations have set a goal to simplify the life of cyclists around the world. With RideAir we can all stop wasting our time and energy on basic bicycle maintenance, and begin a new riding experience. Our company is built on enthusiastic young entrepreneurs who simply wish to fulfill their innovative vision with the support an encouragement of the crowd. We admire your help with this venture and hope for a long and fruitful relationship with our riders community!

 

 

Thanks for your support! 

We really appreciate your help with this product...

The RideAir Team

 

Risks and challenges

We need to raise the funds to establish production, buy tooling and equipment and place bulk orders for the materials. 
Shipping options have already been checked out and most of the arrangements have been confirmed.

We’re already building a strong customer support network for the Kickstarter campaign. We’re not leaving anything to chance!

We have chosen a leading design company, with vast experience in turnkey projects such as ours that will be able to take us all the way from concept to full production.

The only real risks involved are manufacturing delays due to machine scheduling conflicts or errors. Supporters will be updated about delays in a timely manner.

FAQ

 

What type of valves can it inflate?

The RideAir is suitable for both types of valves (Presta as well as Schrader). In addition, you can use the RideAir with a ball inflating pump needle adapter in order to inflate basketball, football and etc.

What is the max PSI the RideAir can hold?

The RideAir can hold high pressure. The actual pressure that the RideAir will hold really depends on the air compressor that you will use in order to inflate the RideAir. From our experience the common air compressors outputs 145 PSI. We designed the RideAir to hold a much higher pressure though.

How many tires can a fully compressed RideAir inflate?

a. There are two main variables that will determine that number: Tire size and width. 
b. There are two main scenarios that a cyclists usually encounter: (1) Reduced air pressure due to unused bike for couple of weeks. (2) Slow leakage of air due to puncture that will eventually cause a flat tire. In these cases, we need an emergency, highly pressured, inflation, so we could reach our final destination (return home safely, get on time to class or work, and even arrive less sweaty to a romantic date). The RideAir will help you manage both situations. 
For the number of Full tires the RideAir can provide, see table above.

What is the RideAir’s weight?

Around 1 pound, just like a full bicycle water bottle.

Is there a backup in case the pump loses air from that last time it was filled?

We designed the RideAir to keep the air inside the tank, without any leaks. The only thing that might affect the pressure inside the RideAir is the ambient temperature changes.

What’s the size of the RideAir?

The size of the RideAir is similar to a personal water bottle you're familiar with. 
For the exact measurements see drawing above.

How can it be attached to my bicycle?

The RideAir is designed to fit any common water bottle holder. 
In case you don't have one, or need another, you can pledge for our "RIDER PACK"

How can I keep it safe when I’m not next to my bicycle?

The RideAir a built-in combination lock with 4 feet metal cable. 
You can lock the RideAir to your bicycle's frame. Moreover, the cable is long enough to lock the bike to a small pole. No extra key is required.

The main idea behind this lock is to secure the RideAir to the bike when you are around the bike or maybe just stopped shortly a a pit stop. This way you can carry everywhere you go with a peace of mind.

How do I refill it?

You can use any air compressor out there! Simply adjust the air compressor to its maximum pressure (most air compressors could reach around 145 PSI or more), connect the compressor outlet tube to the RideAir's inlet valve and fill it up in seconds. It's that simple :)

How much time it takes to inflate a tire using the RideAir?

Literally – 2 seconds.

What’s the average time it takes to inflate a tire using a regular manual air pump?

From our experience, usually it takes between 5 minutes to a lot more. 
It really depends on your energy, muscles and motivation...

What are the benefits of the RideAir for urban cyclists?

There are many advantages: 
a. Zero maintenance effort 
b. Time saving 
c. Refillable 
d. Eco-friendly 
e. User-friendly 
f. Will keep you neat and clean 
g. Portable and easy to carry around 
h. Beautifully designed :)

Who is the main target audience for RideAir?

a. Basically, every biker! 
b. Urban cyclists 
c. E-bikers 
d. Tubeless Tires Bikes

e. Scooter riders 
f. Parents who care about their children safety 
g. lazy people like most of us 
h. Lefties and clumsy people 
i. Commuters

story:
Once upon a sunny but windy day...

My name is Mike Bianchi and this idea came to me while on vacation with my wife.  With 3 kids at home we wanted to maximize our precious time away.  Wanting the most enjoyment, in the shortest amount of time, we decided to go to the beach on a 60+ degree sunny day.  The problem was that at the beach the wind was blowing too hard and it ruined our chances to enjoy a sunny day.

I then noticed the hotel had some beach chairs on their side protecting from the wind, and that’s where the idea came from.  As we flew home, I started to think about all the uses a wind screen would have.  For example, I value my alone time with my wife and it’s hard on a crowded beach but this screen would section space for us.  I could use less of my family complaining that “the sand is blowing on me, my towel keeps blowing, this is so annoying I'm trying to read, and I can’t hold the pages down.”  We love camping and fires, but it can get frustrating fast when there is a strong wind and everyone is depending on you to keep warm, and to cook food.

The WINDSHEELD

It’s a beautiful sunny day and the family wants to go to the beach but it’s too windy? You’re enjoying time camping but the wind is blowing everything around?

Enter the WINDSHEELD. Use the world’s most durable wind barrier to relax with your family, and get peace of mind by blocking the wind elements from your area while at the beach or camping. This versatile, easy to use, retractable screen, is ideal for outdoor enthusiasts looking for privacy or sectioning an area for children or pets.  Built from cast aluminum and high grade nylon this portable solution is the both light-weight, tough, and easy to pack.

WINDSHEELD highlights:

  • Outdoors screen fence
  • Versatile for beach or camping
  • Privacy and sectioning divider 
  • Simple, easy to use and stow
  • Customizable with different colors, design, and corporate logos

Benefits for parents:


1.  Keep your young or pets safe and protected with this sectioning solution.
2.  Extend the seasons by blocking some of that wind on sunny days
3.  Avoid getting full of sand or having your stuff blow away from the wind
 

 

 

 

Product Specs., Diagrams and Sample Pictures:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Life is tough enough without having to be frustrated while enjoying your vacation time no matter where you are, and having a little help blocking the elements makes for a more enjoyable experience for the family.  It’s an obvious solution to an obvious problem. I would love to know down the road that I helped increase enjoyment and valuable time no matter where people choose to go. In addition, if I can provide solely for my family and my wife can be at home with the kids as she had always imagined that would make it all worth it.
 

THE ASK:

We need to secure $140,000 to get the manufacturing of this brand new product going.  We are reaching to all our families and friends for their support, but we need your support as well.  Please contribute the amount of your preference.  One hundred, one thousand, everything counts towards achieving our goal.  We have a few perks on the right hand column for you to consider, but we only have a few months to hit our crowdfunding goal.  Would you help, please? 

Timeline:

Testimonials from our Focus Groups:

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute to this campaign we ask that you please share this link with your networks today!  It's very easy, just click on these buttons below and share on your social media and Pinterest platforms.

THANK YOU!!

story:
Why Scotland? Why Now?

Scotland is known by many things: The beauty of its land, the mystery of the Loch Ness Monster, its culture, kilts, a famous drink known as scotch, and its Christian history. One thing that a lot of us don’t know is the current state of Christianity in Scotland. Scotland is currently on a decline in the area of Christianity. In 2001, 49% of people claimed to be part of the Protestant faith. On the other hand 27% of people claimed no religion at all. Fast forward to 2009/10, the number of those claiming no religion grew to 40% and those claiming to be of the Protestant faith fell to 41%. In 2011, the Scottish Social Attitudes Survey was released showing this: 51% of the population claimed no faith and those who are of the Protestant faith is around 32% now. 

Why start my letter out with this information? Why the information overload? Well I want to give you a clear picture of why I’m writing this letter. Scotland is in a downward spiral, a crisis if you will. The Church has sounded the alarm and is focused on reaching the people who are becoming more secular year by year. The church is fighting against gang violence, poverty, and secularism and they desperately need the help of those around the world.

How To Partner & Help!

There is currently an organization by the name of 20 Schemes, which is focused on planting 20 gospel centered churches in places known as Schemes; Schemes are government housing complexes (read projects) in Scotland. They firmly believe that true mercy ministry is to preach the gospel to those who have never heard it. They feel that all the gang violence and poverty is in direct relationship to the numbers I gave above. When the good news is cast aside and isn’t preached, the people will suffer. And this is why I have decided through much prayer to come alongside 20 Schemes.

I have been pursuing a position with 20 Schemes for the past 6 months and I have interviewed with them and was invited to a Vision Trip in Scotland in September of this year. This trip will determine if I spend the next two years in Scotland planting a church in one of Scotland’s poorest Schemes. This is why I’m writing; I wish to ask you to come alongside me and help reach Scotland’s poorest with the Good News of Christ Jesus. I’m currently attempting to raise $2500.00 to go to Scotland for this Vision Trip which will give me the opportunity to see these Schemes first hand and get closer to partnering in the mission of reaching the lost. 

All financial support is greatly appreciated.

Also, please spend time in prayer for Scotland, the church, and myself. The mission is a difficult one and we need brothers and sisters behind us praying for the lost to hear the truth with open hearts. If you wish to receive updates regarding my progress please continue to check in here. I cannot do this without the support and partnership of those God has placed around me. Thank you all for reading this long letter, lets reach the world together!

 

In Christ,

David McPhearson

 

What Will The Money Go Towards?

  • Travel to/from Scotland: I will be flying from the United States to Scotland September 5th. Tickets average around $1200 USD and up. Airfare may become more costly the closer I get to the date I'm leaving.
  • Travel in Scotland: I will most likely be visiting 3 cities while in Scotland (Edinburgh, Glasgow, and Dundee) to get a broad view of what different types of Schemes in Scotland. Travel will be by train.
  • Room and Board while in the country.
  • All extra funds outside of these costs will be given directly to 20Schemes in support of planting the next church!

What If Goal Isn't Reached?

If the goal of $2500 isn't reached, the money will still go towards offsetting costs for travel, room, & board. I will still honor all perks as well.

The Impact

If everything goes according to plan, I will be spending the next 2 years in Scotland assisting in planting/revitalizing a local church. This has the opportunity to bring the Word of God to thousands who are poor and stuck in a life of sin and bondage. Help us fulfill the great commission!

Other Ways You Can Help!

Pray and Share! This is the some of the best help I can get. I need people getting the word out about 20Schemes and what they are attempting to accomplish.

story:
Hi all! Do you know what do you need most when you have a beer in hand? A bottle opener :D. Here we have colorful credit card sized bottle openers which you can carry in your wallet and use it anytime you need. Now can make "open bottle" happier by add more color to it. We will also give out ring bottle openers to make the action cooler.

What We Need & What You Get

We need some fund to make the opener and put them to market. We have already make prototypes, now is the time to make it real with your support. You will get a credit card size bottle opener(pick one of 7 color you want) and I will add a ring opener for you(black/silver)

SPEC

The card size open is 3.35" x 2.16" x 0.059"/86mm × 55mm ×1.5mm in size
 with 7 color

They are same size as credit card. Easy to carry and never forget.

Special thanks

story:
HELP SFVJRD’S FAST TIMES GET TO JRDA CHAMPIONSHIPS


The SFV Junior Roller Derby League (SFVJRD) is an all-volunteer based organization and the only flat-track junior derby league in the greater city of Los Angeles. The Fast Times travel team features the leagues most talented and dedicated skaters. We train 3 times a week, and have played against numerous cities across the U.S. since 2011.  We've consistently ranked in the top 5 junior teams in the world!

The league was founded in 2011 by Killo Kitty and Coach Dad, who have 3 daughters that were already participating in roller derby. Our mission is to offer girls ages 7-17,  a recreational sport to improve fitness, athleticism, and learn to work in committees and with other league members. Girls in Junior Derby have a safe, fun, and supportive environment to learn the popular sport of roller derby.  


This is the first year of Junior Roller Derby Association’s Championships and the team has been working hard and looking forward to the competition against 16 teams and taking back the #1 spot from Seattle’s I-5.   At the same time, Junior Rollercon will also be taking place, allowing the girls to learn from top trainers and coaches to take their skills to the next level. Now, in order to get there, we need your support!

The Gist 

In order to get our whole team (that's 15 skaters and 3 coaches) all the way from Los Angeles to Daytona Beach, FL for the JRDA Championships we have to fly. Airfare is the biggest chunk of our budget at $770 a person. This is where you can help.

We need your support in getting us to Daytona Beach so we can take back our #1 spot. We're asking for $20,000 to offset our huge airfare, transportation and accommodation costs for 5 days in Florida. 

               


SFV Juniors are a diverse group of girls from all economic backgrounds.  As a league committed to developing strength and confidence in young girls, no girl is turned away and loaner equipment is provided while girls learn to skate and play.  The cost to travel to Florida is a financial hardship for most of our families, but our girls are passionate about getting to Florida and will be doing everything they can to raise the money needed to get there.

Donate any amount. Whether it’s $5 or $100, all money raised will go toward getting our team, Fast Times, to Florida for the Championships. Every donor will get a shout out on our website and Facebook Page to show our appreciation.  Donors of $25 or more will receive a premium – from a SFV Roller Derby Sticker up to a pizza party at our place with us!  Any money we raise over our goal will be used toward future travel. (We’ll be heading to Denver, CO in September.)


    Every Dollar Counts

    The Fast Times team has already traveled to Seattle, WA and Detroit, Michigan, among other cities. Travel costs add up quickly, especially when added to the the price of uniforms and gear. Just a set of wheels can run $50 or more and those are replaced a couple of times a year at minimum.  So, even the smallest donations will help ease the burden and get us to Daytona Beach, FL.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    We appreciate all donations, no matter how small, but if you're not able to contribute monetarily, you still can help out in a big way. 

    Follow Us

    By clicking the "Follow" button above, you can keep up with our latest news and progress on meeting our goal.

    Social Media

    Sharing this campaign on social media can help us reach even more roller derby fans and get us to our goal. You can use the buttons above for easy sharing to any social network. You can also support Fast Times by coming out to our bouts or by becoming a league volunteer. 

    Share your love of Roller Derby and tell a friend!

story:
How awesome would it be to clean up at the park or beach and rinse off the kids or dogs before they get in the car? That’s exactly why we created RinseKit, its like having a hose to go! RinseKit is the only portable shower to have the pressure of a garden hose without pumping or batteries.

Now with your help, very soon it will also be the ONLY pressurized shower to have a battery-powered heater system that quickly and safely heats water to 100°F - A hot shower anywhere with the flip of a switch! 

The RinseKit's patented design simply stores the water pressure from your home for later use. As the water pressure from your hose spigot enters the RinseKit, it compresses the air in the chamber. When you close the valve, that pressure is trapped in the RinseKit and acts like a spring to force the water through the hose and out of the nozzle.


RinseKit’s patented design can hold the same pressure as a garden hose (55-75 psi) for over a month. When in use, RinseKit can spray for over 5 minutes depending on the nozzle setting.

RinseKits are BPA-free, so they are safe to drink from and you can use its water for cleaning up after cookouts. There are also no moving parts and RinseKit is made of extremely tough virgin PE and ABS plastics. Additionally, RinseKit is made from materials that will not rust, so you don't have to worry about corrosion. it’s extremely durable.      

RinseKit has six sprayer nozzle settings and a 6 foot long hose. The detachable lid also acts as a standing pad to rinse off dirty or sandy feet, a cutting board with inch marks for measuring fish and a handy seat. RinseKit can also store wet swimsuits, sunscreen and more under the lid.          

Whether you’re cleaning up after hiking, surfing or work, just need to rinse your car or remotely water plants, RinseKit is like having a hose-to-go!

  • Now you can wash your dog with warm water!

  • Rinse off little feet after a day on the beach with the family

  • Clean up after a lunchtime workout so you’re ready for work 

  • Wash the car without the restrictions of a stationary hose

  • Use while camping as a shower, to rinse off dishes or put out campfires

  • And much more… 

*Note: bike pump is not included 

 

US & International patents and patents pending 

2102.0002-USDP-6   / 002637991-0001  /  30-2015-0008899

story:
The Ultimate Ride

100 days in Europe, cycling between 21 countries to learn from 10 of the most elite European Ultimate Frisbee teams.

100 days in China, cycling between 14 cities to teach what I learned to 22 of the fastest-developing Chinese Ultimate Frisbee teams and spread the Spirit of the Game!

This is the Ultimate Ride. This is my dream. 

(Those in China can check out my video on Youku here.)

What is the Ultimate Ride?

June 18 to September 25, 2014: Part 1 -- Ultimate Ride in Europe

Ultimate Ride in Europe has four main objectives:

  1. Bike across 21 countries in Europe in 100 days, starting from Brest, Belarus and ending in Berlin. 
  2. Visit at least 10 of the top European Ultimate Frisbee clubs, join their practices and learn from them.
  3. Produce a documentary of this trip.
  4. Raise awareness for two charities to help those less fortunate: the Youth Ultimate Project and Mentor project for orphan kids in Belarus.

From March 1, 2015 to June 10, 2015: Part 2 – Ultimate Ride in China

After Europe, I will return to China and bike another 100 days, visiting as many Chinese Ultimate teams as possible to share what I have learned. Ultimate Ride in China has four main objectives:

  1. Bike across 13 provinces in China, stopping in at least 14 cities.
  2. Visit at least 22 of the fastest-developing Chinese Ultimate Frisbee teams and provide clinics for them.
  3. Spread Spirit of the Game across China and promote Ultimate Frisbee via clinics, talks, media exposure and social networks.
  4. Found new Ultimate Frisbee communities by leveraging media coverage.

The Ultimate Ride combines three of my passions in life -- Ultimate Frisbee, cycling and outdoor sports -- in a way that would benefit and add value to society.

Why I Need Your Support

I will be biking alone during this trip, but doing so will be arduous and lonely, In order to complete this journey, I need your support. I am only seeking enough funding to cover food and accommodation during the combined 200 days of biking across Europe and China. I plan on traveling on a shoestring budget, but the following expenses are unavoidable:

  1. An average of 30USD per day in Europe for food and camping or staying at a hostel, for a total of about 3,000USD over 100 days.
  2. An average of 20USD per day in China for food and lodging, for a total of about 2,000USD over 100 days.

All money exceeding my goal of 5,000USD will be donated to my two charities of choice: Youth Ultimate Project and Mentor project for orphan kids in Belarus.

I am seeking corporate sponsors for my bike, film equipment, flights between Europe and China, visa fees, insurance, vaccinations, etc. I will pay for these myself if I have to. 

Impact

Confucius once said, "While one's parents are alive, one should not travel to distant places." Growing up in a small town in China, I, like many friends around me, was brought up with fewer opportunities and approval to explore beyond. Unlike what is customary for many students and those in their 20s in the West, the Chinese education system and society is more conservative and does not actively encourage adventure, travel and participation in sports and outdoor activities. I hope my tour will inspire a new generation of jet-setting Chinese youth and help everyone appreciate the outdoors. But the greatest impact I anticipate will be on the development of Ultimate Frisbee, the sport I love.

Compared to many other “traditional” sports such as basketball, soccer and volleyball, disc sports in China are still in their infancy. I believe more Chinese participation will be beneficial to Ultimate Frisbee, especially in the sport’s efforts to be recognized as an Olympic event. I hope Ultimate Ride will help bring Ultimate Frisbee to the attention of aspiring Chinese athletes. During my trip across the country, I plan to visit several universities and high schools, some of which are sports schools; the sport has been growing fastest among players among this age group. 

I am certain my program will also encourage the founding of new Ultimate Frisbee communities in China. I will seize any speaking opportunities to spread the sport of Ultimate and helping those interested in starting new teams. I can build bridges by connecting new teams to existing Chinese teams near them, and help them to get the needed resources and think about how to be sustainable over the long run.

I already have experience doing this. Six years ago I founded the CUG Ultimate Team at the China University of Geosciences, and for the first time in our team’s history, we were crowned champions at the 7th annual China Nationals held May 17-18, 2014, in Changzhou, Jiangsu province. Many players cried tears of joy. Our second team broke seed and finished tied for fifth place.

Due to the unusual nature of my biking tour, Chinese media will likely cover my trip in print and television, giving our beloved sport lots of media exposure. I have already liaised with a publishing house that is willing to publish a book of my tour, which I believe will generate further attention for Ultimate.

One day in the future, I would love to see Ultimate Frisbee be recognized as a global sport among the Chinese. I want the Ultimate Ride to be an important step to helping realize this dream.

Ultimate Frisbee clinic at Shenzhen Foreign Language School

Presentation about Ultimate Frisbee at Wuhan Foreign Language School

Speaking about Ultimate Frisbee in Zhongnan University of Economics and Law

Presentation of Ultimate Frisbee in China University of Geosciences

Ultimate Frisbee clinics in Minsk, Belarus

Ways to Contribute

1. BACK THIS PROJECT. Every dollar matters! This trip will take the next 1 year of my life, and I can not do this without your financial support.  

2. SHARE THIS WITH THE WORLD.  Show your friends, family, and coworkers the face of someone who is following their dream!  

3. HOSPITALITY.  Let me know if you or a friend can support me with a bed, a kitchen, a shower or good company along the way. Any free meals or accommodation is a few dollars saved which will all be contributed back to spread my love of Ultimate Frisbee.

Connect and Share

Follow my updates at: www.ibikeworld.net

Share my facebook page at: www.facebook.com/ivan.jiangjun

Email be at: ibikeworld@gmail.com

Final Word

I am excited to chase this longtime dream of combining my passions: biking and Ultimate Frisbee. Mostly, I cannot wait to take Chinese Ultimate Frisbee to the next level! Thank you for being a part of my life. You will not only be supporting me, but also the belief that with dedication and hard work, anyone can achieve a seemingly impossible goal. 

Thank you very much! 

Ivan Xu

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ricardo Sanoja, I go by Antonio, and I am trying to become an Eagle Scout. But to do so, I need to first complete an Eagle Project, what this means is that I have to raise money and lead a group of people on some kind of, well, project that in some way helps the community. I have chosen to create an information board for a wildlife reserve/outdoor classroom, set on land set aside by the local General Motors plant and approved by the city of Arlington as an official wildlife habitat. 

What We Need

The $850 asked covers all of the cost of materials, the most costly being a corkboard, plexiglass, locked bulletin board that's going to be installed into the sign ($440). But it also covers the wooden beams needed to support the sign ($95), the concrete that will keep it in the ground ($10), roofing to keep the sign dry ($60), special 8' screws ($1.50 each), wood stain ($8), paint ($21), printing maps, and a 10% overhead in the unlikely case that something goes wrong.

The Impact

This habitat doesn't have much yet, and needs some help establishing itself as a wildlife habitat where people can go to observe nature as it intermingles with industrialism. So I'd like to help them, I'd like to help make their little park more official and give it the potential to do more with itself, an information board allows people to better understand what the place is, it allows General Motors to spread news to the park's patrons and it allows them to begin holding events there through the spread of information.

Risks & Challenges

After the project is funded comes the issue of buying the equipment and assembling the thing comes into play, and although unlikely since we have a couple people experienced in wood construction, the possibility of mistakes happening does exist, if any of the materials break during construction then they'll need to be replaced, if a miscalculation was made and we need more of a certain material then we'll have to purchase it, but aside from a 10% overhead added to total cost in case of such events, if these things do happen they will be paid for out of pocket.

Other Ways You Can Help

This crowdfunding doesn't require a whole lot of money but it doesn't have a whole lot of time either. Any and all amount helps, and if you could share the project it would help a lot. Thanks for your attention, and all your help.

story:
Taskin is a young, San Francisco-based startup and there is nothing we love more than create amazing travel gear. We are super amped to introduce you to our latest creation!  

You need a stylish, professional bag to take to work. This weekend, you need to fly to Dallas for your kid bother’s wedding, so you need a slightly larger backpack for your clothes and the gift (don’t forget the gift). Next up is your big vacay in Hawaii, so you need an even larger backpack for your all the stuff you’re bringing, and everything you’ll want to bring home.

Sure, you could get three different backpacks. Or you could just one: The Taskin ONE 9-in-1 business and travel backpack. 

 

Taskin design principles are anchored in combining style and quality with innovative function. And the Taskin ONE delivers on all 3 of these fundamentals in spades. 

 

3 sizes x 3 configurations = 9 practical variations for infinite possibilities. Each variation is designed to meet a specific, real-world use case. Spoiler alert: It’s also far more practical than buying a different bag for each. Especially when you get it all with Taskin quality and style.

 

 

Carry-on Like Packing 

 But you can fit a lot more while staying far more organized. 

 

Pop-in/Pop-out Backpack Straps

 Extra wide backpack straps with honeycomb padding that can be neatly hidden behind butterfly flaps, what more can you ask for!

 

 

TSA Friendly Laptop Sleeve

TSA/Checkpoint friendly 180° lay flat design allows you to breeze through airport security.. well at least compared to the others. 

 

 

Organization

Bet the Taskin One has more organization options then all the backpacks you own combined :).  Just having more pockets is obviously not enough, so we put in a lot of thought and experimentation into designing the most optimal configuration that will get you the most use out of these pockets. 

4-Point, Self-Balancing Shoulder Straps

Extra wide shoulder straps that with honeycomb mesh padding featuring our unique self balancing 4 point anchor system. No matter how you like to wear your shoulder bag the straps will re-balance to keep your bag in a comfortable-balanced position.

 

Stove-away Water Bottle Pockets

Now you see it, now you don't. A neat hideable mesh water bottom pocket when you need one. 

 

Carry-on Attachment

Lugging around a carry-on, well then let it do the heavy lifting with this special carry-on attachment, which secures the One to most standard carry-on handles. 

 

Easy-hide Compression Straps

Compression straps that hidden when not in use. Also doubles as an attachment to pretty much anything bulky, like a tripod stands.

 

 

Adjustable Sternum Straps

Easily adjustable sternum straps ensure maximum comfort, not matter how big or small you chest size.

 

Sunglass Pocket w/ Velvet Lining

Velvet lined easy access pocket to store you sunglasses or other essentials.  

 

 

Waterproof External Zippers

Custom made easy-slide waterproof zippers to help keep the water out (while ONE is water resistant, it is not waterproof, no bag with stitches are) while being easier to pull open.

 

Adjustable Side Handles /w Magnetic Wraps

Magnetic wraps allow to easily separate the two ends as compared to pulling apart velcro, are a lot more durable as well.. and cooler. The length of the handles can be adjusted depending on the bags expansion level. 

 

Neoprene Cushioned Top Handle

The top handle is made of neoprene so it easy on your hands a stays clean. Neoprene is also very durable. 

 

Unisex Design

Will look great on you and your significant other, so make sure you get 2 of these beauties!  

We had a backpacker go on a 10 day trip to incredible New Zealand with just the ONE as his only bag. Was it a bit extreme, absolutely, but like they say, proof is in the pudding:

 

We have been there, done that 7 times now and we could not have done it without our amazing backers. Below is what our backers from our previous campaign had to say:

 

Back this campaign so you can be part of our next creation and get a great deal while doing so. Thank you!
